name: Patti Phelps
text: Kristina Parker is by far the best medical provider I've been to.  Was a little worried when we moved here to AL but got it perfect the first try.  She is compassionate, caring and let's you have all the time you need to address your medical issues. Love her!! And would recommend her to anyone who wants quality care.

resp.text: We strive for 100% satisfaction, and we love to hear about these positive experiences!

name: Kimberly Hood
text:
Friendly, professional, and the most caring staff.
Kristina goes above and beyond! Highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you; we appreciate your feedback!

name: David Pannell
text: Very satisfied with my appointment with Kristina. Seemed very attentive to my concerns. Asked plenty of questions to determine what was the the best action to be taken. Wanted me to call her back if I wasn’t getting better. Very professional and knowledgeable.

resp.text: Thank you; we appreciate your feedback!

name: Belinda Weaver
text: Always a pleasant experience there.  Every one is so nice & friendly. I love Kristina. She is very thorough & attentive to my needs. I would gladly recommend her & S.S. Medical to anyone needing a new physician

resp.text: We are so happy to read such a great review!

name: Lauren Nunn
text: I visited Kristina Parker, CRNP after having an issue with my eye. I had scratched my eyeball with my contacts and it was red, swollen, and painful. It was late in the afternoon on a Friday and the office was able to get me a quick appt at last minutes notice. Kristina was very quick to see me. I only had to wait a few minutes before she came right in and was very easy to talk to. She immediately assessed my eye and told me she would be right back after she made a few calls. She came back within minutes after calling around to every eye doctor nearby and told me that unfortunately they were all closed at the time. But she recommended for me to use antibiotic eye drops and to go to Callahan over the weekend if it was not better because they were the only 24 hr eye doctors. She was very detailed in telling me exactly what to do and she listened to every concern I had. I appreciated the fact that she had called around to try and reach out for help since it was an eye incident and she knew there was only so much she could do. I would 10/10 recommend Kristina Parker, CRNP as she was very thorough and very diligent in helping me. I will definitely be back to see her.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here!

name: Joshua Elijah
text: They were all very sweet and treated me with kindness but I waited 4 hours on blood work, so my mother had to rush me to ER to find because they never even sent my script in until maybe 2:30. My mother had already fitting me to ER by this point because I was in agonizing pain. My mother rushed me Gadsden Regional where they finally told me I have been diagnosed with cancer.  It just doesn’t make sense I’m a healthy person never even had an iv in my arm till now. I just feel like if southside med care could’ve acted a little quicker than maybe I wouldn’t be on the special care floor.

resp.text: We are always looking for ways to improve; we appreciate your input. If you would be willing, we would like to have you contact our manager at 256-442-4141 to discuss ways we can better serve you in the future.

I cannot recommend her or this practice any higher.

name: Michelle Mayo
text: Dr. Ligon is an amazing doctor and boss. She treats her patients as humans and not a pay check. She cares for every person that walks through that door. She listens to her patients and she does what they want done. She is open to alternatives other than just pushing medications. Switching to MDVip was the best thing she could do for her patients. She is able to have one on one time with them, take longer during each patients appointment. She gives each patient her personal phone number so that they can contact her directly. She cares for her patients and treats them as family. She is also very knowledgable in her studies and has treated many patients that had seen different doctors for many many years, and is able to find the problem in a short amount of time when other doctors couldn't find the cause of their issues. She is very knowledgable in hormone therapy as well.

name: Amber
text: I really liked Dr. Ligon. I switched my whole family over making her our Primary doctor with BCBS of AL almost a year ago. I have a pretty healthy family so one of my daughters and myself have never actually had to see her. One daughter has a monthly prescription we have to see a doctor to get refilled. We filled out ALL of our paperwork at the same time. Now that she is switching to this "MDVIP" program in September, they will not make an appointment for my other daughter to get a sports physical in less than a week because she will be considered a "new patient" unless I pay $1,800 to join the program (that doesn't start until September). This almost $2,000 for the year doesn't even cover everything, still have to maintain my insurance (almost $400 a month) to cover sick visits. Talk about not caring about your patients and being all about the benjamins. Now I will have to switch primary doctors and probably pay a fee to BCBS since it hasn't been a whole year yet.

name: Lisa Ray
text:
My first impression to the practice was Dr. Walker’s nurse (Brandy? Kelly? doesn't matter) who took me to get my vitals and the first thing she did was touch my stomach and ask “Is that a baby in there?”. It was not. I burst into tears for several reasons none being any of her business.
How unprofessional of her as a nurse and as a woman she should certainly know better. I should have walked out but it was my first and only visit and I had to have a PCP to get referrals to specialists. I asked to be seen by a different nurse but she said I was stuck with her. When Dr. Walker met me in the exam room and I told her what happened she apologized for the nurse’s actions but said she was sure her nurse was “just joking.” Seriously? I gave her my list of referrals and left.
On the drive home the Clinic Manager called me for a CYA apology but mainly sympathized with the nurse and started talking about her own infertility struggles that have zero to do with me and how I was treated. I have changed physicians. A truly unpleasant experience with the entire clinic. They were also somehow able to have my first review deleted instead of owning up to their actions.

When a physician hangs the phone up on you just because you didn’t agree with her it’s time to find another physician with little bit more respect and compassion. She’s Rude and very unprofessional. Just wanted to let you know without  patients there would be no Covington Healthcare please remember that. text: Sarah was absolutely wonderful! She was extremely thorough and informative. She treated our daughter with kindness during her immunizations. text: I have always been pleased with Sarah and her services but my husband ran out of his medicine in April.   He called to get them refilled.  Sarah was not there so they set him up a teladoc appt with another  NP  just to get the medicine called into the drug store.  He had just seen Sarah in October. They charged $120.00 just to get his medicine.  I called to ask about this and was hung up on 2 times.  I was told not to come back.  I was not trying to get out of paying , I just think $120.00 is a little  too much for a call to the drug store.

resp.text: Telemedicine visits are  billable. Call your insurance company to get an explanation when they don’t pay. After many thousands of dollars in tuition and continuing education, it is right to be able to charge for those services   This is  consistent with acceptable practices nationwide

name: Stella mullins
text: My mother has copd and heart issues and she can never get any help on the phone when she calls and when she finally does get someone named Patricia she is met with rude and dismissive behavior. I think my mother knows her condition better than whoever she is and she's not her physician. We will be in search of a better facility with more caring staff, if you don't like your job find another profession other than dealing with sick people.

resp.text: Hi Stella, we're very sorry that your mother did not have a great experience with our clinic. If you would like for us to follow up further, we kindly ask that you call the Patient Speak Up Line at 334-793-8720 during regular business hours. Some additional details would be helpful. Again, we apologize that your expectations were not met.

name: J Parish
text:
I have struggled chronic sinusitis for years and when I could not see my regular ENT I would  go here. Dr Paulk treated me for years then when he retired other doctors treated me, which have done a great job. Typically they would give me a shot, an antibiotic, something for congestion and by the afternoon I could breathing again; within about 12 to 14 days the infection would be gone. Well today, Saturday 30 Jan 2021, I went in with a severe sinus infection, like I had done before, and received no care, only advice.  I explained my history and my current symptoms to Dr Wood and she said “oh it is too early to give you anything, keep irrigating your sinuses and take Allegra.  If you are not better in 10 days  there will be an antibiotic ready at your pharmacy, but you will not be able to get the antibiotic until 10 days from today; let’s see if it will clear up on its own.”
So here I am at midnight, completely stopped up, my head feeling like it is about to explode, can’t sleep because a CPAP doesn’t work when you are all stopped up.  If you have to go to this clinic as a last resort, remember if you see Dr Wood you may not get any help.  I wasted time and money on this doctor visit.

resp.text: Hi, we're sorry that you did not have a great experience. If you would like for us to follow up on the comments you shared, we kindly ask that you call the Patient Speak Up Line at 334-793-8720 during regular business hours. Some additional details would be helpful. Again, we apologize that your expectations were not met.

name: Monkey Knut
text: I walked in today due to issues with my left knee. I could not have asked for better treatment. I was moved along at a good pace, each person I interacted with was professional and truly caring, and the place was clean. The visit exceeded my expectations. Thank you Westgate Clinic team for doing such a great job.

resp.text: Thank you for this very kind review. We’re pleased that you had a great experience.

text: Emma Middleton PA was great but, rude n lazy staff make you not want to go back .. dirty... if you don’t have any other place to go, it will do...

They even called to f/u on him later the following  day!

Mrs. Theresa was very coherent and professional and Dr. Pippin was competent and made me feel very comfortable. As far as doctors go if you use First med you are in very capable hands. Couldn't have been happier.

text: This supposed "walk in" clinic has started turning patients away 2 hours before they close. What a joke!

resp.text: Hi Jessica, we apologize that you did not have a great experience at our clinic. We’ll share your review with our clinic manager. Again, we apologize that your expectations were not met.

name: Brittney Pettis
text: I’ve been coming to First Med as a walk-in patient for a year. After my first time seeing Dr. Pippin and her nurse, Kelly, I decided to make Dr. Pippin my primary care doctor. She takes the time to read everything I put on my patient portal prior to my appointment so I didn’t have to worry about expressing my concerns in person. I love that she takes the time to do that as it ensures she’s totally aware of what’s going on with me and why I’m coming in. She also took the time to fully explain her course of treatment and why she thought it best for me. Dr. Pippin made sure I understood every aspect of what was going on the entire time. If you’re looking for a doctor and a nurse who truly care about your well being, I highly suggest Dr. Pippin and Nurse Kelly.

resp.text: That is a fantastic review and we appreciate the recommendation. Thank you! Were so pleased you had a great experience and we'll share this with our FirstMed Team.

text: Saw Dr. Cook this morning his bedside manner is impeccable he gave me an injection in my head no tears love him and his staff to pieces🥰 thank so much

text:
I have been a patient of Dr. Cook's for far to many years to count. He has always been very professional. He stays a d listens to what I have to say no matter how long I need to talk or shed a few tears being the pain i live in day to day.
The only problem i have is when i need refills on meds, someone will not call in to my pharmacist. It takes forever for this to get done.
Nevertheless, Dr. Cook will always remain my doctor until the day he retires.
Sheila

name: Marcey Nicholas
text: I was very pleased with the care I received at First Med. Thank you to the providers for their courtesy, caring behaviors and friendliness. I greatly appreciate your promptness and professionalism with the care you provided to my family member during our last visit. My experience here was one of the quickest and best we have encountered since living here in Dothan. I highly recommend a visit to First Med!

resp.text: Hi Ms. Nicholas, we appreciate the great review. We love to get positive feedback from our patients. We'll share this with our team and we are grateful you chose us for your care.

name: Donnie Pemberton
text: My experience at 1st Med has always been professional, timely, and friendly.  The doctors, nurses, and staff take the time to ensure your visit has exceeded expectations with prompt follow up.  I would recommend their services to anyone located in the Wiregrass.  Thanks!

resp.text: Thanks for the super recommendation! The feedback is really valuable and we'll share it with our team. Many thanks!

name: Kimberly Norfleet
text: Dr. Whitney was very kind and helpful. I was able to be seen within 45 minutes which is a plus especially for how busy this place can get. The only complaint I had was the older front desk woman with the long red hair. Not only did she open the front door late, she never asked me how I was doing and she spent most of the morning talking about the other doctors and nurses as if there wasn't a patient sitting in the lobby hearing all of it. Then she commented, "Whoo...not too many people on the books today." And I'm sitting there thinking, "With a nasty front desk person, I'm surprised you guys have many people at all." Customer service starts at the front and with this lady, you guys are going to lose a lot of valuable patients. Other than her, all other staff were friendly.

name: Lane Hardy
text: I have totally changed my mind about 1st Med in Dothan!  I had a bad experience the 1st time I called but I've seen Dr. Fountain twice now and he and his nurses have been wonderful!  I was able to get in and out on my hour lunch break and all the staff was extremely helpful!  I would recommend 1st Med to anyone!

name: Anita Allen
text: Went today for biometrics, besides OccMed, some of the friendliest staff I've seen in a medical office in a long time. Everyone was smiling, and made me feel comfortable. CRNP Baldwin was helpful, and kind for somebody like myself that was having a terrible start of their day. I was called back about five to ten minutes after arriving, would absolutely recommend

resp.text: Thank you for this great review. We’ll share this with the team!

name: Claudia Hall
text: I used the walkin urgent care service at First Med on a Saturday for a minor health issue. The service was prompt and Carlton, the nurse practitioner, was very professional and knowledgeable. I was in and out in about 30 minutes. As an SAMC employee, I am really proud to have this clinic as part of our organization. It was a great experience!

name: craig mitchell
text: I have used Dr. Paulk for over 30 years. I have always found him to be a competent Doctor and he has managed to cure me.  He is always willing to take the time and answer all of your questions.

name: Cindy Howard
text:
Dear Dr. Paulk,

My son came to First Med, Monday, July 3, 2017 with lower back pain. You were the doctor that assessed his need; however you allowed a 23 year old young man to walk…..walk is an overstatement….he left out of your office hunched over creeping like a ninety year old man. He wasn’t given a shot for inflammation, pain, or a prescription for anything. He was only given instructions to WAIT for an MRI approval which could take a few days. A couple hours after he left, I called the nurse to request at least something for pain. I also explained to the nurse that he rarely ever takes any medicine only when it’s necessary. Still he was given nothing.  Later that evening, I encouraged him to go to the emergency room because he was in so much pain. At this point that was his only option. It cost him five times his co-pay and triple the time for them to do what should have been done at your office that morning. They gave him a shot for inflammation and pain, and then advised him to make an appointment with Southern Bone & Joint. He has an appoint Monday July 2017.

Just a little medical history of my son….it’s literally a small amount of history….He hasn’t gone to the doctor in over ten years. His last doctor visit was with his pediatrician. He doesn’t even take over the counter medicine unless he absolutely can’t cope with his sickness to perform as a mechanic at work.

I can’t believe you allowed him to leave without doing anything for him.

A very upset mother.

name: Wade Denham
text: A 2:00 means that not 3, when you tell them your in a hurry, watching out the door staff walking by, then doctor walks in I sit down He says would you rather I see you in the hall. Very unprofessional, didn't go to have smartblank comments thrown my way, I let him know that as Well. Thanks Mr Baldwin, for making me feel insignificant.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Denham, we apologize that you did not have a great experience at our clinic. We’ll share your review with our clinic manager for review. Again, we apologize.

name: marcia green
text: Visit this clinic in Sept.2018 for a bug bite insurance paid 100%,I paid a copayment of 25.00 and they have yet to refund my 25,00. Call billing office and told check are writing at the end of the month call again in dec after not receiving a check told the same in January I was told that the office that does the refund was back up and if I didn't owe them any money I would receiving a check or if I owe them money it would be applied to what I owe and I would receive some kind of notice if the money was applied to a outstanding account .It now the end of Feb.I have not heard from them so I guess when you overpaid you do not get a refund.I been to many drs in Dothan and never had this happen.

resp.text: Hi Ms. Green, thank you for sharing this information. A manager from the Southeast Health Westgate Clinic will be reaching out to you directly to address your concern.

name: Living Life And Loving It
text: I have been going to First Med since around 2006. I had been treated by a few Drs, but I really enjoyed Dr Paulk. I will miss him. But I have to make a new choice for a Dr in Oct.  Thank You, Mrs Mccoy

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 star review! We are missing Dr. Paulk and hope he is enjoying retirement. As you look to find a new provider, we hope you’ll stay here with us at FirstMed and consider one of our new providers. We think they are really awesome too!

name: Deathlied
text: Poor poor service can't even have family members sit down anymore in the waiting room. Never EVER get Wyndi Strength she's rude, she drove me mad. She does not help at all. She does not listen, I couldn't even tell her all my symptoms because she kept interrupting me. Acts like a young high school drama queen.Very unprofessional it is a shame she looks like a good person. I had to wait almost 1 hour to see her and 2 hours or more to get out of the place. The other doctors are great, very nice and listen to what you say.

name: M S
text:
Carlton Baldwin is the best
highly recommend   great np

name: D S
text: Been seeing a couple of Dr's here for almost 20yrs. Never had an issue until recently. Had some labs done, apparently I was sick, no one bothered to call and tell me, just called in the scrip. Way to go!

name: Faith Hope
text: Pardon any errors or poor grammar I am speaking this into my cell phone. Went to First Med yesterday because I was suffering from sinus infection for over a month. I was being treated by a different Medical Practice who will remain nameless and I had actually seen them three times trying to get some real help and they just kept telling me it's allergies and wouldn't take it more serious so I finally went to first Med.  I told the doctor my symptoms, swollen painful glands, pain kept moving from left to right  sometimes in the middle and it really hurt when I swallowed, congestion in my chest (that ugly colored stuff) coughing so hard my ribs felt they're going to crack  congestion in my nose headache eyes ache Etc and NP Baldwin examined  me and treated me as I expected to be treated in a doctor's office and gave me the necessary medicines to finally get rid of this bad sinus infection / cold. He was extremely nice, very professional and knowledgeable, helpful and he actually took time to listen to me and explain things which was so wonderful that's very rare for a doctor these days. And oh my gosh one of the ladies I saw was Karen she was a stitch, had a great sense of humor. I highly recommend 1st med. they're in the middle of renovating so just be patient as I'm sure it will look very beautiful very soon.  the floor is beautiful and the wallpaper too in the back. Everyone was super nice and friendly. Oh and I was a walk-in I got there about 645. There had already been a couple other people and I think I was seen pretty quickly, about 30 minutes, considering evidently they do appointments also. I saw some reviews that the wait was really long but mine was not that long at all and there were actually probably seven different  patients in the waiting room at different times but they got called back pretty quickly and so did I as a walk-in. Thank you again so much First Med for being there for me! I'm already noticing a difference in the right direction. PS ladies do your hair I felt so bad I went in looking like I don't know what but it doesn't hurt that this doctor is easy on the eyes so you might want to take an extra minute LOL. No disrespect mrs. Baldwin good for you both! It's just nice to meet a really nice person who is nice looking and a doctor. Pretty rare. Maybe that's just part of this wonderful Southern Hospitality in Dothan. We had moved here from up North about a year ago... and we love it!

resp.text: Wow! That's one of the very best reviews we've ever received. We're so pleased that we met your expectations! Thank you for leaving this detailed feedback so that we can share it with our awesome team, they will enjoy hearing it.

name: Kenneth Tew
text:
I go to First Med every year for a physical. This is paid 100% by my company as long as the doctors code it preventive.  Every year I get billed and have to call First Med many times to get it straightened out.  Also when I have blood work done, I have to call and call to get the results.  My wife recently had blood work done as well and 4 weeks later, we are still trying to get someone to call her back with the results.
I kept calling the number on the bill to get my bill corrected and have left messages.  I have called First Med and left messages there as well for the billing dept.  Still no call backs.  Today I stopped in at First Med and told the girl up front that I wanted to speak with someone about my bill. She gave me another number for me to call.  I like Dr. Obrien but it's not worth the hassle anymore to go see him.  I had an appointment with Dr. Obrien for next week but I cancelled because I have a dislike for First Med so much.  My mother and mother in law goes to Dr. Obrien also which they love but they also hate the crappy service you have to go through to see him.  Time to find another medical provider.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Tew, we apologize that we have not met your expectations. We strive to provide a great experience and hope we can resolve this for you. We will provide this feedback to the management team for follow up. Again, we are very sorry.

name: Tanya Riley
text: I have a lot of strange health issues. The worst is fluriquinloin poisoning. Dr. Crocket has experienced it!!!! He didnt dismiss me as a crazy person. He really understands the nightmare I live in. I highly recommend this caring man. And Jennifer Stewart, the np. She is awesome. And Jofie..spelling may be wrong. Who listens to me cry. Or call forgetting things. These three keep me hoping and praying I may get better. I leave not crying but thankful to God I found them. With my problem, you have to kiss a lot of frogs to find the prince or princess. I believe I found them with these wonderful people.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review and the many compliments! We'll share your praise with the team.

name: Beyond Relief Massage
text: Couldn't get a prescription right for 6weeks so I finally make an appointment to go physically get it done correctly & wait over an hour?! What's the point of having an appointment...no use here. Dr is fine but service is extremely slow & if a dr's office can't get a Rx right can they do anything right besides take your money?!

name: Jill Hughes
text: Was refused REGISTRATION, because I did not have a hardcopy of my BCBS card. Had a picture on my phone, was unacceptable because clerk could not run my phone through her scanner. My son was having an allergic reaction, skin. On Sunday: Other offices closed or no doctor was in. Ended up going to the Emergency Room $300 copay instead of 40 at office.

resp.text: Hi Ms. Hughes, your feedback about the registration process will be shared with our clinic leadership. We apologize that we were unable to meet your needs and we’ll see if there are any process changes that should be considered based on this feedback. Although we never like to receive reviews like these, they help us improve and we appreciate you taking the time.

name: Brandon Baker
text: worst place to go i went for blood work and the office lef a message for me to call for results i called at 1 and left a message never heard from them called again the next day and got the office lady to transfer me to the nurse she never picked up. ve called 6 times and left 4 messages and got hung up on twice its been almost a week and still no call back extremely poor service the nurses are rude and the doctors just stand around and talk and make u wait!!!! not going back

name: Kelli Crooks
text: Went in with severe knee bruising and dislocated patella. Doctor said I was fine. Recommended Tylenol and "taking it easy". Horrible. He thought I was trying to get pain meds or something. No personality, pure doc in the box mentality.

name: wanda davis
text: I had an appt scheduled with Dr. O'Brien and when I arrived I was told I Did Not have an appt. And would have to see Jennifer Stewart A Nurse Practioner. She told me my left lung was crackling, possibly pneumonia!! She told me the meds I needed, we went over my existing meds that I needed refilled and said to go to the pharmacy and get them. It's been 30hrs., 5 phone calls, 4 msgs. And my prescriptions are still INCORRECT!!! Half of my meds have yet to be phoned in and my pneumonia meds haven't been prescribed neither!!! I Will Be Visiting Them In Person....might need a Bondsman!!!

name: Carla Gregg
text: Went in at 10 am to be seen, was told they were behind on patients, come back at 1:15 pm. I arrived at 1, at 3:47 I was finally brought to a room only to be treated like a second rate citizen from their very own nurse practioner. I literally have never been treated so poorly by a healthcare provider in all my life. If you choose this place, ONLY see Dr. Cook or DR. Paulk, these young practicing doctors have no bed side manner, no concern for you as a individual patient, disgruntled because he had to work by himself, and trust me, will literally laugh in your face if you try to guide him on what works best with your own body. Again, I was humiliated, and belittled by this man. Will have to change care providers now for fear of having to see this practicing doc again.....I've been going for yrs, one man can ruin your establisment!!!! Hope you other providers head my words. It was so bad, I felt I had to re-humiliate myself to the board director, Mr. Ken....who of course, his job is to protect his people. As a head manager of three establisments myself, I respect that. However, NEVER at the patients cost....I warn other patients, please proceed with caution!!

resp.text: Hi Ms. Gregg, we are so sorry to hear that we did not meet your service expectations. We will share your concerns with our clinic management.

name: Melissa Branton
text: Go in sick to be tested for flu and try don't even have any flu test. O'Brien days he was treating me with the flu because I had classic symptoms of it. Went to another to get swabbed to be sure because I have a young child and needed to know for sure. Unprofessional. What medical practice doesn't have flu test?!

text: Went on a Saturday in extreme pain for a second opinion. Was told upon arrival it would be a 3.5 hour wait and that there was someone who had been there since 8:30 that still had not been seen. It was 11:45. I know it's not the receptionists fault, but on a Saturday when you have that much of a back up with one physician on duty, let's use common sense and call in another physician. Left and went to Urgent Care and was seen within 45 min.

Instead of getting a whooping, he would come out laughing his head off.  Normally I was a very obedient & good child, but a needle turned me into a cat!  Miss dad!

name: Amanda Leigh
text: Dr. Miller is very cruel and uncaring. This is the most unprofessionally run doctor’s office I’ve ever been to. They treated me with disrespect and the nurse actually laughed at my concerns. I went in after moving from Soith Alabama in order for me to keep receiving a very vital prescription that I need to function on a daily basis. They e-scribed the meds to the Walmart pharmacy in Jasper. Well, the Walmart pharmacy was going to have to order it and it would take three days. Well, I needed the meds that day because I had started a new job and needed the meds to function properly and hold down my job. So, I called Dr. Miller to ask her to e-scribe it to the CVS. Well, it’s now three days later and Dr. Miller still hasn’t e-scribed the medicine. I’ve never in my life been treated so disrespectfully by a medical staff in my life. Luckily, my doctor’s office in my old town e-scribed the script in for me or else I would have eventually lost my job waiting on Dr. Miller. This clinic is a JOKE. The people who work there are a JOKE.

resp.text: We have searched for you in our patient database and are unable to locate you as our patient.  Because you aren't in our system, we don't have contact information and thus encourage you to contact our offices if and talk to management about this issue.

name: Brandy Reynolds
text: I went here nearly 5 months ago after a bad spat of bronchitis, upper respiratory infection and lung infection. I had a horrible cough during that and developed a hard pressure in the upper center part of my stomach which is pushing on my ribs and heart (possibly vagus nerve) I explained all of this to the doctor that I seen and told him I was having problems breathing since it started, much worse when I sat down. I also explained to this doctor that I had been taking meds for migraines but had ran out and needed a refill. Once this doctor found out I was a smoker, he seemed to not even care at all. He blamed everything on smoking. I had my 12 year old son in the room at the time and this doctor literally drew a graph of how long I was going to live on the bed paper. He terrified my son!!! I knew then I'd never see that man again! Instead of checking to see what the pressure was and instead of refilling a med I had been taking for 12 years he put me on Buspar. The first night I took that Buspar the pressure increased so bad I could hardly move! I'm also now having to take bp meds since all of this. I'm 34 years old, I should not have all of this going on and for it to hit like it did all at once. And instead of this doctor trying to help me he terrified my son! He also prescribed me Naproxen which luckily I didn't take because I went to St. Vincent where they done at egd and found I have chronic gastritis as well as reflux esophagitis so the Naproxen could have caused a stomach bleed... I've seen another doctor here who is better than the first but I am still having the same issues. I'm honestly believing a stuck hiatal hernia or something else has been missed. The new doc put me on zantac which didn't help either. I feel no better, in fact I feel worse than when I did when I went to try and get help here about 5 months ago. As far as the staff, nurses and other docs they are great. The first doc I saw I would not recommend to my worst enemy!

text: Ok so my mother is a patient there. She recently came to stay with me and has bipolar disorder. This man instead of prescribing any kind of meds for bipolar like my gp did, gives her xanax 60 a month. Ok, so my mother is a recovering addict and alcoholic, and instead of telling her he can't give them to her like most doctors that see that behavior and know something's up they keep prescribing them to her, well let me tell you she has been eating all 60 in less than two weeks... ikr abusing them, she is clearly addicted to them and instead of him telling her no he keeps giving. So here's what I think I'm going to do, im going to file a complaint with whomever I can to have this man investigated through the medical board of alalabama.

text: The care may be good, but unfortunately I couldn't say. I called and could barely talk because my throat was so sore and had lost my voice. text:
If i could rate this no stars i would.

If you have to have a referral please look elsewhere.

The nurses are just as bad an unfriendly.

They almost cost me a trip to the emergency room.

Please look elsewhere for a family physician.

text: I called to set me up as a new patient and Sheryll hung up in my face before I couldn't even finish my sentence. VERY UNPROFESSIONAL and i will be finding else where to go

name: Amanda Brown
text: I've called at least 20 times in the past 2 days trying to get a BCBS referral. I've gotten through one time, and gotten voicemail the rest. The referral I got was only made valid for one day. Please hire front desk workers to answer the phones.

name: Iggy Tate
text: Found this practice through bcbs insurance page for "find doctor" and it said they were accepting new patients. When I called to make an appointment they wanted to know what meds I'm prescribed. They wanted to call me back after talking to the nurses to approve me as a new patient. 4 days later they called to say I wasn't accepted as a new patient. If you're looking for a family doctor save yourself time and call another practice. I was able to get an appointment elsewhere without waiting to be approved...

name: Georgia Shirley
text: The office is pleasant with very friendly staff. Dr. Summerford is great; very thorough.

name: Stacy
text: The doctors are wonderful.

name: Heike Childs
text: Dr. Honeywell of Creekside Family Practice is our family's physician.  We love his gentle manner, humor, and caring bedside manner, but behind all of that is an extraordinarily skilled physician. The staff at Creekside is personable and helpful. The billing is accurate and the accounting staff are very helpful in filing with the insurance providers. The lab is fast and efficient without appearing to be unduly rushed. Test results are called in to us on the day following the lab test.  Because we are existing patients, there was a time when we have been given priority when we experienced immediate medical emergencies and it did save my husband's live. However admittedly we try not to repeat the use of this extraordinary privilege.  They are a great team and we highly recommend them.

name: Alex Tomlinson
text: Dr. Showers is one of the best doctors in town.  He has been great to me and my family.  I will not go anywhere else.  Simply the best!

name: Renee Holder
text:
My son has been a patient of Dr Honeywell, for over 16 years. He's seemed to be a very caring Dr. But when my husband passed away last October my insurance changed. And with that their attitude changed. My deductibles were billed to me and left me confused. Dr. Honeywell ordered his staff to make me pay any do amounts before they would see my son each time he had an appointment. Being on a fixed income this is difficult. But my son needing his medicine was more important so I would scrounge up the money and pay it.
All of that is not too big of an issue until the last appointment before he had changed primary doctors. he was getting ready to go off to college and they refuse to see him unless I paid a no-show fee that I had canceled prior to them claiming that I owe them $50 for the no-show. keep in mind I have showed them the text where I had called and cancelled the appointment they still claim I owe them the money. And refused to sign off on an immunization form he needed for college. Not knowing, I could have had it signed by any physician, they were willing to ruin his chances of going to college. For a $50 no show fee?!! This is a doctor that has been seeing my son for nearly 17 years! Never having a problem collecting any deductibles( although late sometimes, due to the fact I wasn't aware...)and getting paid through the insurance company.
It breaks my heart that Dr. Honeywell held captive a piece of paperwork over $50! Especially, the lack of compassion that Honeywell has expressed with a loss of my son's father, and my husband.16+ YEARS!!!
Although, this explains why the office does not accept Medicaid. Pretty sure it's because Medicaid will only pay so much.
So my opinion, their compassion go only as deep as your wallet.

name: Melissa
text:
Dr. Honeywell is a very caring physician and that is certainly what we ALL need! He's been my primary care physician for about 3 years now...and he's great with working things out & talking about symptoms, etc. that may/may not be going on with me to get to the bottom of any health issue. Most importantly, he -nor his nurses- never make my visit feel rushed (even though I know he's a busy man!) and seems so genuinely concerned in making me better when I'm not 100%.

Thankful I have Dr. Honeywell!

(p.s. there used to be a rude desk nurse problem...not sure if it was an organizational problem or what, but it was resolved and hasn't been a problem in a long time, which means they listen to their patients and make changes when needed to improve their services--which says a lot!)

name: Jeremy Douglas
text:
Thank you Dr. Haskall for calling me on a Sunday concerning my labs, I went to the ER to get my Blood sugar lowered. Your care and concern may have been a blessing in disguise. I have a massive headache from getting my sugar lowered so quickly, but thank you again so much.

Jeremy Douglas, Patient of Dr. Ohalloran

name: zoologist1992
text: I see all staff there as kinfolke except one who actually is blood.  My doctor is Lon Haskell MD as well as him being that of certain blood of mine.  All fellow patients are kind, trustworthy and polite as well.  Thus I expect young guns often present.  But the lab is not somewhere many people choose to work long term due the the general relationship between staff and patients -SGD

name: Matt Kennedy
text: Dr Honeywell is the only doctor I have seen that goes above and beyond to make sure his patients are seen when they need care.  I was recently hospitalized for a sever asthma attack and after my return visit Dr Honeywell squeezed me into his already busy schedule multiple times to make sure I was taken care of.  He's awesome.

name: Robert Kemper
text: I've been going to Creekside for about 18 months. The doctor I see is good, which is ultimately the only important reason for being there, but I'm not satisfied with the wait time in the exam room, the wait time in the lab, or the wait time trying to pay a bill over the phone. They need to find a way to improve their operations.

name: M Davis
text: Creekside has been great to me, and very prompt with appointments and calls. Though I did have to wait a very long time on my first visit, I later figured out (at least I think) that the established patients were given priority. After that visit I've never waited longer than 10 minutes in the waiting room, or around 20 at the lab (that was a particularly busy day, to be fair). Dr. O'Halloran is kind and knowledgeable, and actually seems to care about whole body health which is wonderful! Most other docs I've been to look for symptoms to treat, but Dr. O'Halloran assesses the whole system. Prescriptions have been called in promptly and correctly. I'm thankful to have found a great primary care office :)

name: Scott Harden
text: This is a great family practice. Dr O'Halloran knows his stuff and is a really nice guy.

name: Nick Savage
text: I would first like to say, that Dr. O'Halloran is an excellent doctor.  I have been going to him for a couple years a least.  He has always been great. However, his front desk staff, and Creekside's rules, are the pits.  Their front desk staff are incredibly rude, unprofessional, and unknowledgeable about anything that goes on in the office. If you call to check up on something, and require a call back, they will never return it. They will not let you schedule an appointment for a future day, you have to call the day you want to be seen. Not only that, but good luck getting seen. I have sat forever in the waiting room, and usually spend an hour and a half before I ever see him. This last time, I never did.  I told them I had to leave, I had to return to work, and they told me I would have to pay a cancellation fee, for an appointment they set up a few hours earlier, knowing they were running several hours behind. They did not even have the courtesy to tell me beforehand that they were short staffed and running behind.  After leaving, they then mailed me a letter telling me they will no longer see me as a patient.  Glad to see they are here to make money over helping people. I will find a doctor who actually cares about seeing his patients, not just taking their money.

name: Pamela Thomas
text: Dr. Honeywell has been my doctor for 20 years and is not my child's doctor.  He is nothing short of AMAZING and will do anything in his power to help take great care  you.

name: Shelley McClanahan
text:
After moving to the Huntsville area a little over two years ago for my husband's R&D career, it was alarming to discover the degradation of quality medical care here. I have a few ongoing medical issues with my kidneys and my heart, as well as chronic migraines, so it was vital to find a good GP, and fast. After about six months of suffering one disappointing GP after another, I was telling a (then) new Huntsville friend how overwhelmed I was trying to find just one decent doctor seeing new patients, and she recommended Dr. Chris O'Halloran. She and her husband had been seeing him since their R&D transplant from Texas two years before us. Dr. O'Halloran, she said, "stops at nothing to get to the bottom of what's going on with you." She went on to say that together she and Dr. O'Halloran had discovered the root cause of her own migraines and was treating her with a preemptive medication that had cured her condition. She also said that her husband had begun having trouble with his heart, and that Dr. O'Halloran knew exactly the place to refer him for excellent treatment.

Thankfully, Dr. O'Halloran was seeing new patients, so for well over a year now I have been able to see for myself, time and time again, that my friend's recommendation was on point. He truly is an outstanding physician with a very friendly aura, and he has an answer for almost anything; and when he doesn't, I can assure you he will know who does. (Just be prepared for a fast talker! :D )

(PS: my friend also sent us to an *amazing* dentist: Dr. Ernest Barnes, III. Imagine Foghorn Leghorn as a dentist and that's him.)

name: Meagan Ewing
text:
Dr. Barmore is very sweet, but this last visit (February 2021) felt rushed, and nobody communicated with each other.

I filled out a list of medicines, marked which ones needed refills, and turned it back in with my yearly update paperwork. The CNA who worked me up asked about it, so either she didn’t get it or just didn’t look at it.

They were very uncommunicative on the portal. I asked about my thyroid levels (what I have to go to a PCP for and what the visit was about) and my A1C. The CNA communicated with me about the A1C, but I had to prompt her again about the thyroid levels, and she never responded on the portal.

And only a 2-month supply of my thyroid meds was called in to my pharmacy, so I’ll either have to keep bugging them about it, or plan to pay another copay and see the MD again in 2 months when I need refills again. They also didn’t run a T4 lab to check how my levels were on my current dose, just a TSH and A1C.

The visit I had in June 2020 with Dr. Barmore was amazing, but this visit fell extremely short. I’m juggling with whether I wouldn’t be better served just going to American Family Care to get my thyroid meds refilled, because at least they operate on extended hours and their phlebotomists are decent.

name: Clayton Baswell
text:
Let me start by stating I am a business owner... very rarely do I rate business with one start however this situation more than merited this rating. If it were possible to give less stars I would do so.

I have never been treated so disparagingly or with such utter patronizing disdain from a medical provider in my entire life. Gaile Prentice CRNP (not even a medical doctor mind you) was assigned to me when I called in for a general wellness check over a year ago.  After a not so pleasant initial experience with a CRNP who was clearly not well trained or very competent for that matter I thought I'll try again when I call back next time for another appointment with another doctor. Unfortunately you are assigned the same doctor for LIFE at this practice.

This is the most absurd practice concept I have ever heard of. Instead of seeking the best doctor patient relationship this practice cares more for administrative duties and collecting as many co pays as possible.

As my wife accompanied me to my appointment literally in tears pleading for  help with managing my general anxiety we were met with ZERO SYMPATHY and were denied a refill of an very common anti anxiety medication I have used in the past on multiple occasion when it was absolutely necessary to do so (valium).

Rather than attempting to dig into the problem she exasperated the issue and the most she would do was refer me to a psychiatrist. Never mind in Texas with my  primary care doctor I was able to get prescription refills without ever having to see such a doctor. They were more than competent and experienced enough handle simple issues like these.

I was treated with contempt and my personal integrity was questioned on multiple occasion regarding a medication I have been taking literaly for years.

Do not waste your time with this practice. Do not waste your time with Gaile Prentice, she is utterly unsympathetic, contentious, and unqualified as a Certified Nurse Practitioner to act as a primary care provider.

name: gail springer
text: Worst experience ever. Went in to discuss bloodwork and explained I was having anxiety issues. She upped my anti-depression medication which did nothing for my anxiety. Told me if it didn’t help to call and they would do something else. Called twice and didn’t even get the courtesy of a return call. Guess they wanted another co-pay. Time to move on.

text: Malpractice. I have been having undiagnosed chronic body pain for almost 4 years and then Dr. Jernigan was supposed to give me a referral to a rheumatologist but they failed on the first try because of some lab tests mixup and then the 2nd one nothing was happening until i made some phone calls and finally got an appointment myself. The new meds made me sick so i wanted my initial dose of the the original med back which i have been prescribed for almost 2 years. This man then ignored my request completely and reduced my dose again. I pleaded with the nurses on the phone but they told me he was going to cut me off completely before the date of my specialist appointment. Dr. Jernigan is by far the worst doctor i have ever experienced in my life. Doctors like him just proves that you can spend 8+ years in medical school and have absolutely no idea what you're doing. They also NEVER answer the phone. I've had to call OTHER medhelps to call them just so they'd answer the phone. I work and go to school full time and now i gotta find a new doctor. He cut me off of ALL of my medicine. Thank you now my pain is going to be way worse. Aren't doctors supposed to help with your pain? Guess not. Disgraceful.

name: Jamye Morris
text:
I had a terrible experience at MedHelp Narrows with Dr. Larisa Russell.  I took my daughter in today due to a two day headache, fever and fatigue.  Dr. Russell was very condescending, sarcastic and ended up joking that my daughter might have a brain tumor.  It was not at all funny.  I felt like I was under attack the entire visit.  When I tried to talk to her about my daughter’s headaches, she laughed at me and said “ are you sure she doesn’t have a brain tumor?  I said “
What did you say and she said it again”.  At this point I requested a new doctor.  She became even more rude and told me just to come back tomorrow when another doctor would be in.  I left the office shaking and crying.  It might not sound bad on the post but it was.  Having had loved ones die of cancer how could this be funny for anyone.  Did she give my daughter a flu test, no, a mono test, no, consider seasonal allergies even? This person has a terrible bed side manner and has no business working in the health care field.  I’m still not over it. By the way, the other ladies in the office ( nurse and office staff) were very kind and apologetic. No apology was given by Dr. Russell only a comment that I did not get her sense of humor.

name: michael jones
text:
I can't believe how horrible this place is now that they have changed company hands. I called one day because one of my prescriptions didn't get sent to my pharmacy. I was transferred to the nurse who talked to me horribly. She even insulted me repeatedly, yelled, and was beyond rude. She wouldn't listen to anything I had to say.

All I wan't to know to do was verify what was sent to the pharmacy. She kept going on and on about it was time for me to come in anyway for my three month check up, and I have already gotten, first she said three months, then changed it to six months of prescriptions already, (she was actually right the first time when she said three months) but it wasn't even two months yet. Which means I would have eligible for my third month. I didn't even receive the first month. So even if I did use the first two months, I would have still had one month to go.   But that wasn't my issue.

My issue was all but one of my other prescriptions actually made it to the pharmacy. I just need to confirm it was sent. My wife and I filed a complaint against her. And left them for another clinic. After requesting that my medical records get sent to the new clinic, I get a certified letter that they were dropping me. Lol, that was too funny. I never heard anything further about my complain against the nurse. And the certified letter was from the nurse manager that we actually filed the complaint with. So I guess if you complain about one of their nurses, you automatically get the axe lol. So I guess they get the green light to treat their patients any way they want.

But the nurse we filed the complaint against was the nurse for Dr. Jernigan. My wife who is also a nurse could overhear her said she's heard anything like that in the 20 plus years she's been an RN which is why she recommended that I file the complaint.

resp.text: Best of luck to you Mr. Jones.
