text: Good doctors ,friendly staff and doctor.

name: Nancy Weltlich
text: Wonderful caring experienced professionals

name: WoodKrafters Construction
text: Dr Buddy Smith is great. His staff, most are great. Only problems my family has had coming here is getting "PA" for medicaid. Ive watched my family on 4 separate occasions have to fight just to get the staff to do their end. Family went without medicine once for 4 days because staff failed to do their job. Only found out after family calling medicaid and the pharmacy.

name: Lacy Kuenzel
text: I have been here numerous times between my children, my husband and myself. I have been for myself twice in the last few months and both times were less than an hour. We have never had a bad experience. The entire staff has always been super friendly and knowledgeable. I am very pleased with the service and care provided.

name: Rachael Dannelley
text: If you are going to utilize a contactless registration system, you should make sure that someone is managing it during your scheduled business hours. Waited an hour and a half to find out that “because of an issue” the clinic had not opened on time and we would have an additional hour wait before being able to be seen. Also, placing a sign on the door would have been a simple way to let the public know that you were not able to see patients at this time. The parking lots full of waiting patience could have made the decision to go to a neighboring urgent care or go back home without wasting their morning.

name: Kevin Rush
text: This place is supposed to be Veterans Administration approved as indicated on the VA's website. I am a veteran with VA insurance and over a month after my visit I received a text that payment was denied and was sent a bill for over $600 for an office visit! No one contacted me but my credit card was billed $125. I will be contacting the VA to have them removed from their approved walk-in clinics!

name: Mary Cathryn Brooks
text: How do you speak to anyone on the phone??? My visit was fine. I get the wait. I work in a specialists office so I get it. I just can't get ANYONE on the phone! The prompt says to push 5 to talk to a staff member, so I push 5. Then it takes me back to the main menu. Please fix this. PLEASE!

name: Sasha Bishop
text: My daughter was just refused care because my phone couldn't scan the registration code and wouldn't load their website.

name: Miller Sherling
text: Awesome: friendly, efficient service. QR code on door so folks can register outside in car. Receptionist & 2 folks in waiting room wearing masks, with both mouth and nose covered. NOT awesome: person who took my kid’s temp wearing face shield only, no mask, in small closed room, no ventilation, and used ORAL thermometer. So kid had to lower mask. Not safe for anyone. I should’ve said something and didn’t.

name: Eric Phillips
text: Went here for our kids ear ache.  The sign on the door says mask required if you don’t have one please request one from desk.  Went in and they would not let us in because we didn’t have a mask and when I requested one they said they were out.? What kind of urgent care do not have mask.

name: Denise Thrasher
text: When I decided to get my Covid vaccine with them I was delighted because they were always organized and it’s convenient. The day I was to go they called me and asked me to come the next day which was New Year’s Eve . They said someone didn’t take it out of the freezer. Ok then the next day I went as I was told, it took a while but I was ok with that because it was new. They were nice and apologized because they were “ learning” and that’s fine. Well I was suppose to go Thursday the 28 but I told them I work out of town that day but I could get there by 6:00pm. The nurse said just come Friday morning, we are open half a day, ok that’s fine. So today I tried to register just as I was told to do and it didn’t have an option for Covid follow up so I called the office, explained it to the nurse she said let me call you right back. Ok, I waited and waited, finally someone from CORPORATE called me explaining they didn’t have anymore vaccine to give. WHAT?? She started out telling me well you were suppose to be here yesterday. I stopped her and said hold on , I told the nurse I could come but it would be 6:00 and she told me to come the next day,I even called WEDNESDAY and told them again I could come but again I was told to come Friday!  I didn’t do that on my own! She said well she didn’t have the authority to tell you that. After going back and forth she said she was gonna have to find me a vaccine and it would take her a week! So guess what Iam not a happy camper. I told her Iam in healthcare and I am pretty upset for being able to get it because if their mistake. Am I wrong for this?? I know this is all new and I realize mistakes happen but come on give me a break! I have pts and family members to think of!!  Still upset!!

name: Brandy Gray
text: It wasn't the 3.5 hour wait that was upsetting to me.   It was the nightmare of a sign in process from your car!  Once I finally got through the many many many questions, copy of drivers license,  insurance info,  copay info,  etc and I finally get to the 'finish' button at the end, the circle went round and round and round and it never submitted my info after spending at least 30 mins on filling out all the info.  I walked inside only to be handed an iPad and told to fill it out again!  Needless to say I left and went to Pricare.  They were able to see me immediately.   Very very dissatisfied and disappointed with the long sign in process at Main Street when im already feeling absolutely terrible and exhausted.

name: Katrina Kennedy
text: I registered my boyfriend online for a COVID test at 9am. We waited outside until 1:49pm!!! AND HE IS STILL INSIDE!! Its 3:15 and they still arent done yet. If we ever get out of here, we wont be back that's for sure. He could literally have COVID and they got him up in there for that long.

name: W “Annie”
text: Register online now?. What an annoying pain in the backside! Wasn't this way first time we came for testing. Over an hour trying to get the online registration to work.!  Still sitting here outside trying to register. Place be closed by time we finish.

name: Tom Lozaw
text:
Medical assistant Tameka provided great service. She was professional, friendly and caring. I was impressed that she took history information, blood pressure and even took exrays.

Nurse Practitioner Callie diagnosed my illness and prescribed medicine to help me get well.

resp.text: Thank you so much Tom! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Debbie DiBenedetto
text: I have had 2 out of 2 great experiences at MainStreet.  I've never had to wait more than 5-10 minutes and the staff is all so friendly, efficient & caring.  NP Ellison is wonderful as are her nurses.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Debbie. It was a pleasure serving you!

name: Destiny Benford
text: I would like to give it NO STARS but it want let me do that but this place sucks and needs to be shut down permanently. The reason why my 71 year old grandmother went there for abdominal pain at 2 p.m and didn't get out till after 6 and in between all of that they were sneaking patients in and out through the back door skipping over her and still didn't solve her  problem she came back home even worse than she left and with this place supposed to be urgent care she might as well went to the ER as long as she stayed in there my family is completely done with this Urgent Care of can't say the same for the others but this place the one in Alexander City AL needs to be closed down (NOT A FAN OF THIS PLACE) NO STARS IF POSSIBLE

name: MainStreet Family Urgent Care
text: Love the convenience of having an urgent care clinic that is open after work.      The staff was very friendly and the facilities were Super Nice!  They even have Free Coffee and Juice.  Oh and I love that they had my medicine on site so I could go straight home afterwards!

name: Sha Lewis
text: Fast and professional. And they also have fleece blankets if you get a little too cold. Very thoughtful in making sure patients are comfortable from beginning to end.

resp.text: Thanks Sha! We always want to make sure are patients are comfortable and well cared for the second they come in the door.  We appreciate your kind words.

name: Wendi Alexander
text: Fast, friendly,  and very professional!! Great staff!!

name: Brandon Thornton
text: CRNP Cassandra Gammage was great. Very caring and thorough. Went above and beyond for my little girl. Seemed passionate about her work.

resp.text: Thanks so much Brandon! We love Cassandra and are so happy we could make you feel like part of the MainStreet Family!

name: Kevin Brown
text: They got me in fast. And the staff and DR was very professional and friendly.

resp.text: This is great news! We're so happy to know that you had a good experience.

name: Sheretha Woodyard
text: I took my son into the Urgent Care on Sunday for abdominal pain & vomiting.  Upon examination of my son, the Nurse Practitioner said she would have to send him to the ER because she could not scan him there.  My first thought was, she is in a hurry because it's close to closing.  To my surprise, she called the ER to let them know she was sending a patient and told them what she thought was going on.  We arrived at RMC where my son was diagnosed with appendicitis and had to have emergency surgery.  Today I received a call from I think Lisa the NP that was working on Sunday calling to check on my son.  I appreciate the thoughtfulness & her taking the time to check on him. Awesome Customer Service! Thank you Main Street Urgent Care & Nurse Practitioner Lisa.

resp.text: Sheretha, thank you so much for your kind words!  We always strive to treat our patients like family and want to make sure your visit was great!  We certainly hope that your son is on the mend!

name: Amanda Hill
text: My husband and I went to the clinic a week ago. We both have the cold crud going around. He was diagnosed with URI and ear ache, they diagnosed me with the flu even though I had no symptoms, and my husband had all the symptoms. They took us back at the same time, to the same room, and tested us at the same time. They treated us with steroids and mucinex d. A week later we are both worse off. I don't have insurance so I paid $125 for nothing. I would not recommend this place and I will not go to another one of these clinics.

resp.text:
Hi Mandy,

We appreciate your feedback, and we're sorry your experience was not satisfactory! Someone from the clinic will be reaching out in the next 24 hours to see how we can help. Thank you for choosing MainStreet Family Urgent Care.

name: Brian Dodson
text: Never again will I visit this place.  So you said that my insurance denied my visit to you.  So you charged me cash price for a visit.....Really? And you charged my card without my consent.  No thank you, if my $ is all you’re worried about and not my health or how you treat your customers.  Don’t care to do business with you.

name: Joe Littrell
text: Waiting over 4hours  as walkin.And still waiting.

name: Fran Arnold
text: If I could give 0 I would. Do not take your child there. I have a toddler who was prescribed a medicine both his physician, choa and the Walgreens told me he should never have been prescribed... they do not have drs there only pa or np... I get they are medically trained but this is not a place for children at all...

resp.text:
Hi Fran,

Thank you so much for reaching out with your concerns! I've passed your information along to our Chief Medical Officer to review your child's chart. The medication prescribed is approved by the FDA and CDC for children, but we'd be more than happy to discuss any concerns with your child's pediatrician!

name: Tasha Reese
text: Very fast pace and knowledgeable staff.

name: Bama_ Diesel
text: The staff was very friendly and respectful. They got us in and out fairly quickly.

name: Misty Goodson
text: Long wait time

name: Kerry Bulin
text: Very friendly, caring, and efficient staff.

resp.text: Thanks, Kerry! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Urgent Care!

name: Don Martin
text: There is no better Dr in Alabama than Dr Wood!

name: Beth Edwards (CurlUpWGoodBook)
text: Staff & Drs at this location are fabulous!! Dr Wood & Dr Funderburk are the best around! They treat you like family!

name: Kimberly Perreault Bryant
text: Called to get my blood pressure pills renewed. Would not do it for me. Didn’t call me back. Don’t understand how you treat a patient like this especially when we’re in this pandemic where it’s been proven you’re at higher risk having high blood pressure with coronavirus. Do not recommend. Obviously patients well being is not in their best interest.

name: Zac M
text: Chris Wood and his nurse practitioner, Bella Hudson, are both excellent. Never had any issues here. Chris has been my primary physician for going on two decades.

name: Michelle Watts
text: Never in my life have I ever encountered worse office staff than the staff at Chilton Family Medicine. They are always extremely rude, and have no phone etiquette. Kim put me on hold and the operator came because the call was disconnected. She then blamed it on me saying I must have hung up, because hold doesn't disconnect the call. They transfer you without asking you to hold or letting you finish a sentence. During a routine credit check, I found out I was in collections from a visit in 2014. Upon calling the collection agency, I learned it was from them. I called to see why I had a balance. She said it was from them not filing through my insurance. When I went to that visit I gave the girl at the front my insurance contract number, but did not have my card on hand. Well, she must not have written it down because they didn't have it. Timely filing with insurance is 365 days. So, it's too late for them to file with insurance. Kim, the billing representative, said she called me in May 2014 and I said I would bring my card in at my next visit. I never went back to them, BUT I GAVE THEM MY CONTRACT NUMBER. I never received any statement because they entered my address city wrong. I was never informed I even had a balance, so there was no way for me to correct it during timely filing. So I'm responsible for their irresponsible rude office staff. Do yourself a favor and NEVER go to Chilton Family Medicine. The doctors are great, but it is not worth dealing with their horrendous staff.

name: Tadd Bit of Videos
text: I have had the same issues with this office, like you said the doctors are great, but the staff could care less about you, i just found out i have a bill there, it 120 days pass due, I never got a bill, they told me that there billing office should have, well they didn't, but they want to turn it back on the patient to take care of there billing issues, i am considering looking for another doctor, not do to the doctor himself but the staff and the billing issues continue every time you go to them, STAY AWAY, unless you want to do there job too and pay them for doing there job, or the lack there of!

name: Chantil Nasef
text: Quite possibly the SLOWEST doctors office I have ever been to in my life. Appointment at 230pm and still haven't left as of 5pm!!!

name: Terri JD
text: I called to make a new appointment one day when the office opened. I was put on hold, and was eventually asked if I could receive a return call after lunch. That would have been fine, and I gave my contact info, but it did not happen. I called back mid-afternoon and waited on hold for 20 minutes (out of curiosity to see how long it would take for someone to pick up). When someone finally picked up the phone and asked who I was waiting for (it was not the same woman who answered the phone, and not her fault), I decided if this was the type of service that was being provided, I would not even waste my time making an appointment.

name: Lila Wild
text: I was searching for a doctor for months. I'm in my 20's & healthy you wouldn't think it would be hard to find a doctor... but everywhere I called was never taking new patients. It seemed that everywhere was full. UNTIL I called Auburn Family medicine. I got put on the books right away to see Dr. Hammond and he was great!! I recommended him to my mother (who is almost 60 & healthy) she struggled to find a doctor too (because we rarely have to go to one)... Our previous family doctor was not caring and very passive, he never seemed to take her seriously about her health concerns. My mom left Dr. Hammonds office almost in (grateful) tears at the compassion and care he took to ask her questions, and let her explain any concerns she had about her health. He took his time and did not pass her off just to get on to the next person. They told me on the phone they do not accept people as new patients if they are over the age of 55*, they graciously made an exception for my mother because of her good health status (which I'm so grateful for). My husband now see's Dr. Hammond too. Occasionally the office will send out an email saying they have issues with their phone system not working. (That could explain the complaint reviews about long wait times on the phone.) I personally have never had a problem with this. The email they send out provides other options to contact the office if necessary while the phones are down. They make me feel welcomed at Auburn Family Medicine and I recommend them to everyone!

name: J Brooks
text: Great place if you have the sniffles, if you need real medical advice for real issues, find somewhere else. I can’t count how many times I’ve been asked to come in, asked if I have the same issue, then tell me they’re referring me to someone else. Less than 2 minutes with the D.R. or N.P.

name: Tarra Dixon
text: Have always loved Dr. Bufford, but I am currently seeing Dr. Hammond. He is just as wonderful, great listener, very caring and just a wonderful dr in general. Love the entire staff.

name: W W
text: Dr. Hammond is great!

name: Will Witten
text:
Dr. Buford was excellent until I got into pain. I was hospitalized for Gastroenteritis after vomiting for 5 hours and spent 6 days in the hospital. I was prescribed medication for the extreme pain I experience on voiding my bladder due to my condition until I can get to my specialist (can’t see me until the 5th)

Dr. Buford, despite strong medical evidence and multiple medical opinions from specialists on my condition, refused to continue that medication until my appointment with a specialist in a week. This is why people have primary care doctors, and his disregard for my pain due to societal pressures is sickening.

I am now left to try to find someone willing to do his job for him, which leaves me looking like a drug addict just because I have a very painful and embarrassing bowel condition.

I will never patronize a doctor that would leave a patient in obvious pain like this, the war on PATIENTS IN PAIN in this country needs to stop. I will never be back to this establishment.

name: Jessica Johns
text: I used to love this practice, now I have to call every three months to get refills on my prescriptions because they deny the pharmacy. I am out of my prescription and they want to say they need 24 hours to get them called in, no longer a fan and I may just be finding a new doctor.

name: Tara Webb
text:
There's something about that Dr. Bufford... the way he pulls that stool up and sits real close and stares into your soul as he asks what he can do for me today... I'm making a joke, but seriously... he cares. I have NEVER not ONCE EVER left that office questioning the care I had received. Whether the answer is Yes or No, good or bad, I know I'm being told the truth by a caring, smart, empathetic, professional, ethical, sincere doctor.
Ok, the rest of the staff are OK, too. :)  Love y'all!

name: Megan Thomas
text: My first appointment with Auburn Family Medicine was with Dr. Gauthier. He was extremely nice, attentive, and seemed to really care about getting to the root of my symptoms. The next time I had to make an appointment was a bit of an “emergency” appointment and I was scheduled with Dr. Gauthier’s Physian’s Assistant Anna. There are seriously not enough good things I can say about her. She really listened to what was going on with me, thoroughly explained all treatment options she felt would benefit me, and respected any concerns I had as well. I now only schedule my appointments with Anna. Honestly if I could give more than 5 stars I would. All of the staff are great, but Anna is hands down my favorite! You will not be disappointed if you schedule an appointment with her!

name: Craig Wilson
text: I always have a great experience at this office! Every provider listens to your concerns and I always feel like I’m taken care of. I’ll tell everyone I know to come here!

name: LMM0003
text: Staff is very friendly and the Drs actually listen to you. The hours are great for 8-5 workers!

name: Becca Nance
text: I can't say enough good things about Dr. Bufford and his team. They are always friendly, patient, kind, and explain everything thoroughly. Dr. Bufford and his physician assistant, Michael, are exceptional at what they do. I'm not as familiar with Dr. Gauthier, but my few experiences with him have been pleasant as well. I highly recommend!

name: Summer Whatley
text: every visit i’ve had, the doctors and nurses have been nothing but EXCEPTIONAL. If you are looking for a new doctor in Auburn, Auburn Family Medicine beats them all and i very highly recommend this office

name: Michelle Smith
text: I've been going to Dr. Bufford and staff since college. Their kindness and bedside manner is impeccable.

name: Nicolas Gay
text: Amazing clinic, with amazing doctors, especially doctor bufford. I dont think i could receive better care anywhere else

name: Joyce Smith
text:
Very prompt with appointments, Lovely staff and doctors... could use a bit of pep in their step when calling in prescriptions for their patients in pain (it's happened with my regular medication too). Didnt hesitate to take my payment though! Theyre knowledgeable and kind, but as with most offices... theyre human and make mistakes. Still a great office, just wasnt very happy that my medications have been forgotten by them a couple of times.

**update**
Hands down the BEST medical office ever. They went over ALL of my tests and previous tests my last dr didnt bother to. I miss them so much.

name: Brittany Meadows
text: I've been going to dr. Bufford for 7 years and I refuse to use anyone else until the day he retires (:

name: Gabe Hayes
text: Called to get an appointment to fill my zoloft, and the wait was two weeks!! If anyone knows anything about zoloft, it takes about 5 minutes to fill. It also has some pretty harsh side effects when you just stop taking it! I told the lady on the phone this and she acted like she didn’t even care!

name: Jeffrey Willis
text: Bruh whats the point of making an appointment if im still waiting 30 to 45 minutes...

name: Elise Broadus
text: I’ve had nothing but good experiences so far

name: Anwar Kalalah
text: Rude receptionists

name: funkyy Buddha
text: Nice friendly staff and facility.  Doc was super pleasant and had a great bedside manner.  Thanks Doc P!

name: Ventress Aeneid
text: Since "primary care" is displayed on the sign outside the building, I walked into the office in an attempt to establish primary care for a family member who was with me.  Once inside, the receptionist asked why I was there, and when I told her I was there to establish a primary care physician (PCP) for the person with me, she asked for my insurance information and ID; I gave her my ID and the family member's, plus my insurance card.  Upon looking at my card, she muttered to herself:  "Oh, it's B.E.G." (for those of you who don't know, BCBS policies purchased through the Affordable Care Act have B.E.G. as the first letters of their policy numbers). I asked her why she had to say "...it's B.E.G.," and she responded that with those policies it was necessary to have a primary care physician in order to receive medical care--which I knew, and which is why I was there in the first place (See sentence #1 of this review). She accessed the information related to my policy, then proceeded to tell me who the family member's PCP was; I told her that the doctor she mentioned was MY doctor and NOT the family member's.  She then went on to say that without a PCP we would have to pay for the visit out of pocket, and I once again informed her that the whole reason we were there was to establish a PCP--was she actually suggesting that we needed a PCP in order to get a PCP?  She then dismissively asked, "So, what do you wanna do?..."  Dumb question, since I had stated my reason for the visit more than once.  I asked her to return my IDs and insurance card, informed her that this process could not possibly be as difficult as she was making it, and suggested that she do better with future prospective patients.

resp.text: Ms. Aeneid, this is Dr. Pivovarov. I apologize for the incident that happened to you at our office, I was not aware of this. If you still looking for a provider for your family member please give us a call and I will personally make sure it will be addressed appropriately. Thank you for bringing this up.

name: Suger Ice
text: It is a very nice clinic and excellent doctor and staff.

name: Brandon Rogers
text:
If you stop taking patients at 8 don't post your hours as open till 9

And then don't be rude when you have someone come in who is in legitimate need at 840 pm crying

I mean, where is your medical ethics here, not even a single patient in the waiting room, and tell a patient to leave and go to the ER when it was not a medical emergency in the middle of a covid pandemic.... Your front desk person tonight should be fired for being so dismissive and rude!

Like legit fired!

And what the owner says below is a lie... What the patient needed was strong antibiotics and pain relief from a large oral infection... The patient only saw the front desk person who has no medical degree... She was denied access to even have the Dr look at the issue... Her oral surgeon was appauled they sent her away as well! "patient should have been given antibiotics and pain management and instructed to follow up with surgeon in the morning.... An ER trip was completely un-necessary and urgent care was the correct choice given they were open"

Don't try to hide this bad review with your comment... It was earned!

name: Jenna Mountain
text: Wonderful doctor and staff! They really seem to care about any issues you may have.

name: Tam's Natural Solutions
text: Thanks god I finally found a doctor for a busy small business owner.   His hours are so perfect for me.   For the 1st time in 12 years my blood pressure is under control.   I feel so much better.   .

name: Richard Morgan
text: I really appreciate your extended hours. Good for you, keep up the good work.  I was truly impressed with your nice facility and the caring staff and friendly can do attitude and smiles. The Doctor was TRULY AMAZING, as well as the front desk staff were incredible. THANK YOU ALL SO VERY MUCH!!! You have a customer for life.

resp.text: Thank you.

name: Annette Spindle
text: I was very impressed with Dr. Pivovarov and the staff at this after hours clinic.  He took the time to listen to me and discuss the issue I had been having for days.  Ran a rapid test to confirm.  Very convenient and quality care.  Thank you!!

name: H S
text: I highly recommend this practice; the doctor and his staff are top-notch. Other doctors incorrectly diagnosed me, causing my issue to worsen. Dr. Pivovarov saw me immediately and carefully listened to all my concerns. He diagnosed me correctly and prescribed me the right medication. I made a turnaround overnight.

name: Gene Pack
text: Very friendly! Very fast! We will definitely use them if we ever have another after hours issue.

name: Kim Whitson
text: Casey at the front desk was very professional. Dr. Pivovarov was very thorough. I highly recommend Custom Family Care.

name: Melissa Perkins
text: Extremely clean! Polite, professional and friendly service.

name: Taylor
text: Polite, communicative, honest. What more can you get?

name: Joe Bama
text: Awesome place and quick service

resp.text: Thank you.

name: Rhona North (SC Assailants)
text: Great service!

name: Znar Barwary
text: Dr Mathison is absolutely AMAZING. However the front desk nurses are extremely rude and unprofessional. There has been many times where there is a miscommunication on their end but my parents who are senior citizens and long time patients have to accommodate to them instead of the other way around. The reason I gave 1 star because of the front desk nurses (2 in particular).

name: Brenda K.
text: Okay....I had my first appointment today and I’m SO HAPPY!  Everyone is so nice and I can tell they love their jobs and their patients.  Everything is upbeat—no gloomy I-don’t-want-to-be-here faces.  First impression, besides the nice, professional ladies at the front counter, was WOW!  The patients were seated hardly any time in the comfortable seating area before they were called back.  No yelling about how they are waiting too long, etc.  I only sat for maybe 15 minutes and I was called in at my set appointment time...AMAZING!!  My new doctor is DR. MATHISON.  She is a 5-STAR doctor, and rightly so!  She is very friendly, thorough, and genius minded!  I loved her in the first 10 minutes.....okay...maybe less time.  She covered everything and allowed plenty of time for two-way conversation.  She made sure to give me time to ask any questions and tell her about my medical history.  So, if you plan to make an appointment here, it will be a GREAT DECISION! :)

name: Susan Layton
text: Dr. Mathison has been my doctor for many years. I love her! She listens to what I say, and she takes what I want into consideration. She explains everything we're doing about all of my issues, and she's always quick to respond if I have a question. I have referred several friends, and now they too are long time patients.

name: Ginger Holt
text:
Dr. Mathison is thorough and caring. She remembers her patients and is interested in all aspects of their health and well being. She considers the whole patient. She is more than medically capable as well.  All these characteristics make her a rare find among physicians in these current days.
Highly recommended.

name: Joseph Chambers
text: On today’s date, my wife called Dr. Mathison’s office terrified that she was having a heart attack and looking for help. She has always loved her doctor and trusts her. When she called today she was told that her doctor wasn’t available . Trying to put her mind at ease and just simply see someone for help she asked for the staff to give her a Urgent Care referral . She was told no and to go to the ER. When she responded that she didn’t want to spend that kind of money she was told “it’s better than being dead.” She then said “ you guys have been so kind today” and then front desk staff hung up on her.

name: DEBORAH Gatwood
text: This was my first time to see her , I have searched for a  general physician to get established with for my health care needs . She took the time with me asked questions and listened to me , doing follow up blood work to see where I am at and where I need to be .  Very relaxed atmosphere . She wanted to make sure  I am being treated by all the correct doctors needed for  my health care.

name: Melissa Ohlrich
text: Took my son here today. What a GREAT experience we had. Not ONLY do they genuinely care for their patients,  but they charge a reasonable fee to see a doctor which was incredibly helpful since we have no insurance.  Great people, clean office and knowledgeable.

resp.text:
Melissa,
We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your experience! We hope we can continue to treat all of your healthcare needs!

name: Kristin Marie
text: This place is amazing!! Heather at the front office is so caring and sweet! I've been late before and she still remaind kind and sweet!! Dr.Morgan the nurse practitioner is amazing!! I hadn't seen a doctor in over 10 years because of the way I had been treated. She made me feel welcome and safe!! She answered every question and has took care of every need I have!! This place is the best!! Thank yall so so much for being so kind and so attentive!! I'm not afraid of going to the doctor anymore because of yall!! Thank yall so much!!❤

resp.text: We are so very happy you enjoyed your experience with us. We hope to see you again soon.

name: Malee List
text: The staff at this facility is very professional and just amazing. They went above and beyond to help us. If you contact the facility they will not hesitate to get back with you. The scheduling process was seamless for whatever your needs are.  Even thru the Christmas Holiday they were available to assist us. Today you can not find that level of personal care at a time like this.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words. We deeply appreciate our patients and treat each and every patient as if he/she was a member of the family. Happy holidays and have a blessed day!

name: marlene tew
text: I'm new to area went right in no wait great experience they were friendly and great people I highly recommend I saw Olivia she was great I highly recommend and thanks again 😊

resp.text:
Marlene,

Thank you so much for your kind review! We are so please you enjoyed your experience. We hope you continue to come back and see us for all of your medical needs.

name: Ryen Katherine
text: I used their Huntsville Rapid Test Program for quick COVID results and was really impressed! They communicated well, delivered the results quickly, and  were very helpful. I will be using their program again for my next COVID test!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! We are so happy to hear your enjoyed your experience. We try to make everyone’s experience as positive as possible.

name: Bobby Dempsey (Sambo)
text: Great staff and doctor...

resp.text: Thank you for leaving such a kind comment. Have a blessed day!

name: Sugar
text: I had a decent experience in her office. The staff was really kind and helpful but I had an allergic reaction to an antibiotic and was told she would call in another. It has been over 48 hours and no one answers the phone so I went to the office and it is closed for for the past 2 days. They must have closed right after my initial call. I don’t know what’s going on. I really thought this was a good clinic till now🤷‍♀️

name: Josh Congress
text: Not a good Doctor will give out all of your personal medical stuff without your consent. Will write prescriptions to drug heads that sell them. My father like to died and her office about two months ago what she did .....I don’t suppose to tell you this because I could lose my license . You made a big mistake when you came for my father and me personally. You was my doctor and still was but I’ll be taking this matter to the Medical Board .  Your license need to be revoked. That’s not all this lady call me USELESS,A CROOK. Y’all better wake up this isn’t a good Doctor

name: clang theo
text:
This doctor has some serious issues.  First of all, the staff is rude and will never let you talk to a nurse.  Secondly, the wait time is ridiculous.  Your appointment may be at 10am but you will sit there until 2pm at least! And the waiting area is always packed.  Furthermore, the attitude of Dr. Travis vacilates between happy and upbeat one minute and moody and snappy the next.  She cut out one of my mother's medications and when she asked her why she refused to tell her. Who refuses to tell a patient?!
Stay away if at all possible.

name: Matthew helveston
text: Dr. Travis was a great doctor she was the only one that took insurance in this area the other doctors around here charge two $300 a visit.  Is she back open now

name: Julia Fowler
text: She is a horrible doctor. Prescribing meds that most people dont need. My mother sees her and has been sick real bad lately and having real bad problems.  Was just informed today that this doctor has been shut down. I knew from beginning she wasn't no good.

name: Chelsea GLenn
text: Is this office permanently closed?

name: Asmita Virgo
text: Good

name: David Sweet
text:
These are some of the rudest people l have ever encountered. You cannot get anywhere with anyone in person, or on the phone. They like to hide behind the phone so they can continue to be rude and then put you on hold for so long in hopes that you will hang up.

I understand there is construction going on, but why would you allow them to park their machinery or put their supplies in the handicap spots. Handicap parking is already limited, especially van accessible spots.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Sweet, we would like to discuss this matter further. Will you please call our office at 414-5900 and ask to speak with the operations manager so that we can help resolve any issues that may be. All the best, and we look forward to hearing from you soon.

name: Abigail Laird
text: I've had constant pain for years now and because I'm young the doctors feel "uncomfortable" trying more serious treatments even though I'm losing my whole life to this pain. For over 2 years I have had to wait 1 to 2 months for my doctors appointments and every appointment they tell me the same thing and go in circles with me, refusing to progress treatment. On top of that when they reply to reviews they copy and paste the same message over and over again. They are not listening to me and they won't listen to you. They don't care.

name: V White
text: At first doctor was nice the first few visits. Then the doctor started to act like he did want to be bothered. Came in leaned against the cabinet acting like I was a waste of his time. Yesterday stated he didn’t keep track of my health that I saw specialist for that let them keep track of my seizures and heart. He was only there for general things. But yet he is required by law and my insurance to keep track of who I see and my medical records. To which he demanded I find another doctor all because my disability lawyer asked if he could give his opinion on a form since he was to be talking with all doctors he referred me to. The billing and customer service department of the group believe that I got what I deserve and the doctor is correct. I am a person that has seizures and has AFib and has not been driving since a wreck to where this is the second general practitioner has refused to listen as a doctor should. And force me to find another doctor and the cost of losing everything because of they don’t care.

resp.text: We would like to discuss this matter further, so we encourage you to call our office at 414-5900 and ask to speak with the operations manager so that we can help resolve any issues that may be. All the best, and we look forward to hearing from you soon.

I would highly recommend A.M.G.

text: If you have a bill you can’t even make an appointment. They are going to constantly push that bill in your face. Not only that Dr. Carlos doesn’t care about his patients. name: Deanna Davis
text: I love the docs n staff and the fact that they are right at my hospital

text: Fast and efficient!!
