name: Sarah S
text: If you want to waste your time using this Dr's office then this is the place for you! I have NEVER in my life dealt with a medical office with such poor service. Whenever you call this office to leave very important information concerning your health, asking for a NURSE to call you, be prepared to wait days (thats even if you get a return phone call) The Dr seemed like a very concerned physician however his nurses like to treat patients like their the Doctor! I had one nurse who called me back after 4 days and she tried to tell me she knew exactly what the Doctor had ordered me to do with a certain medication and when i ask her how she knew, she tried to tell me she was in the room with the Dr. which I called her out on because she wasnt in the room with the dr and I. A lady by the name of Jordan was, this ladies name was Gloria! When I confronted her and told her NO MA'AM you were not in the room Jordan the dr and myself were the only 3 people in there that day, she put le on hold and later came back to the phone with a different attitude, but informed me that my Dr was out of town and guess what HE HAD NO FILL INS.. I have worked in the medical field and bo that Drs cant just leave their patients without ANYONE to help them with their medical needs!! Long story short I went without my medication from Thursday until the following Thursday! 7 FULL DAYS!! It was no big deal to this lady at all!! I have gladly found another physician and I honestly wouldn't take my animals to this office!! So again if you want to deal with getting the run around THIS IS YOUR PLACE, IF NOT DONT BOTHER EVEN MAKING AN APPOINTMENT!! I will be reporting this medical office!! Thanks for wasting my time Alabama Medical Group!! Maybe dr Rubenstein needs to stick with being the mayor and retire at being a physician!!!

resp.text: Hi Sarah,we value our patients greatly and ask you and all of our patients to feel free to provide feedback about our services. We really would like to discuss this matter further so that we can help resolve any issues that may be. Would you mind speaking with our operations manager about your experience?

name: Janet Newburn
text:
I don’t normally write online reviews, but this group is terrible.  The Doctor’s and staff are nice, but lack professionalism. I see Rubinstein at the Saraland location and Siegel at the Springhill location.
The wait times are off the charts. When you ask why you are waiting so long, they either just look at you or push you to another waiting area. My time is just as important as theirs. I was at the Saraland location today for over 2 hours. I saw Rubinstein for approx. 4 minutes. Routine checkup.
The staff has not the first clue about what’s going on medically with patients.  I have been called with incorrect information regarding my results, I have had to tell them what they were supposed to be doing per visit with Doctors.  I have been scheduled for a procedure that was ill prepared then I was forgotten.
Office Managers, are you reading these reviews?
Patient care should come first and far most at all times.  The staff in these offices should be more concerned with this than what they are having for lunch.
I walked out after seeing Rubinstein today after I was left sitting to have blood drawn. (I know how long it takes to draw blood)
I’m sure they couldn’t care less! Sooner or later this junk is going to catch up with y’all.

name: Howard Rhodes
text: They wouldn't call in my blood pressure medication while I was out of town, And had much attitude about it !  So I had to find a new doctor.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Rhodes, value our patients greatly and ask you and all of our patients to feel free to provide feedback about our services. We really would like to discuss this matter further so that we can help resolve any issues that may be. Would you mind speaking with our operations manager about your experience?

name: Becky Kidd
text: I am so very thankful to Dr. Jonathan Siegel and his wonderful staff. Each person was extremely helpful, professional, and caring to me, from the initial consultation with Dr. Siegel, to follow up after my procedure.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Ms. Kidd. We're glad to have Dr. Siegel as a member of our team and are so glad you shared your feedback with us.

name: SHANTA EDWARDS
text:
This is the worst group in the Bay Area PERIOD!! I was turned away because I couldn't pay $110 on a previous bill that didn't even belong to the Dr I was seeing! I made arrangements on this bill and have been paying monthly but this DR refused to see me still!! All the money that I've paid and my insurance have paid and this is how I'm treated!!! I'm not asking for special treatment, just trying to be treated!

I am in severe pain and I am ashamed for this group that they would care more about money than they would helping care for their patient! What kind of medical practice does this!!!!! Only money hungry ones. I will NEVER come back to this establishment nor will I recommend them to anyone. I am going to share this story on social media as well, to let people see how these practices are letting patients suffer because of the almighty green dollar. It is not right nor is it fair. I could see if I had NEVER paid them anything, but to pay every month even with me not even working, makes this situation not only sad but despicable and down right disheartening.  Thanks so much Alabama Medical Group and your doctor's for always putting money first over patients!!!!!!!!!!!

resp.text: Hi Ms. Edwards, on behalf of Alabama Medical Group I apologize that you feel this way. I've spoken with the customer service rep who assisted you today and I have reviewed your file and there seems to be some inaccuracy's with your statement that I'm hoping we can clarify. If you will please call our office at 414-5900, our operations manager would like to discuss your visit in further detail. Thank you and we look forward to hearing from you soon.

name: Kaitlyn Franklin
text: These doctors are the most neglecting, ill mannered doctors I have ever come across and not to mention horrible communication and listening skills. And then they’ll continue to pass you around to many other doctors because they don’t have the means to help. My family and I decided to pull from this doctors office today. Never again.

resp.text: Hi Ms. Franklin, we value our patients greatly and ask you and all of our patients to feel free to provide feedback about our services. With that being said, you left no details about your experience that resulted with you leaving us with a 1-star review. We really would like to discuss this matter further, so I would like to encourage you to call our office at 414-5900 so that we can help resolve any issues that may be. All the best, and we look forward to hearing from you soon.

name: Karen Bozant
text: The doctors are great and the lab techs work quickly. I'm amazed that I don't have long waits like other places. They get to know you and not just push you through their office.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback Ms. Bozant!

name: Deanna Davis
text: The docs are wonderful caring kind people. The staff are precious. A blessing!

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-star review and the positive feedback. We are so pleased to hear such kind words about our staff.

name: Cliff Wright, Sr.
text: One stop shop for all things internal. Have seen many of the doctors for various conditions and treatments and all are knowledgeable and professional. My personal favorite is Dr. Don Sanders; you won't find a more caring and compassionate doctor anywhere, especially one that actually listens to (not just hears) his patients. Front desk staff does leave a lot to be desired as they are young and tend to be rude and impatient, but you're not there to see the 'staff' so just blow it off.

name: Betty White
text: Hands down the best group I have been with! I would definitely recommend this place as not only the best on the coast, but probably the best in the country!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Mrs. White. Our healthcare team at Alabama Medical Group takes great pride in creating an environment where patients receive quality, individualized and compassionate medical care.

name: Caitlin Brown
text: The WORST doctors office I’ve ever dealt with. These people are ignorant and incompetent. Horrible horrible staff, do NOT recommend .

resp.text: Hi Ms. Brown, we value our patients greatly and ask you and all of our patients to feel free to provide feedback about our services. With that being said, you left no details about your experience that resulted with you leaving us with a 1-star review. We really would like to discuss this matter further, so I would like to encourage you to call our office at 414-5900 so that we can help resolve any issues that may be. All the best, and we look forward to hearing from you soon.

name: Lacey McElderry
text: This is a great doctor's office. The staff and the care that you will receive is top notch. I highly recommend the delicious dietitian program.

name: Kacey Young
text: Waited two hours for my mother to see a doctor for a scheduled appointment. Then the front desk was very rude. Never apologized for the two hour wait. They are overbooked. Shouldn’t have to wait all day for appointment.

resp.text: Hi Ms. Young, we're sorry to hear that your mother's appointment ran late, but unfortunately due to the nature of our business sometimes this happens. With that being said, we never want our patients to be unhappy and we apologize for the unpleasant experience. If you would like to discuss this matter further or if we can reschedule your mothers appointment, please call 414-5900 and ask to speak with our operations manager and she will get her scheduled.

name: R.Allen Crowe
text: So I just retired from the United States Navy after 28 years of service.  My family and I moved to Mobile, Alabama for our last move as we intend to live here for the rest of our lives.  Well as in any place you live there are many good things and there are not so good things that you experience.  We just came across a not so good thing and that is the Alabama Medical Group, P.C.  We were only with this PCM and the medical group for 3 or 4 months when we received in the mail a letter from them dismissing one of my family members.  The letter did not state any reason why only that they “need to do this from time to time.”  When asked why our family member was dismissed their representative would not provide a reason and on top of that they were rude during our phone conversation.  As a Navy Captain (retired) who has been to many places in this world along with my family who have been with me through all of that,  this has been the most disappointing experience of my career and was upsetting for my family members.  As a result of this,  my entire family has now changed PCMs.  I hope this feedback will help the management of Alabama Medical Group to self reflect and make some changes for the better. In the meantime,  I would not recommend this facility if you are a veteran as I assume they do not hold the veteran status as important.  That is strictly my impression.

resp.text: Capt. Crowe, I've looked into the situation involving your wife's experience at our practice and due to HIPAA compliance regulations there is very little I can comment about her visit and post publicly on the internet. It's unfortunate to hear that she had a negative experience, and I would like to encourage her to call our office at 414-5900 and ask to speak to the operations manager or the marketing director so we can discuss the allegations in your comments above. One comment that I can, and would like to address, is your statement saying that we do not support veterans. That simply is not true. In fact, several of our physicians currently serve in the military, along with members of our staff, as well as their spouses. We appreciate their service to our country along with yours and the other men and women who chose to make that sacrifice to protect and serve our great nation.

name: Trevor Clifton
text: I may be partial, but Alabama Medical Group is the best practice in Mobile! I will definitely continue to use my physician and the organization for any needs that they are able to assist with.

resp.text: Trevor, we don't think you are being partial at all. We appreciate your 5-star review and positive comments!

name: June Reddix-Stennis
text: Just left the Alabama Medical Clinic Walk In Clinic, I was refused service first because it was 4:15pm but the Facebook page says the close at 5pm and the website says they close at 4:30pm, either way I got there at 4:15pm so she said they couldn’t see me because they cut off at 4:15! Then she asked if my primary doctor was in the group, my response was no but I have two specialist in the group, so she then informed me that they couldn’t see me because I didn’t have a primary doctor there. The website says nothing about having to already have a primary there! Either she was lying or the website is giving out bad information! I just drove all the way from west Mobile to go to the walk in clinic and couldn’t even walk in! Wow! I’m sooo disappointed, someone really needs to correct this problem, it’s so unprofessional and so was she! My visits with my specialists there have been great but the Walk in Clinic needs work!

name: Laurie Watson McKay
text: My surgeon was Dr. Scott. He was fantastic and very down to earth. I would trust him to cut me open anytime! :-)

name: Jennifer Schuller
text: Internal Medicine Center is made up of a group of kind, caring and compassionate physicians who are highly skilled and trained to take care of all of your healthcare needs.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-star review and the positive feedback. We are so pleased to hear such kind words about our staff.

name: Robert Johnson
text: i like Dr Carlos and think he's a good dr but I wish the waiting time wasn't always so long to see him.

name: Frances Moore
text: I found that the Doctors at the center are helpful but the staff are horrible.  They are not concerned with the patients health.  They are not helpful and when you are sick you want to be able to see the doctor.  I was told that I could go to their urgent care facility the next morning if I was having a problem.  Horrible staff I would not recommend this facility to a dog.

name: Bo Lambert
text: Best doctor...Dr Arnold....nice to know some one cares when you go in...and oh by the way..WDE..DOC!!!

name: Neal Hattenstein
text: Dr Alan Shaine is my Doctor and he is a womdeeful doctor sits with you and exam .just great bed side mannnee

name: tammy beard
text: The facility itself may be ok. Idk. But , in my opinion, Dr. Amy Strasburg is rude, vapid, unprofessional and would be better suited for a career behind a cosmetics counter. If you go there, ask for a different doctor. And be prepared for each and every visit to take two or three hours. Apparently, their system completely collapses on a regular basis.

name: Rebekah Graham
text: Everyone is friendly and Dr. Hayden Long is the best.

resp.text: Thanks Rebekah, we are so glad to have Dr. Long as a member of the AMG team!

name: Daniel Crocetti
text: Great team of professionals, providing excellent care.

name: Mohamad Sahyouni
text: Horrible.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Sahyouni, we're sorry to hear that you had an unpleasant experience at our practice and would like to discuss the details of your experience. Would you mind if our operations manager contacted you to discuss?

name: Janet Harwood
text: Sometimes when a new system is implemented  efficiency suffers some, however the staff is very friendly and patient. Each time I have an appointment, I’m in and out within 30 minutes to an hour max. I’m so grateful to have them as my primary care provider!

name: Rosalie Toney
text:
I highly recommend Dr. Smitherman! he is very knowledgeable and caring doctor and willing to listen to patient health problems and will give a solution for it.  My husband and I are in Good hand. Thank you Doctor Smitherman.
From: Mr & Mrs. Toney.

name: De Be
text: Terrible! His nurse or staff would not refill my prescription for viagra or slidenafil because I hadn’t been to his office in a year. Well guess what , I haven’t been sick to need a visit. Why would I go when I’m healthy especially during COVD? There are online Doctors so you lost my business!  Terrible!

name: Tim Slusher
text: This guy obviously has more patients than he can handle. I was told it takes a few days to be approved as a new patient. It took over 2 months to get a call back. Good thing I didn't wait on that call. Do not call, look elsewhere!

name: Penny Erwin
text: I trust Dr. Smitherman, he is alway very nice and has taken care of me for several years! His staff is great!

name: Carol Reese
text: Excellent doctor and staff! Highly recommend him.

name: Michael O’Dell
text: I heard nothing but great things about this office and staff. I was referred to Dr Smitherman month ago and called to make appointment with staff. Went through the process of being approved being that they are selective on taking more people on as I was told. Received a call to make appointment and I scheduled one that was a week out. Received another call from Natalie (front desk clerk) telling me they need to move my appointment due to training on new equipment for the office. It was moved to Oct. 21st at 2:30 but then received another call from Natalie telling me something came up and needed to move again. I agreed to change again being that I’ve been needing to see him for some time. It was moved to Wednesday 23 at 10:30am. I arrive and Natalie tells me my appointment is for Thursday. I made it very clear over the phone with her about my schedule. Off on Monday and Wednesday I go in at 12. I would not have another off day till Tuesday 29th. I would not recommend. I’m in retail business, plus have to be a service to customer issues and would never expect to keep my business Or clients with such terrible customer service.

name: Tiffany Carter
text: Love Dr. Smitherman and staff!  He has been my primary for about 5 years.  He is a great listener and that goes a long way!!  His staff is super friendly.

name: Dennis Dease
text: Dr Smitherman has been my family physician for 27 years.  He is a fine doctor who is easy to talk to and listens well.

name: David Strickland
text:
Dr. Smitherman has been my doctor for approximately 30 years.
I couldn't ask for a better doctor.

name: Jason Wilson
text: I absolutely loved Dr. Serpas. She sent me for tests until I finally got answers. Brown sequard syndrome and a syrinx on my spine. Was sorry to see her go, but my treatment did not suffer in the least. Tori is fantastic and continues to help me more than any other place I've been.

name: Billy Manning
text: I have to say as far as the staffing it's some of the nicest most kindest people but as far as the nurse practitioner taking his time to listen to what is up and just write you off I give him a thumbs down. Refuses to give test results on labs refused to do any test to find out if someone had anything other than covid. Even said he'd call in meds day of visit in sub freezing vehicle visit of labored breathing patient which was Later found to have bronchial pneumonia. He needs to get a better bed side manor. Not everyone is seeking drugs just to be healed.

name: Cynthia Sanford
text: They have taken great care of me for the past 3 and a half years. I have type 3 diabetes along with other medical issues.

name: Elaine R
text:
My son (18 years old) needed a last minute physical and COVID testing.  His regular MD was not able to see him until a week later but Southview was able to get him in the next day :)
He absolutely loved the staff and the provider he saw.  He even asked if he could start going there instead of to his local MD that is about 5 minutes down the road.  Thank YOU ALL for a great experience for him

name: Heather Shirley
text: I been having problems for years and couldn't get answers till I went here.

name: Sam L
text: This place was REALLY needing new staff!! I am amazed and thankful for the new staff and how kind/attentive they are. I had a bit of a doozey experience with Dr. Luke, she's a great doctor but I wasn't pleased with her attitude... But that was last year and things may have changed since then. I love Dr. Gallagher and Tori, all of the nursing staff are fantastic and couldn't ask for better treatment. I've recently started going back and I wish I could give this place more than 5 stars because that's how ridiculously good my experience has been. Thank you Southview.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback!! We appreciate you!

name: Fresh Princess
text: I had the worst experience here. After arriving to my appointment 45 mins early I still waited 1.5 hours in the waiting room. Then an additional 45 mins in the exam room. I kept telling myself it would be worth it. NOT IN THE LEAST! Dr Luke was so RUDE! She wouldn’t let me speak and treated me like she had to get me out of there ASAP. Will never go back even if I’m bleeding out. Also, there was a dead roach in the exam room.

name: JA B
text: I was assigned Dr. Eileen Gallagher as my PCP when I moved to the area. She has extraordinarily unpleasant bedside manner, which I believe is as important as clinical skills, which I also found lacking. With her cold, crass and condescending personality, I am surprised she sustained any customer service-related profession in The South. She does not participate in anything electronically, Rx’s, medical records, etc. She is so old, she is unfamiliar with current medical treatments. Her nurse practitioner is excellent. Dr Gallagher is the only remaining physician at Southview Clinic. The other physicians have left, and Dr. Serpas is leaving soon.

resp.text: We are so sorry to hear this. If you would call our office and speak about this to our clinic coordinator, we would love to try to resolve this issue. If you have been to our office, you were more than likely assigned through insurance to Dr. Gallagher, but saw a different provider, as Dr. Gallagher is not taking new patients and has not been for some time.We encourage you to call our office so that we can try to better the experience for you and others in the future.

name: Grenade Quick (Grenade)
text: Worst excuse for a doctor’s office I have ever seen. People only come here because they are assigned by Medicaid. I am one of those victims. Dirty floors, dirty walls. Impersonal doctors, who seem they would rather talk about random small talk than your illness. Often forgets to call in prescriptions to the pharmacy. Long waits, for no results.

resp.text: We are so sorry to hear that you had a bad experience. If you would like to call and speak about this to our clinic coordinator, we would appreciate it so that no one experiences these issues again.

name: Jana Avellana
text:
I am not fond of this doctors office at all.

Cons:

They NEVER answer the phone. I have to call at least 5 times before I can get an answer. One time I attempted to contact them for days just to get a refill called in for my sons Epi pen. If I was on my phone leaving this review I would screen shot my call log to show that I called 6 times in the last 30 minutes with no answer.

You can try leaving a message but your call will not be returned.

When they do answer they never have appointments.

When you are lucky enough to get an appointment your wait time is going to be at least 2 hours.

Pros:

The facility is very clean

Since they never have appointments they are very good about referring you out to other doc in the boxes so that your insurance will cover the cost of going elsewhere.

Most of the staff is friendly.
......................................................................
On our first visit they couldn't wrap their heads around why we were actually there. My son needed a referral to have allergy testing done, the only way to get one is to visit your primary care physician. They kept asking if I wanted to get him monthly shots for his allergies or an inhaler even after I had explained several times why we came.

The school year is almost over and they still haven't called me in another Epi pen refill. I am sharing mine with the school daily....

All in all if it wasn't for the fact that I live in the boondocks and I don't want to have to drive 30 miles to a doctor Tricare approves I would NEVER keep this doctors office.

name: Benny Pendergrass
text: The doctors really want to help you if they give you medicine and you don't think it's working or good tell him they change it they trying to help people like doctor Supposed to very nice and friendly

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback

name: Donna Behan-Flores
text: Great Doc!

name: John Killian
text: Terrible excuse for a staff

resp.text: We are so sorry to see this. Over the past few months, we have changed a lot of the staff and we hope you will give us another chance!

name: Cheryl
text: I love Dr. Walker. She truly cares about her patience and takes the time to listen to you. The people at South Baldwin Regionals Medical Center are friendly and the office, bathrooms and patient rooms are clean.

resp.text: We love hearing about these experiences! If there's anything we can do for you in the future, we are happy to help!

name: raven gale
text: Autumn Walker is awesome. I switched to her from another doctor who just wasn’t getting it done. Dr. Walker knows how to get through to me, which isn’t easy. I’m glad I found her!

resp.text: We are always more than happy to assist in the future.

name: pam baker
text:
Dr. Walker is an excellent doctor. I am a nurse and have worked with many.  She listens, is thorough, up on the latest meds and a good bedside manner.  I hope I can continue as one of her patient/client.

Thanks,

Pam Shelton, RN, BSN,LNC

resp.text: We love hearing about these experiences with our team! Thank you for your feedback.

name: Gretchen Witbeck
text: Dr Pound is a very knowledgeable and caring Doctor that I have been seeing as my GP for over 10 years. I would highly recommend her.

resp.text: Thank you; we appreciate your feedback!

name: Dee C
text: Dr. Pound is a very good doctor gives good health advise and she is direct with healthy decision making, her advice was great for me she never let me down with my health needs, I hate to see her leave, and she don't have much to say but Dr. Pound keeps darn good notes in my health reports, that's what counts for me as well.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!

name: Katie Shrader
text: This office is well organized with COVID precautions. Everyone did their job in a timely manner and all were attentive except the person taking vitals and checking history. She didn’t acknowledge that I had a hearing problem and could not understand what she was saying.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to Dr. Pound and her team.  We appreciate your feedback, as we are always looking for ways to improve.

name: Lord John A Coefield
text: I was seen about 5 minutes after arrival.  Was treated welcomely by the staff.  Dr Pound took the time to answer my questions, go over meds info and more.  Smooth and positive experience

resp.text: We strive to provide great experiences. Thank you for your feedback!

name: mariea bridges
text: Dr.Pound has been my primary dr.for over 20 yrs.Can't imagine having anyone else when she retires.Always soft spoken,kind,patient,always worked me in no matter how busy ,how booked when i needed to be seen that day.I will miss her always and am truly grateful for all the years she took care of me.I wish u a wonderful retirement.God Bless You.Sincerely,Mariea Bridges

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!

name: Kathleen Lynn
text: Each visit with Dr Pound runs smoothly, even with Covid restrictions. Staff is always helpful and Dr Pound is the best physician I have ever had.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review! We are happy to pass along your comments to Dr. Pound and her team.

name: Willie Simms
text: Provided excellent medical care in brief time.

resp.text: Thank you; we appreciate your feedback!

name: Barbara Swader
text: I have been a patient of Dr Lora Pound for many years. Pleased with service.

resp.text: Thank you; we appreciate your feedback!

name: Larry Pruitt
text: Very pleased with the quality of service received on my office visit Monday 1/13/2020.

resp.text: We appreciate your positive review about your recent experience with us!

name: James Shinn
text: Arrived early, very short wait. All the vital statistics basics done quickly. Short wellness exam, bi-anual blood work up and overall health discussion and medication review with DR. Pound. 45 minutes to total in-out and recieved a follow up phone call to discuss my lab work 3 days later. Office very organized and effecient, friendly staff.

resp.text: Mr. Shinn, we are very pleased we could provide you with a positive experience!  We are happy to pass along your comments to Dr. Pound and her team. Thank you and have a fantastic day!

name: Viola Ellza
text: Dr. Pound was great! I was in so much pain the night before, and was convinced I had a UTI or a kidney infection. My insurance requires me to see my primary care doctor during regular hours, so I walked in to her clinic, and it was her half day, but she took me in anyway. I am so grateful, she prescribed me some medicine, and had me feeling better within a few days. Very caring doctor!

name: Christian Majors
text: What can i say...Dr. Lora Pound is the BEST primary Doctor i have ever Had in my life .This Doctor is proffesional, Caring and Polite. Yet at the same time she is Honest and not one to sugarcoat things. She has backbone...i respect that. I have a lot of health problems. She and her refferal mgr. Terri have sent me to some great specialist! The office mgr. Terri is really courteous and helpful!! Her receptionist Jackie and Sheila are always professional and polite!! Last but not least 2 of her nurses Vickie and Sonya are Amazing Ladies!!!!  They truly are concerned with patients overall health. I would highly Reccomend Dr.Pound and her staff to anyone!!! Dr. Pound has dedicated her LIFE to help saving LIVES. It is more than a proffesion to HER. It was and still is her CALLING. Again,  Doctors have limitation to what they can and can't do. She is truly thourough and to the point. Honesty goes a long way with me. I thank God a friend reffered me to her. She truly has helped prolong my life!  I shall not soon forget it !!!!! Thanks again to her Entire Staff!!!!

resp.text: Christian Majors, we are very happy we could provide you with a positive experience! Your recommendation means so much to us and we're so happy to have earned it. Thank you again for taking the time to share your positive experience. Have a great day!

name: David Barber
text: Routine check up with a trip to the lab for bloodwork.

resp.text: David Barber, thank you for the star rating!

name: Howard Bates
text: Good Doctor

resp.text: Howard Bates, thank you for the star rating!

name: carlie Morgan
text: I never been I guess its OK mabey

name: Jess
text: Did not care for her much. She seemed uninterested in my problems.. will never see her again.

name: Veronica Cram
text: I can not say enough great things about this office.  The entire office team is extremely professional and nice. They always follow up when they say they will, and, I get all lab results electronically faster than I have ever even received a courtesy call from any other physician's office.  I love the technology and customer service.  Great job all around.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind review.

name: Chelsea McCool
text:
Utterly the worst doctor and worst care you can receive in Huntsville.

Update: They kick you out of their practice if you leave a bad review instead of trying to understand what they did wrong and correct it. Not but a couple days after leaving this review I got a letter telling me they would no longer see me and that they would transfer my medical records as a "courtesy". When I say the worst care, they obviously made a clear example of how they work by booting me. What kind of practice is malicious like this? AVOID.

Copy of letter added since I've found it.

name: Bob Burkett
text: My friend and general practice physician retired, so I was recommended to visit Dr. Kara Wallace by one of her former Nurse Practicioners.  That was almost 2 years ago.  I have found Dr. Wallace and her staff to be excellent.  Dr. Wallace is professional and truly concerned about my health and well being.  She is current on the latest medical issues and technology.  I am completely satisfied that I made the right choice in a family practice physician and she earns a rating of top notch!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review.  It is our goal to have each of our patients feel as you do.

name: Cristina Hinkle
text: Dr. Wallace and her staff are always helpful and looking out for my well-being.  Appointments are always timely and I love being able to as questions and review information anytime on the portal.  My work environment is not private, so it is nice to be able to ask questions during the day with privacy. I have been going to Dr. Wallace for many years now and they have always fit me in when needed and kept me healthy. Thank you all.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Nicole Gropp
text: I have had great experiences with the office and medical staff. I always get in quickly, and I like how homey and clean the office feels. I also appreciate their online patient portal and automated appointment reminders.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Andy Kramer
text: I'm new to Huntsville, I just called to see if this practitioner was accepting new patients.  Was told to come to the website and complete paperwork, upon completion and review I would be called for an appointment or notified of rejection.  I asked if my insurance was accepted, the nice lady said sorry I can't answer that, your paperwork must be reviewed by the doctor and head of staff.  I communicated that I would not waste my time if my insurance would not be accepted.  I again asked if my insurance would be accepted, the lady said sorry and that she understood.  I replied I will take my business elsewhere.  First impressions count!

resp.text:
This is unfortunate, and we apologize for the miscommunication.  As a result we have begun asking our new patients if there is health insurance and who their carrier is.  The initial form we have all new patients fill out before making an appointment is very brief and, in part, helps us to ensure we do accept your insurance.  A  the list of insurances we work with can also be found on our website.

We hope you have been successful in finding a new physician.

name: Cathy Jones
text: Dr Wallace and her staff are friendly and professional. I’ve been going to Dr Wallace for years . It’s like visiting family when I go for a visit. They are always on top of making sure I have the best health care available. I drive from Decatur for my appointments with her that’s how much I trust her

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Ian Miller
text: I have never had an issue with Doctor Wallace or any of the staff at her office. My entire family has been able to visit Doctor Wallace's office for years without any issues. The office environment is warm and welcoming, because the staff are always kind and courteous. We strongly recommend Doctor Wallace.

resp.text:
Thank you for taking the time to give your kind review..  We appreciate the 5 stars!
Stay safe.

name: Lloyd Newman
text: I have been a patient of Dr. Wallace for at least 20 years, maybe longer.  Anyway, I have always been treated with respect, courtesy, and dignity.  Hard to beat her and her staff.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!

name: adriana Lane
text: Very unhappy with the the way they nickel and dime. I had my daughter go on a well visit and wanted to refill her Asthma medication. So because Asthma was mentioned it's a chronic visit.  Charge  (1)..same daughter has an overnight field trip so papers have to be filled out.  Charge (2) 25.00. Really? What kind of Dr. Office does this? Never experienced this ever! Will be looking elsewhere for a Doctor you can bet your nickel on that!

resp.text:
We do not charge for all forms that our patients request we complete for them. Some forms require an appointment because of the time or information required. Often, forms necessitate researching a patient’s history, medications, labs and other correspondence. This then becomes the liability of the practitioner who signs the form. And then there are some forms that are much less extensive and may be filled out at the end of our patient schedule. (Though this policy is among the policies addressed in the new patient paperwork, you can also view our policy on third party forms on our website.)

Regarding the incident in your comment: the two forms that we did complete for you at the time of your visit were completed at no additional charge. The other three pages that you brought in later and that you asked to be filled out while you waited required unscheduled time that we had to manage without affecting other patients. We are sorry you thought that charging for this was unreasonable.

We do understand the frustration with the other charge you mentioned, but that is due to insurance rules. Guidelines state that a wellness visit addresses health maintenance and illness prevention. Once we address other issues and prescribe medications in treating those issues at a wellness visit, it becomes a different kind of appointment. Depending on the agreement between patients and their insurance carrier, patients may have a separate copay for this office visit.  Because of this, some doctors require that a separate appointment be made, entirely. We opted to address it during the one visit to spare an additional trip and any additional time away from work or school-- something for which most of our other patients are grateful.

name: Sonia B
text: I have had only excellent experiences at Dr. Wallace's office. Everyone has been professional, caring, and supportive. I appreciate that it is a small friendly office without a mob of people in the waiting area coughing and sneezing.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Alex McCool
text:
I do not recommend coming here.  I came here a few times for basic physician care.  It is worse than most walk-in-clinics I have been to.  They do not really listen to you or care, they just give you a prescription for symptoms and send you on your way.  Every time, I waited between 30 minutes and an hour past the time of my appointment before being seen.  They really like to request lab work from the same place, which seems suspicious to me.  Almost every time I went, they filed the insurance wrong.  Double check that everything is in network before they do it, because they will file however they please and screw you over.  If you are desperate, don't want to go to a walk in clinic, and just want a prescription for your symptoms would be the only way you should go here.
I had pain in my hip/groin area, they did a urine test and requested STD testing (I'm a married man), told me they would call with results and work on figuring out what was wrong.  I waited a week with no response, when I called, they said oh your STD results were fine, just take some Aleve for the pain.  They do not care what is wrong with you.
Update: if you leave a bad review on Google, they will send you a letter informing you that they are terminating you as a customer. As if you needed any more proof that they do not care about your well being.

name: Hannah Akridge
text:
I left this doctor for two reasons.

1.) They made me pay a missed appointment fee, which I had cancelled far in advance of the actual appointment. They told me I hadn't cancelled this appointment.

and

2.) I initially went there because I was severely deficient in Vitamin D. Their suggestion was to keep on doing what I was doing (which was taking a multivitamin). This was confusing because I had been doing this for a while, yet I was still obviously deficient (I had my blood work done at a clinic after developing symptoms and brought this to them). I told my mother this, who has worked in the medical field for many years. She called them to talk about it. They then called me, as if it was their idea, and told me to take an additional 1,000mg supplement. When I told my mom this later, she told me this was her suggestion to them.

resp.text: We're sorry that you feel this way! Our practitioners take great care to remain aware of the latest medical research and, when relevant to a patient's interest or well-being, to convey any changes in treatments that may result from that research. We understand that, sometimes, this information conflicts with what our patients want or expect to hear. However, when we are aware of research that indicates high dose vitamin D supplements are unsuccessful/unnecessary (https://www.aafp.org/afp/2018/0215/p254.html), it is unethical to prescribe that a patient take more of it. While we cannot force our patients to take or to avoid some vitamins or supplements, we do convey the relevance, necessity, and side effects of these vitamins or supplements during their appointment.

name: Angela Jackman Howard
text:
First of all, as someone who's been alive for a few years, I always hated going to the doctor. Most of the time, if you don't feel like you're being rushed, you feel like you're being patronized while they dismiss your concerns. This office does not do that. The doctor and nurse practitioners ask questions and are willing to listen to suggestions. They do not always tell me what I want to hear, but they are willing to discuss concerns related to the issue for which I've made an appointment. If I have a question or a concern, I can send a message through the portal and get an answer within a reasonable amount of time.

Second of all, I would hate to be a physician who has a business listing on Google, because you're a sitting duck for people who either DON'T have much experience with any doc beyond their pediatrician or who have unrealistic expectations of what most physicians can or should do. It appears most people are more willing to spend the effort to blast a business than to approach the people who run it to try to achieve some mutually positive resolution.

resp.text: Thank you!  We appreciate your review and believe others will as well.

name: Joe Shaw
text: Not sure why they're only rated 2.9 out of 5, I've been coming to this doctor for the last 3 years and they've been very professional and very accommodating. If you have a pressing concern they can see you that day. I can't imagine going to another office.

resp.text: Thank you!  Our patients are important to us and we make every reasonable effort to accommodate their schedules and needs.

name: Ypsilanti Rox
text:
Rude, insensitive and inconsiderate staff that doesn't take the time to really listen to the reason you need an appointment. On hold for 13 minutes. You won't see a doctor here, BTW, unless you're super lucky. Nothing against NPs at all, but I think having a MD's name on the practice when you rarely see one is a little odd.

Other places treat you better. Go to those other places.

resp.text: In an attempt to corroborate the information provided in this review and correct any potential issue with our patient services, we realized we are unable to verify that any part of this review actually occurred. Beyond the reviewer's choice to provide questionable specifics, all of our patients are made aware of and agree to (when registering as new patients) the way we integrate our nurse practitioners into our scheduling and patient care. (If a patient schedules an appointment over the phone or through our website with Dr Wallace, that appointment is scheduled with and will be with Dr Wallace. However, if patients need an immediate appointment with our office and Dr Wallace is booked or unavailable, we offer appointments with one of our very capable, considerate, and frequently-praised nurse practitioners.) If our staff ever does behave in a way that is inconsiderate or unprofessional, we ask that patients bring this to our attention directly so that we may correct it.

name: Leslie
text: The office staff is absolutely rude and unprofessional. Completely do not understand the urgency of needing an appointment. Could give me an appointment if I was there in ten minutes, but I told her I could be there in 15 mins, therefore I was unable to get an appointment. This is absolutely ridiculous and I will be finding a new doctor.

resp.text: We hate to hear that you feel this way about your experience. All of our patients are important to us, and we make every reasonable effort to accommodate their schedules. We also make every reasonable attempt to avoid making our patients with scheduled appointments wait in our lobby to be seen because of another patient that may arrive 10-15 minutes late for an appointment. For this reason, in the instance you described, we were only able to offer you an appointment for 10 minutes out, later in the afternoon, or at various times through the next two days. We hope you understand.

name: Marjie Lewis
text: Great staff and excellent care! Dr. Wallace paid attention to my concerns and was very knowledgeable.

resp.text: Thank you! Dr. Wallace and her staff work hard to provide the best possible care to all of her patients.

name: Kenneth Bryant

Karen Anthony, Office Manager

name: Terri Cranford
text: Do not use this Dr. Over priced clinic with no lab and no on site x-ray machines. Out of pocket will cost you $150 which is ridiculous because he is not a specialist of any kind. In fact he is not a great family dr. Don’t expect any emphathy or ethical practices here. If you don’t have insurance tough. I have on several occasions said when I was well and had great insurance that I needed to find another dr. I was lazy because he was convenient. I over looked the fact that my Mother was his patient and she died a needless death from Colon Cancer because he didn’t do a Colon test. My family should have slapped a malpractice suit on him. Then I’m having to file disability and I have no insurance and I’m waiting on an appt next month. I call and beg for one month of a script to be called in. No. I was told to go to the emergency room. I have been on this medication for over 10 years. The effects of not taking it is dangerous. He was only worried about $150 not a request from a center that is helping me and he has done same thing before with my maintance medications.  I plan on filing a formal complaint also but go somewhere else even if it’s a doc in box. Also last antibiotic he wrote me out the pharmacy caught it. Severe side effects with the blood pressure medication I take. It could have killed me. Retire unethical person you are not worthy to be a dr. Get some compassion!!!!

They treat you like a total stranger instead of someone who is sick. I absolutely hate this place and if I would have been aware of where i was being taken to in my condition I would have suggested somewhere else immediately..

name: Wendy Burgess
text: I was recently admitted to this hospital and I had nothing but an awesome experience all the way around. From the housekeeper's, dietary, lab techs, and cna's to the nurses and doctors. Even anesthesia during my unexpected surgery and the recovery nurses were wonderful. They were all very attentive to my needs and checked on me regularly and made me feel like they cared. The nurses would come in at the beginning of their shifts and introduce themselves and were there for me all through each shift, no matter what I needed. And the doctors were like clockwork rounding early.  I never had to wonder when the dr was going to come see me because they were there every morning to see me at the same time and let me know what was going on with my care, test results, etc. I couldn't have chosen a better hospital to have to be in for 4 full days. I can not thank the staff enough for the quality of care they provided. I would definitely recommend anyone to go there.

name: Karen Thomas

name: Terri Watkins
text: I have been Hospitalized here twice in the last couple of months and have had 2 visits to the ER, each experience was great, from the Drs. on call Dr. Macbeth and Dr. Jon Yoder, both went above and beyond trying to get to the bottom of my problem and they did! The whole ER staff was very caring and concerned and I have no complaints at all! The entire Hospital staff was very accommodating and showed true concern from the Lab employees to the ICU staff! If applicable I would give a bigger rating......awesome service!

name: C D
text:
Worst hospital experience ever!
Like another person wrote, you walk in with an ailment, but will be treated for something completely different.
In my case I was seriously bruised up from an accident. Dr. Elizabeth Bataglia came back a couple of minutes after a urine sample was taken and told me that I didn't have any injuries from the accident but that they would treat me for an STD instead, right in front of my fiancé!

We went to a different health care provider a few days later, who also took urine samples from the both of us.
They said they would send it off to a lab to get a correct result.
It came back negative!

We have been together for years, so how could I have an STD according to Dr. Bataglia but not according to the lab?!?!
Obviously someone (the staff, nurses or doctor) made a serious mistake in giving me an incorrect diagnosis, and simply being diagnosed with an STD is an embarrassment in itself!

This hospital and their personnel should be ashamed of themselves for not taking patients nor their health seriously!

That was the last time we went to this hospital. Ever!
They don't have to worry about us coming back.
We will be going to a different health care provider from now on!

Unless you want an incorrect diagnosis, Stay Away from Atmore Community Hospital!

name: PoBoyFlowCHE
text:
Took my fiancee to the ER a few days after being released from a better hospital due to kidney failure from a severe infection. The staff is rude, unprofessional, and they do not seem to care if they help you it all. Seems like they just want to get you out instead of taking time to actually investigate and treat your ailment. I walked outside to make a phone call to my fiancee's family to inform them that she was sick again, and when I came back in the lady at the front desk rolled her eyes and very rudely stated I was not allowed to see her per hospital rules. So if you have a loved one dying don't expect to be able to say goodbye in the emergency room at this hospital.

All in all a very negative experience and she didn't receive any treatment at all. In my opinion you are better off taking your loved one or yourself down to Mobile or Pensacola if you have an emergency and the time to get there.
