name: Sofia Rivera
text: The doctor is lovely and seems to care. I wish I could say the same for their front desk staff. Spent 5 months trying to be seen as a new patient, and after 2 or 3 cancellations on their part I finally was seen. The doctor ordered labs to be drawn at an offsite location in Foley. No big deal. I call TWICE, one the day after my appointment and one the day before my labs were to be drawn at quest. Your office assured me both times quest would have all of my information and lab orders. I went out of my way to ensure this would be a smooth process because I had never been to that lab before, or an office that required me to go elsewhere to get my labs drawn. I even told the lady I spoke with that I have an appointment at 9:15am at quest tomorrow and she assured me I didn’t need to do anything further. I starve myself the night before, stress about how many pokes it’s going to take, get everyone in tow (husband and kid), and off we go. I get to the quest office early and they state they do not have my order form. Okay. Why not? So the lady very kindly calls your office for me to inform you I’m there for my blood draw, need to know which tests... an hour later still nothing. By now I have long missed my appointment, have had to watch screaming children run through the lobby by overwhelmed parents, and for what? I had to leave quest and physically go to your office ($$/gas/time/sanity/still starving) to get my lab order form. Spent 20 minutes in your office just waiting on that. It took half an hour to get to your office from quest due to traffic. By the time i refueled and looked at the time I just didn’t have the time to go back today, I have other obligations. This was such a disorganized mess.

name: Terry Lockhart
text: The most professional and friendly Clinic I've ever been to.

name: Tracie Nichols
text: I have personally known Dr. Birkenhauer and several members of her staff for several years. Dr. B is someone you can trust and she extremely caring, friendly and knowledgeable.

name: Charity Belle
text: Best bedside manner. She's very engaging. Always end my visits with a hug. Don't know what we would do without her.

name: Don Kilbourne
text: Dr. Birkenhauer and her nurse take care of my family, including some very complicated cases.  They are incredibly loving, kind, and super detailed taking care of us.  They are as efficient as they can be with their work load and people getting sick as often as we do these days, I am so grateful they are here in Gulf Shores / Orange Beach. !!

name: Ivan Rodriguez
text: I am military and was referred to Dr. Birkenhauer as a new patient from tricare due to Hurricane Michael’s evacuation from Panama City Florida. I have called their office multiple times to make an appointment only for them not to answer the phone. I went into the office and filled out paperwork to get seen and they said that they would contact me. It has been a month and I have not heard back from them.

name: Angela Kuenzle
text: Always a positive experience sometimes wait times are long but she's a busy lady.

name: Carmen Broadway
text: Very friendly staff. Love the MA!!! He is great!!!!

name: Isaac Stooksberry
text: Been going here for over a year now. They are always friendly, and thorough, truly seem to have my best interest as a priority.

name: Sandra Egbert
text: The staff is incredibly rude.  Every call I have with them they are pushy, short, inconsiderate and very matter of fact.  No need to treat anyone this way.

name: Cheryl Brown
text:
Service was good but tried to contact them about my prescription, by leaving a message and the next day spoke to one of the doctors . I understood that I’d get an additional  medication. He said that he’d check on it and call right back. I’ve had no response to my requests. Very disappointing.
It’s very difficult to get a person through the automated service. I have yet to get through easily.
The menu is very time consuming and frustrating.
The positive is that the doctors were friendly and seemed knowledgeable.

name: Taylor Teel
text: Incredible staff that was very helpful.  They saw us right away, knew that it would require some extra care and attended to our patient very well, making sure that he was well beyond OK before they left.  5 stars.

name: Luanne Heslin
text:
I just returned from MainStreet Family care
! Fantastic care. All of the staff were tops!
Allison,Mariah,Keanna and Teresa went way above
Making a very upsetting visit ok! So professional
And courteous. I will return.
Thank you for everything! 10 stars in my book!

name: Delaine Gibson
text: The staff were extremely nice and helpful. The were pleasant, even at the end of a long 12 or 13 hour day spent helping others. I'm very thankful they were there and treated me with care and respect.

name: Noah Chizanskos
text: Staff did not help elderly couple, who stated that they did not know how to use the tablet for their visitation. My wife helped the couple, as I pictured. Staff at front desk has not batted an eye in their direction. This should be concerning for anyone worried about covid, as the staff handed the tablet over without gloves, the couple used it, and now my wife is using it for the couple. This is a lack of standards.

name: Deb Haze
text: This clinic is like a well oiled machine!  Such a breath of fresh air.  Everyone is extremely kind and professional.  Pam is exceptional at her job and I will continue to come here for care solely because of her.  Well done!

name: Kevin Kennedy
text: Awful! The lady at the front desk was not friendly at all. You have to check in online There is no other alternative for people that may Not be comfortable with using online services. While I was there an older lady came in and said she didn’t know how to use the services and they tried to give her a tablet instead of helping her and said they couldn’t help her. I told the lady that I would help her and then asked for a number to complain and the front Desk host went to the back and got two other employees who came out to me and told me that she wasn’t rude, when she was being rude to me , and then they threaten to call the cops on me when I committed no crime. I would never recommend them to anyone! You go in there not feeling well they are supposed to make you feel good about yourself and treat you. Not put you through more torment!

name: Casey Fuller
text: The online check in and texting process really made my visit enjoyable. I didn’t have to sit and miserably wait in my car or in the lobby for hours. Instead I was able to wait at home and they simply text me when it was close to my time. Lobby was clean and staff was very friendly and helpful.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing, Casey! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Mike Parrish
text: I’m pretty sure I have a kidney stone. I registered, paid and waited. And waited. 3 hours later and I noticed several people had been called that arrived after I did. I’d rather be in pain at home. Or if I want to wait 3 hours, I can go to my regular doctor. DO NOT go here unless you have a day to waste.

name: Tannic Blu
text: The Staff Is Very, Very Friendly. My Visit Went Very Well, and Without Any Hassle. I Would Strongly Recommend This Urgent Care Clinic.

name: SarahAnn Southerland
text: Very nice waiting area with refreshments available, however, every time I have gone (3 times), the wait has been hours long. Would not recommend going here if you just want to get it in and get out.

name: Carly Byrd
text: I have been a patient at too many clinics to count. I have never felt more comforted while feeling ill than I did at MainStreet. The extra mile they go to here is unmatched. Free waters, juices, Keurig coffee, even play books and toys for the children! In/Out less than one hour. Highly recommend.

resp.text: We are so happy you had a wonderful experience. Thank you for taking the time to write this review!

name: Shontae McCants
text: I was in a car accident the day before and this Urgent Care gave me the hardest time about seeing me saying I had to go to the ER first. Even though I was told by the paramedics and police officers to go to the Urgent Care. In this day and time who want to go to the ER for a headache! The girl at the front desk left and wouldn’t come back to assist me I end up walking out and going to another urgent care facility. Very unprofessional!

name: Ashley Watson
text: Amazing customer service and care!

name: Belinda Reed
text: Will never go back . 3.5 hour wait. Staff was arrogant wouldn't listen to anything I tried to tell them. BP was elevated tried to explain I have had a lot of stress NP answer was I have a lot of stress but my BP not up.

name: Abigail White
text: The lady at the front desk was nice but I waited 6 minutes at the desk before she was there, I asked for a corona test, stated that I was showing symptoms yesterday and was still told to take a seat in the general waiting area. I proceeded to wait and sit near all of these people for an hour and 45 minutes before having to leave for another appointment, never got the test, i’m really hoping they find a more efficient way to test than using entire rooms for a nose swab when they could just quickly do it so that the other people there don’t potentially get exposed.

name: Kameko McLemore
text: Fast,  friendly service, with VERY minimum wait time! I've been before and I will certainly go back!

name: Bill Dorminy
text: Went early to get a "rapid" test for covid. There were already 30 people in line. 3 hours of standing in the sun with at least another hour before I would get through the door was enough. I knew I would have to wait, but there are numerous ways to offer good customer service and not have people standing in the sun for that long. Obviously customer service is not a concern of this facility.

name: Qiana McMillon
text: I am here this morning and there was a white woman with short blonde hair that was so RUDE to me and my husband. She made us move because we were in “employee parking” with no sign to show that and then she wouldn’t even answer my questions about testing! I would never come back here seeing that I had to drive over an hour to get here and be treated like this!! Management needs to be looking into who they are hiring.

name: Tim Ooten
text: Care by the Medical Staff was good. But I sat in the Lobby for more than 2 hours. Thank God I was not there for nothing urgent. There is no Urgent in the Valley Urgent Care.

name: Jessica Tomas
text: Went in and had a great experience. I was told that we would not get billed for my service after asking multiple times. A few weeks later was greeting with a bill so called the urgent care back and the receptionist/nurse who answered the phone was super rude. Would not recommend.

name: James Pridgen
text: The ladies at the front desk were rude and dismissive. and States that they were too busy to answer the phone. I had driven over an hour to that clinic because they were doing the rapid Covid testing with no appointment needed and when I got there they had signs on the door. I was told that there website had the correct information and when I showed them the information from their website I was told that there is nothing they would do about this. I told them that I had called numerous times and never was able to speak with someone and had I known that this would the case I would have not wasted my time. Then I was told that they were just too busy and didnt have any to answer the phone. I have attempted to contact a Manager with no success. I would not recommend Using this place as in their word are "Just too busy" and they dont even give you a bit of common courtesy.  --

name: Jonathan Hall
text: 6 HOUR WAIT..Showed up first thing in the morning 14th per person and still waited 2 and a half hours in the sun then 3 hours in the waiting room. Employee didn't like someone referring them as0 the DMV and told him to leave and not come back.  She can refuse service. Stating dont go to six flags then. I had to find out my results just so I could go back to work. If I can help it I will never go back again.

name: Anthony Murphy
text: Very nice people and was quick and very professional and made me feel at ease

resp.text: Thank you, Anthony!

name: Ravyn Walton
text: I went In on Monday night 10 minutes before closing with my daughter and the RECEPTIONIST had a very bad attitude kept checking her watch and told me I would have to hurry and get my paperwork done because they are closing in 7 minutes.  So the doctor finally calls us back and she got us in and out very promptly and was accurate and very polite. Told us wait at the front desk for the school excuse. Still checking her time the receptionist finally finished the excuse and calls my baby last name. Sits our excuse on the counter  without saying have Z nice night or anything.  I stated if you dont like your job you should find a new one because people come here sick you know you will have stay until the last patient leaves.

resp.text:
Hi Ravyn,

We really appreciate you reaching out about your experience. That's certainly not the kind of visit we want our patients to have. We will follow up with our staff accordingly. Thank you again for brining this to our attention!

name: corwin heard
text: At Main Street Family Care they are so nice to you and take good care of you. I feel so much better. Thanks to them

resp.text: Thank you for sharing Corwin! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Tara Bryan
text: Went in this morning feeling terrible! The staff were great and I felt like Doctor Allison Strickland genuinely cared for me and how I felt. Offered me treatments no other doctor has before..... definitely recommend them!!!!! Keep up the great work Mainstreet Urgent Care!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Tara! We are so happy that you received everything you needed!

name: Tabitha Truitt
text: I took my son on New Year's Eve and as expected it was busy.  The reception area was clean and the exam room was clean. The Nurse Practitioner we saw was very nice. However, the receptionist that spoke with us as we came in greeted us by telling us how long the wait would be and what she would need to check us in. No hello or welcome. This was in a tone that was clipped and fast. Now it may have been her idea of an efficient greeting, not mine.  Every question asked was met with this same snappy tone. I also was not impressed with the nurse assisting either. No one wants to work on a holiday, so don't. But, if you have to, accept it and do a good job.

resp.text: Hi Tabitha! We appreciate you sharing your thoughts. This is not the typical MainStreet experience we strive for and your concerns will be addressed. Thank you for the compliments and we hope your son is feeling better fast!

name: Mary Willaims
text: From out of town and my friend has COPD. We called to find out what time they closed and was told 8. So we load up, arrive only to be told and I quote....."it's a minute til 8 we're closed".........my friend explained and was told "you can go to the hospital" with NO concern NO CARE in her voice at all. There was no one in the lobby, parking lot empty....so beware they do NOT CLOSE AT 8 THEY CLOSE BEFORE 8

name: Tyronica Marshall
text: Took my daughter in running a fever. Receptionist is rude and clearly prejudiced. We walked in first and she sent couple of different race back first. Btw...I'm African American. Never again will I take my child back. Lady came to front apologizing after I heard their conversation from the back. Apology was not sincere. Beware of the RACISM!!! Only gave 2 stars bc they took her back after the lies...

resp.text:
Hi Tyronica,

We appreciate you reaching out with your concerns! We'd love to be able to follow up, and if you have a minute, would you mind emailing us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com with your daughter's name and DOB so we can review her chart? Please be sure to include any other specifics about your visit and interactions with the staff. The way our system works is that we pull patients back in order of when we get their completed intake form, not necessarily who walks in the door first. Regardless, our leadership team will look into this. Thank you again for contacting us and providing us with your feedback!

name: Craig Waters
text: Love this place

name: Michelle T
text: I came to this place to see about an issue I was having at 8:38am on a Saturday morning.  The receptionist was rude and ignorant. If you can get past Becky at the front desk then you will be fine. The rest of my experience was fine. Rated a 3 because of the receptionists stupidity.

name: Debra Wilson
text: Nice place,  clean. Staff very helpful and kind. I would go back or recommend them to others. They are all very young and have some things to learn abt patients but to me they were very efficient.  The only real problem is getting someone on the phone. Maybe they are very busy. But I think they do a very good job.

name: Ambriah Howard
text: Great experience and the Staff was very caring. Did not have to wait long either which is always a plus!

name: Lindsey O'Steen Doughman
text: It all depends on who’s working. I have had a five star experience here and I’ve also had a negative star experience here.

resp.text: Lindsey, we're sorry that we missed the mark with your experience this time. We strive to provide consistency. We'll be sure to meet with our team so we can provide you the experience you deserve--each and every visit!

name: Sherrad Hayes
text:
This office does a great job!!!
I've had some real bad experiences with places like this in the past but the professionals in this office are super. I have no complaints and highly recommend them.

resp.text: Thank you so much Sherrad! We try to help every patient heal and feel better, FAST! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Jenna Brown
text: We also had a very positive experience at Main Street!  The facility is new, spacious, and clean with extra touches like free coffee, water and juice in the waiting area.  Staff was kind and service was quick.  They were so good with my son!

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to share these kind words! We hope your son is healing better and feeling better FAST!

name: Alana Stewart
text: I went to Main Street Urgent Care for a severe cough. I did not have any other symptoms except for the cough but went because I didn't want to be constantly coughing at work and Dayquil wasn't helping anymore. I left with out any real diagnosis and a prescription for an antibiotic and a cough medicine. The cough medicine had absolutely no effect and after finishing to round of antibiotics there was no change in my cough and it has only gotten worse. I called up there to see if they could potentially reexamine me. Unlike every other urgent care that I have ever been to they told me I would be charged a copay to be reexamined. If I had known this was their policy I would have gone to an urgent care in Auburn like I usually do as they care more about me getting better than me paying a copay and don't charge one for reexaminations. They did call in a new cough medicine prescription however it is a decongestant even though I have absolutely no congestion symptoms. It was also not covered by my insurance so I was forced to pay out of pocket. I will not be returning to this urgent care in the future. In my opinion it is worthwhile to drive to the Auburn area to see a doctor that can actually diagnose me and make sure I leave happy and healthy.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear that you didn't have a positive experience, that is certainly not our goal or intention. We always strive to treat everyone like family and our patient's health is always the first priority.

name: Angie Higgins
text: omgggg what an amazing experience my daughter and I had. I actually felt important and not just "another patient". We received great service from the moment we entered the door by the receptionist to the very back. The young lady who assisted us (Tikerah) was very kind, gentle and patient with my baby. I would definitely recommend!

resp.text: Thanks so much Angie! ❤️❤️

name: Jen Evans
text: T.Brock was extremely sweet and nice! I went in on a Sunday and got out within no time would definitely recommend this place.

name: Zane Everitt
text: Great service. In and out in less than an hour. Everyone was very nice. The rooms were clean and complimentary coffee and water were a bonus. Definitely recommend this facility!

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to share these kind words! We hope your son is healing better and feeling better FAST!

name: Felisha Mccullough
text: Paid $30.00 on a test was told to come back an get the results went back for the result I was told It was to late because a miss understanding of the time and date( Ididn't get my results of the test and they refuse to give me my money back and said I have to pay another $ 30.00 for another test really I don't think so)

resp.text: Hi, Felisha. We'd like to learn more about your experience and see if we can help clear this up. Would you mind emailing us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com with your contact information? We look forward to speaking with you.

name: Megan Coggins
text: 2 months ago, I would have given 5 stars; However, 2 days ago, one of the nurses in the clinic refused to treat me. He said that they would see me, but wouldn’t send in any medications because of me being pregnant. I was very disappointed because I was also pregnant 2 months ago when I had the flu and was given a prescription by the same providers. Thankfully, the Urgent Care in Opelika doesn’t discriminate against pregnant people. Will definitely tell everyone not to go here.

resp.text: Hi Megan, we appreciate you taking the time to reach out to us. Pregnancy can certainly make getting the right treatment/prescription difficult, and we certainly attempt to do all that we can for every patient. I would love to get more feedback from your visit. If you could, give me a call at 205-739-4876 or you can reach me by email at AJames@Mainstreetfamilycare.com.

name: Chancy Rudd
text: This place is awesome!!! I took my wife in for stitches. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We were in and out very quickly and we received exceptional care. I definitely recommend MainStreet Family Urgent Care.

resp.text: Thanks, Chancy! We're glad you had a great experience, and we appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Urgent Care!

name: Nicole T Tansmore
text: No one never answers the phone or calls you back.😔

name: Elizabeth Abner
text: I am feeling so much better. This is my second visit. Everyone was nice and kind.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review! We're glad you're feeling better!

name: Calan Ray
text: I received great from Tikerah and the entire staff. Tikerah was so nice and helpful.

resp.text: Thanks Calan!

name: jeff carter
text: Very positive experience, short wait time. Katherine Gamper was physician that saw me and she was very professional and diagnosed my situation. Again very pleased with the service.

resp.text: We are so happy you had a wonderful experience. Thank you for taking the time to write this review! We agree that Katherine is one of the best!

name: Kimberly Rose
text: The staff here is amazing! They were willing to help any way possible and the wait time was not long at all!

resp.text: We are so happy you had a wonderful experience. Thank you for taking the time to write this review!

name: outshined72 (kimmyshimmy72)
text: I wasted my time going there. I was having a bad time after a flu shot. There was a tech who felt the need the need to diagnose me in the waiting room and the NP came to the door and basically made me feel like an idiot. Good job folks.

name: Ashley H
text: By far the best doctor place I have been to. I've been sick alot, and I went to the hospital twice and they did nothing & didn't prescribe me any antibiotics or anything. Even the regular doctors that I have been to down here, they just tried to get me in and out and didn't listen to the ssymptoms that I told them that I was having. I love all of the doctors and it is the best place to go if your sick

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to share these kind words! We hope you are healing better and feeling better FAST!

name: Alicia slaughter
text: I really appreciate the fast and friendly staff

resp.text: Thanks so much Alicia!

name: Mike James
text: great clinic. In and out in no time. courteous staff

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to review our clinic! We're glad to had a great experience :)

name: Jody Walker
text: Exactly what Urgent Care was designed to be. Friendly and helpful staff with a genuine concern for my well-being.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind words Jody! This is exactly the experience we hope to deliver to every patient!

name: Anne Smith
text: They were very nice and kind, l went there for severe pain from sciatic nerve flare up, l could barely walk because of the pain that was on the 18th, today lm walking, thank you Dr. Nicole Groover for knowing how to help me!!!!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing Anne! So glad we could help you feel better, FAST!

name: Sherika Scott
text: This is the best thing to happen to Valley, Al as far as doctors go! Their building is nice and clean. They have complimentary water/juices/coffee. They even have other snack items that you can purchase. The wait time is short. The receptionist is very caring and understanding. The nurses are nice and friendly. The doctor seemed to be good. And they even have a treasure chest for the kids after their appointment is over. They accept medicaid unlike most urgent care centers which is caring in itself! But best of all these wonderful people actually do a follow up call to check on you 2 to 3 days after your visit and even if everything is going well they ask you to call back if anything changes. I can honestly say i love them!!! Laneir Hospital sucks (negligent and life threatning misdiagnosis', rude, long wait) -please avoid them and make mainstreet your place for emergency health issues! I now know they are indefinitely mine 😊

resp.text: Thank you so much Sherika! We're glad you had a great experience! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Urgent Care!

name: Bob Gay
text: Great staff, Great service. Recommend to anyone in need of fast and friendly service.

resp.text: We are so happy you had a wonderful experience! Thank you for taking the time to write this review!

name: Mandy Cain
text: The establishment was very clean. The receptionist was very rude going in and leaving. The nurse or tech (not sure what she was) was extremely rude. They put me in a room, she came in and talked to me then told me the provider would be on the screen shortly and I could explain my condition to the provider. I was completely confused - she wouldn't explain anything to me. I had to finally get firm and say please explain to me what a provider will be!!! She said the Dr will be on the screen and you will see the dr by internet. I said NO I will not agree to that. I came here to see a Dr not a screen!!! She was so expressionless and had zero personality. No bedside manner at all!!!!! Very Rude!!! She was shocked I wanted to see a live provider -i said NO I want to see a DR. in person!!! Then she said a live provider would be in soon. I felt like I was in a science fiction movie!!! IT was very awkward and confusing. If I had not waited forever to get back there I would have walked out!!! The DR finally came in and I expressed my concerns. She apologized and told me she was very sorry and she understood my confusion and my concerns. She was very very nice!!! Then the nurse or tech (what ever she was other than very rude) came back in and gave me a shot and told me to walk out front to the lobby and wait on my meds. That is all she said and walked out!!! I went back to the lobby and sat down. I was in there going on another 30 minutes and asked the receptionist if my meds would be ready soon. She was very rude!!! IT was the holidays BUT you it is your job!!! I could have drove to Stop Watch in Opelika and been out for the time it took me at this establishment and received much better care!!! I do not suggest anyone to take time out of their day to see this establishment!!!!

resp.text:
Hi Mandy,

Thank you for reaching out and providing feedback about your visit. We apologize that your experience was not satisfactory, and we will be following up with our staff. Can you tell me the date of your visit? We are always striving to improve, and I hope we’ll have another opportunity to help you feel better FAST!

name: Debbie Wood
text: Great facility.  Katie is professional and  diagnosed my problem in a timely manner.  I received a follow up call to see how I was feeling.

resp.text: We are so happy you had a wonderful experience! Thank you so much for taking the time to write this review!

name: Taylor Harper
text: Cna that took my vitals was very rude . Asked her if I could bring my sister back and she said no it’s a hippa violation . I’ve never heard that in my life and working as a nurse I know that doesn’t break the hippa code . Once I insisted that I want my sister in the back with me no if ands or buts , she calls the girl at the front desk and starts to gossip about me and my sister wanting to be together in the room . I don’t see the big deal . Someone really needs to retrain the whole place cause nobody seems to know wth they are doing .

resp.text:
Hi Taylor
We are so sorry to hear about your unsatisfactory experience.  We are looking into it and someone will be contacting you to further discuss your visit. We appreciate your feedback and I hope we can win you back sometime in the future.

name: E'Lexis Edmonson
text: Tikerah was very kind and made my experience better than any other time I have visited.

name: Regina Moore
text: Today I was treated for a sore on my mouth and was prescribed a medicine that i have already tried that was over the counter. I will go to my physician next time. I am not please at all.

resp.text: Hi Regina! I'm sorry your experience at MainStreet was less than a 5 star experience. I'd love to speak with you more about it if you could give me a call at 205-739-4876.

name: Keyal Loveland
text: Clean, friendly, with organic coffees/teas/juice in the lobby. They even have blankets in case you get cold. It's the little things!

resp.text:
We are so happy you had a wonderful experience. We agree about the “little things” meaning so much!
Thank you for taking the time to write this review!

name: Joy Robinson
text: I was very sick went in the young lady up front was very kind get to the back the and one of the Techs that came in to give me a shot was very rude I reported her right then only she knew I was about to report her actions so she spoke to the person in charge ahead of me trying to justify her actions this is not a free clinic and people come because they are sick and need help Quickly my blood pressure was up and I had a sinus infection / cold and I was treated very rude and when I addressed it it wasn't taken serious this happened Sep 25 ,2017  after waiting almost 2hrs to be seen because of them being full

resp.text: We are sorry to hear that you didn't have a positive experience, that is certainly not our goal or intention. We always strive to treat everyone like family and our patient's health is always the first priority.

name: Roniegus Lyons
text: I had insurance but they still wouldn't see me because I didn't have 60$ Co pay. I could have died

resp.text: Hi Roniegus, I apologize you had a less than excellent experience. Unfortunately we don't determine how much your co-pay is, but just go by what your insurance company requires for an Urgent Care visit. Though in any emergency situation, you would want to seek out the closest Emergency Room as Urgent Care isn't intended for most emergency situations. If you would like to discuss this further you can reach me by phone at 205-739-4876.

name: Danny w
text: Most screwed up place I've ever seen.

resp.text: Hi Danny, I apologize that you had a bad experience at our clinic. I would love to hear more about your visit. If you would, please give me a call at 205-739-4876.

name: Jackie White
text: Nice and friendly staff

resp.text: Thanks, Jackie! We hope you feel better fast! Thank you for choosing MainStreet Family Urgent Care!

name: Katie Woodham
text: Excellent experience! Staff is professional, friendly and thorough. Office was clean and well arranged for social distancing. Nurse was very gentle when drawing blood for labs. Very happy I chose this doctor and medical facility!

name: Keith Chilson
text: Dr. Lassiter and staff were friendly and easy to talk with.  Their office was clean and the waiting room was comfortable.  Best of all, there was no long wait.  Dr. Lassiter was warm and congenial.  I would recommend Dr. Lassiter to any who are looking for a primary care physician.

name: Rhonda Robertson
text: Dr. Lassiter is a very caring Doctor. He takes the time to ask if I have any questions and then actually listens.  He does not rush in and rush out. His staff is also very friendly.  I would highly recommend Dr. Lassiter to everyone!

name: daryl goff
text:
I'm really happy with the way I am treated.

name: elijah moring
text:
So i have appt. I go in with two hospitals discharge papers, i hand them to the lady at the front desk and i wait.

I get called in to the room to check vitals and Dr. Lassiter opens the door and tells the nurse that he didn't need the paperwork i gave to the front desk.

Two things: first, he states that if i'm here for pain medication i came to the wrong doctor and second, at the end of the visit he needs to look over my discharge paperwork to determine if i need to go see an ENT or a Pulmonologist.

I was released from Flowers on June 14, 2021, i went to his office on June 16, 2021, for blood clots in both my lungs. This guy was more worried about my sinus issue than he was blood clots. I went in to see him to set up a primary physician and for the issue regarding the blood clots.

After this experience, whether you have seen him or not, i would not recommend this guy for nothing. The only thing he is good at is putting puzzles together and gluing them for "art work".

He is not out for the patient, if he was he would have sent me to a pulmonologist instead of stating "i need to go over your discharge paperwork" knowing they ware in his hands. He didn't do his job so therefore i had to do it for him and set up a doc appt at a doc in Panama City in the middle of July.

I am writing this review because they asked for it, don't ask next time. I also called and spoke with the office manager because Flowers told me i needed to, he didn't do his job.

Choose another doc, this guy will leave you to die. I have literally been in pain since i spoke with him, can't sleep, or lay, on my back because of blood clots, mainly left side, and have yet to get a call for a pulmonary referral.

If i could zero stars. He is ridiculous as a doc.

name: marti massey
text: It is unfortunate to have to give a one star in order to rate and review. Otherwise, this Dr doesn't deserve any stars. My parents were his pts for many years and they adored him. They we're both healthy into their 80s. But when my parents needed more care, he declared there was nothing else he could do for them. After my Dad died, my Mother continued to see Dr Lassiter. I, too, have fought for my parents, just to receive the help my Mother needs. But, you see, my Mother is very sick now- and Dr Lassiter will do 'no more'. No more signatures, no more paperwork, no more just answering some questions for me. I went to his office one day last week. There were 2 people in the waiting area. Yet, every room was full, and he was too busy to give me 5 mins of his time to explain to me why he didn't read the physical therapist notes stating that my Mom needed a hospital bed. I was willing to wait all day for a few minutes of his time, and he sent his nurse to tell me that he couldn't see me until after flu season!  I honestly don't think he can hear or read. Now, with that being said, if you need a very large puzzle put together, he's your man! If you are sick, please don't see this Dr. If you are well and just need some blood work drawn, or if you may just want to visit his office to see his beautiful puzzles hanging everywhere; by all means, go to him.

name: Christopher Senn
text:
Best doctor I've ever seen. Doesn't judge me like all other doctors in Dothan. Dr. Schmitke, whom I've always seen for oral surgery,  refused to even look at a major abscess in my jaw because I asked for a price list. I have no dental insurance so I was going to have to pawn my car title to pay him. I guess he thought I was trying to get charity so he gave me his "next available appointment" on APRIL 2. He told me go to Flowers hospital and have them check it out. I didn't even make it through triage before they wrote a script for the same antibiotic I already had. They acted like I was seeking dope. I went to dr lassiter for an appointment for something totally different. He saw my face and immediately said it was bad. Did bloodwork, helped me in so many ways. What's wrong with you people?  Try seeing it from the doctor's perspective. They are here to help. Would you rather him lie and treat you elderly parents for things that aren't going to help? Maybe he sees it like he could be helping a child or someone who is dying of cancer at 21, or maybe he didn't want them to be in the office during flu season.  Maybe.......I KNOW HE IS A GREAT DOCTOR! TAKE IT FROM ME, YOU COULD BE TREATED MUCH WORSE. GO TO JAIL AND COMPLAIN ABOUT HEALTHCAR. I'm sure he didn't go to medical school to write scripts for hospital beds. Most doctors in dothan would gladly fill out paperwork for stuff like that. BUT THEY CHARGE $50 EVERY TIME THEY HAVE TO.
GREAT JOB DR LASSITER

name: Laura Thornton
text: I've been a long time patient of Dr. Lassiter's and my parents are long time patients.  My husband was a patient and my kids have seen him too.  i used to really like the care Dr. Lassiter provided.  In fact, I've even recommended him to friends in the past.  However, over the last several years, I've totally lost confidence in him as a doctor.  Before my father passed away, we were trying to work to get some VA paperwork submitted.  We had worked for a couple of weeks on getting a response from Dr. Lassiter.  Finally got a call from his office on the afternoon we buried my father, who ended up passing away unexpectedly.  More recently, we've been trying to secure a hospital bed for my 90-year-old mother who suffers from dementia and now requires full-time care.  She's had many falls and several months ago, she actually fell getting up from her bed and broke her arm.  Dr. Lassiter suggested we get home health to come do an evaluation to determine if she needed the bed.  Home health came, did the evaluation and in no uncertain terms determined she needed a hospital bed.  Home health submitted the paperwork to Dr. Lassiter and when he filled out his portion of the paperwork, he wouldn't approve for her to get the bed. In another instance just last week, I called his office one morning because my mother had become very ill.  It's flu season, so I wasn't sure if I needed to bring her in and risk her getting the flu, or if he could call some medication in for her.  He had just done a physical on her several weeks prior.  I didn't hear back from his office until 5:00 in the afternoon.  By that time, I had already taken my Mom to the emergency room where she was treated for a severe case of bronchitis.  In the last couple of days, we've tried to get an antibiotic called in for my mom because she has developed a urinary tract infection.  Dr. Lassiter wouldn't do it because he said the antibiotic she was prescribed at the hospital for bronchitis should take care of that too.  Obviously, it hadn't taken care of it or she wouldn't have the UTI.  He told me a couple of years ago when my Mom was very sick that there was just nothing else he could do for her.  And I guess he was right!  Because he definitely hasn't done anything for her since that time!  Just because you're 90, doesn't mean you don't deserve good medical care!  In spite of all of this, he has had some wonderful staff members through the years.  Although, I've noticed he's lost a bunch of good ones over the years.  I can only guess that they got tired of making excuses for him when he wouldn't respond to his patients. I also noticed that he went from being on his own in a practice, then his practice was affiliated with Southeast Alabama Medical Center and now his practice is affiliated with Flowers Hospital.  I have to wonder if there's a reason for all those changes as well.  At any rate, now  he will have two less patients to worry about.  Mom and I won't be back except to collect our records to take to another doctor.

text: I love this place. My doctor Miss Amanda is the best Doctor I have every had or met. She takes her time to explain things with you and She truly cares about her patients. name: Jody McLean
text:
Took me over a month to get my first appointment have seen them for 2 years and I have only seen a doctor once in that time. Today I was out of meds (Thursday before Labor Day) I was called by a nurse who preceded to tell me that I missed my last appointment. I told her that was a phone appointment that I was to be charged $35.00 dollars for so I decided not to take that appointment. I told her I was out of meds and if I could make my appointment for after labor day she informed me that would not be possible. So I am to do with out my Blood pressure and PTSD meds.for 5 days.
The $70.00 dollars that I pay per appointment is twice the amount that I paid in Mobile Al. I believe that I will try a Real Doctors office that care more about patients then their bottom line

resp.text: We apologize this was your experience. We do not want any patient going without their medications. We want to reach out to you, but we are unable to locate you in our system. Please call our practice manager at your earliest convenience 334-664-0463 extension 3329.

text: It's a shame that it's damn near impossible to get someone on the phone to schedule an appointment for my children. The people in the Fort Mitchell  office (Amber and Amanda) are good as gold, it's just the acrobatics you have to go through in order to be seen.

resp.text: Hi Sa'Vaughie, I'm sorry to hear that we didn't meet your expectations for timely communication. We do have other lines of communication in addition to the phone. You can text us 334-203-9398 or email us appointments@preferredmedgroup.com. We hope this will make things easier for when you reach out to us in the future.

text: Only my first appoinment, but Dr Uzzell (Ft Mitchell) listened to my story (condensed version) and offered so many options and new things (medical tests, meds, etc) that the many, many doctors I've seen in the last 7-8 years have not even brought up.  I go back in 3 weeks for a follow-up on a new med I'm now taking and hopefully, all is good and we can get on with the other tests and options she mentioned. The wait wasn't long at all (I'd filled most of the paperwork out online) and the staff was polite and very efficient. I hope all of my future visits will be as positive as the first one. UPDATE 2/10/20 : Great medical practice. Super-friendly staff and Dr Uzzell is great. Happy I am a patient of hers, and Preferred Medical Group!!

name: VONDA “QUEEN OF FORD” BOLDEN
text: The only reason why I am rating them a 1 is simply because I can't give them a ZERO!!! Today was my grand daughter 1st appointment with this office... When her mother got there she was turned around because she didn't have ALABAMA Medicaid and has GA Medicaid... When she made the appointment the office was aware that she was just born in Columbus.... As a matter of fact... The Medical Center referred us to this office since its only down the street from my house... My grand daughter mother gets there and was told... "WE CAN'T SEE YOUR BABY WITHOUT A MEDICAL CARD"... and sent her on her way with a website to switch her medicaid over (which was the wrong web address) She called me and I asked did they even offer her to pay for the visit... she stated no however  she was going to turn around and go ask if I could pay with my card... They told her that it would cost 70.00... When I asked to speak to the young lady, (Amber or Amanda) she got on the phone and I asked how come they didn't give her an option to pay before she left.  This ______ said, "We don't see ANY PATIENTS without them paying upfront... I let her know that MONEY was a problem however you just don't send a baby however when in fact they are suppose to be seen soon after coming out of the hospital... She then gave my grand daughter mother the phone back without saying anything...  I then told my grand daughters mother to leave because at this point I felt like we were taking my PUPPY to a veterinarian and not my grand daughter to a pediatrician... To me they made us feel like she was an un-necessary animal that we just wanted and not what we needed.  We will now do business in Columbus and not even worry about this Pediatric Center... Amber/Amanda whatever her name was... SHOULD BE FIRED!!! She doesn't represent this office in a professional manner!!!

name: Lorraine Hollins
text: I was a new patient at the clinic coming from Atlanta,Ga. with multiple health issues. I have never seen the doctor that was on my medicaid only this P.A. In the beginning Amanda was polite but she later changed after Dr Berryman gave me two injections when I was suppose to have a total of  three injections in three different locations to help ease my pain. The second injections didn't go so well.I wasn't able to complete the three injections.(my right hip,lower back then the left hip) the areas were inflamed. I was in so much pain i couldn't walk. And I had an up coming appt with Amanda. Because I wasn't able to keep my appt with her. She barred me away from all if the medical facilities associated with her... Bottom line if she can't get money from Al. Medicaid too then youre not allowed on the property. Hats off to Dr Berryman he's a caring doctor for his patiences...he's professional in what he does.

name: Valerie Maddox
text: Worst office staff and RN ever. I ran out of thyroid meds and they wouldn't refill. Every time I asked, they said, "after we get your labs back." The RN actually said that in an email to which I attached the lab results, which was 2 weeks after I sent them the first time. I'm not asking for a controlled substance people  - I'll die without this medication. I had to go to another doctor to get my meds, and they said what I thought  all along - that she should have given me enough of my meds at the current dose to carry me over until she got the lab results or whatever else she was waiting for. Also, the Dr. told me to stop taking my NP Thyroid prior to doing the labs because she said mixing synthroid and NP thyroid is dangerous. New doc said that's not true, and based on my labs I actually needed the NP Thyroid and she told me to keep taking it.

name: Penny Vidler
text:
I have not had the best of experience's with Dr. Wright's office.
The first year she was there , for my annual physical she wasn't there so I saw the nurse practitioner , he was great but I was a bit disappointed that I did not get to see her.
Last year was virtual, which was OK.
This year I was told that someone would call me to schedule my blood work, well no one called , so I called them and was told that yes I would need to go get my blood work the next morning since my appointment was in two days . So I was an  hour late for my job to find out no orders had been sent over, and then when I called was told that Dr Wright would send be for lad work after my appointment , so I did not understand this because wouldn't that mean I would have to go back AGAIN to get the lab results . Oh and at the time I called about the lob work I also informed the receptionist that I was now on Medicare and did they accept it, she said yes we do, never told me that because of the change from BCBS to Medicare that I would have to fill out additional forms because now it isn't an annual physical  it's a wellness check ( what a bunch of bull). So when I showed up for my 7:30 appointment this morning , first of all the receptionist ask me what I was there for ( I made the appointment a year ago for my physical , you should know what I am here for)  then I said remember I am no longer on BSBS so do you need my Medicare care?  Oh by this caused a disturbance, Oh we can't see you at 7:30 if it is Medicare you have forms to fill out, we will need to reschedule.  YOU KNEW I HAD MEDICARE !! So they wanted to reschedule , so another hour missed from work and still have never seen Dr. Wright. So No I did not reschedule I walked out of the office !!!!! So mad!!! Dr. Wright may be a wonderful Doctor but I will never have the chance to actually meet her because my plans are to change Doctors Offices .
PVidler

resp.text: We're disappointed to hear of these experiences. Thank you for letting us know so we can work to improve.

name: Tammie Dortch
text: My Husband tested Positive for Covid and the next day my daughter and I became sick.  We drove 40 minutes to this walk-in clinic to get the rapid test only to find out they’ve “reached their limit for testing today.”  So does this mean the PANDEMIC is over??  Or is it not as bad as we’ve been told?  I guess I can just go about my daily routine.  If there’s a limit for how many people can be tested, it must not be such a big deal after all.  Thanks for clearing it up!

name: William Covan
text: Been up here waiting for 4 hours now and there is only 2 other people in the parking lot so why is it taking so long to get seen...id be better off going to the ER at least id get seen faster and get out

name: Jamison Ingram
text: This place refused to test me for covid-19 because I don't have a Credit Card or a bank account. Regardless of insurance paying for everything. The next clinic that offer's testing is over 60 miles away. How can "health clinics" be aloud to be so discriminating?

name: chicken lady
text:
My husband and I recently visited Mainstreet urgent care on December 22 for the Covid 19 testing. We had the best experiance possible. The CRNP Troy Wilcoxson was awesome! We told our friends about what a great experiance we had, and recommended the establishment to others.
So today, December 23 I took my daughter back to get tested for Covid 19, since our test were positive.
In my 48 years I have only experienced two other so called CRNP's as bad as the Donna Conway treated me today.
She bad mouthed Mr. Wilcoxson in how he practices and the decisions he makes. I pleaded to her to change my daughters prescription over to what my husband and I were taking which is not against the law nothing illegal and she could have totally made me feel better as mother and understand ultimately I know my daughter best, she is not just a math equation.
Everything I said to her she used words like "debunked", when I am the paying customer.
I was shocked.
Just because what I was requesting did not fall into her agenda and I pleaded with her, she chose not to make me assured as a parent my daughter is getting  the right treatment. Not to mention she wrote my daughter for an inhailer and no one even listened to her lungs. Using an inhailer when you don't need it can cause more damage than good.
After I stated that fact, she then listened to my daughters lungs and said she sounded clear.
I am so appalled by her lack of bedside manner and inability to connect with the concerns and needs of the patients.
On our previous visit we were invited to sign the kiosk about our experience. Today Donna Conway made sure to skip that option. When I asked the front desk receptionist to please load the kiosk for me it only allowed me to enter 1 as my satisfaction, when I went type the reason why, someone conveniently shut it off and the receptionist could not reload it.
So there's that.
If this Donna Conway continues to be employed at your establishment, I will make it my daily mission to make sure through ALL of my media connections that people call first and only visit the Care Center when Troy is working.

name: Theresa Cahoon
text: I was very sick on October 30th. They were not seeing patients because their internet was down!  Today, I gave them another chance and the receptionist shoved a paper at me to go register on-line.  My phone doesn't work well. I wish another company would buy this place out so we could receive care! It's ashame. This used to be an efficient place with good staff.

name: Rodney Butts
text: Came in on Saturday 7/11/2020 , with sciatica so bad I couldn't sit down . I had been holding myself up on crutches for hours . I got there 20 minutes before they opened at 9. When the guy opened the door he went to the line of people wanting covid testing and began calling names. I told him that I was hurting real bad and needed a shot. He said that I should come back after lunch.  I replied that I am in a lot of pain and need a shot. He told me that these people need a swab . No compassion for pain. It was obvious that he hasn't had any real pain before.  I made it to the emergency room at DWM and they got me in right away.  I have used mainstreet before but I will not in the future.  When you put test before pain you have lost your mind in my opinion.  Testing won't last forever.

name: Tammy Gibson
text: My husband and I both have been ,and are very pleased with their service ,very friendly and professional

name: Lisa Driggers
text: Wait is terrible with hardly no one even in the waiting room. They over charge on everything. They don’t properly bill insurance companies so you’re left having to deal with getting it properly taken care of, in the mean time their billing people threaten to send you to collections for non payment ALL BECAUSE THEY COULDN’T BILL INSURANCE PROPERLY THE FIRST TIME. Will not go back.

resp.text:
Hi Lisa,

Thank you for reaching out about your experience. We'd like the opportunity to follow up on your account, but I'm having a tough time finding you in our system. Would you please email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com with your name and DOB? Also, our billing team would be more than happy to review your claim and fix any issues! The billing phone number is 256-854-9989. Please don't hesitate to let us know what we can do to help make this right for you, and again we want to thank you for bringing this to our attention.

name: Sandatmyfeet
text: Hospitality at its greatest. Front desk clerk super nice and helpful. Very clean place. In and out in no time. Nurse Practitioner/MD was very personable and knowledgeable. The Nurse or aide that done the vitals could be a little more talkative and explanatory. Overall good experience.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! So glad we could help you heal and feel better, FAST!

name: Leah Blalock
text: This place is amazing!!! They were fast, extremely friendly, and even have medications on sight! Will definitely be recommending everyone I know to them!

name: Castle Clan Gunn Castle Clan Gunn
text: From a medical professiona new to town, this place won't ever be getting a second visit from this nurse. They are "smoke steaming off a hot terd" slow and unprofessional. I was second in line when the door opened and still had to sit for an hour and a half while seven other patients were called ahead of me because the staff didn't know how to enter my information into the computer system. I was sick as dog and couldn't even get a Dr excuse for one day!! I guess they know how we are all feeling on the inside!! I'll NEVER go here again and I'll tell everyone I know what a bad experience I had!! They didn't even call my prescription in to the pharmacy in in a timely manner!! Y'all truly suck!!

resp.text:
Hi Mr. Gunn,

We appreciate you reaching out and providing us with your feedback. We'll have someone review your chart so that we can follow up accordingly.

name: glennie kirby
text: Awful experience staff doesn’t give out correct information In several different areas from appointment to waiting to when results are back didn’t even post them to the portal so what was the point!

text: They provide Great, caring services, Thankful I Chose to visit them today for medical issues. I would recommend & use their services again if & when required. Thank you!!!

name: Trevor Farris
text: waited in the lobby for 2 1/2 hours while others that showed up after me got tested.

name: ANGELA WATSON
text:
I was very pleased with the service I received today. The place is so clean and inviting. Troy was super amazing with everyone, but there was a little boy there and we all know kids can be a little terrified about going to the Dr. Troy made  this little guy feel like the star of the show. Troy complimented his super cool shoes and wanted to play basketball with him. This was probably the first smile on my face all day.
Then I got to meet Super Troy and super he was. Bedside manners were SINCERE and AMAZING! Then I met Maegan who was a charm. Very professional and personal, which made me feel relaxed about being there. She was so sweet and got my second smile of the day!!!
Last but not least was Tory. She was super busy when I arrived, but friendly. She administered my three shots and breathing treatment. Best shot giver EVER!!!! She was so sweet and caring.
I only have rave reviews for the staff and the cleanliness of the facility.
I honestly NEVER thought I would visit here. A very good friend of mine is the Dr.
at the urgent care at D W McMillan, but I knew I couldn’t wait a week to see her. I was in tears when I saw Dr. Garrett was out until next year. She’s the absolute BEST in my book.
Much to my surprise, I was very PLEASED with my service today.
THANK YOU SO VERY MUCH!!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing this Angela! That is the SUPER experience we hope to deliver every time! Thank you for choosing MainStreet!

text: Our service at the Urgent care was great ,Troy and Megan did an excellent job they were efficient in taking care of my husbands very bad cut and were happy to do follow ups. Thank you Urgent Care I’m glad your there.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us, Pamela! We're glad we could help your husband heal and feel better!

name: ed wil
text:
Receptionist is very unprofessional and uncaring. I can understand because the physician has set the tone for this office. Under new management and I am changing doctors as of today. Was a 20 year patient until my doctor retired. Don’t recommend!

I would like to follow up on this experience so that potential clients can be informed. Thank you for the standard response to my first concern. I did get a follow up call from the director that manage this location and she left a voicemail. I called her office and I left a voicemail however no other follow up. Let’s be clear, as a new doctor transitions to take over new patients first impressions matter. This new doctor Ashley Walker did not make me feel important enough to welcome me as a new patient. Keep following those rules.

resp.text: We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to us directly at 205-971-3342 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Josh Kane
text: If ur looking for a family practice in the area this is ur place. Been a patient here for a couple years and my visit this week with Dr. Walker was the best experience ive ever had at any doctors office. The whole staff was so nice, everything was organized and easy even with it being really busy. Got to meet the manager at checkout and voiced some frustration I had scheduling my appointment this time. Apparently they converted to a answering group a few weeks ago with all the other grandvew, which sucks but the manager heard me out and said it was all really new for all involved but they were workin on a daily basis to fix issues with them. She gave me her card and told me to reach out to her directly if I have any trouble nect time. Felt good to be heard. Go see Dr. Walker and make this ur office . You wont feel like cattle being herded through like every other doctor office. You feel like a person with a voice with a team that actually cares. They put the ‘family’ feel into family practice.

resp.text: We strive for 100% satisfaction, and we love to hear about these positive experiences! We always strive to provide top quality service. Thank you again for taking the time to provide feedback. We hope you have a great day!

name: Caleb Thomas
text: Brand new patient to this practice and saw their newest physician, Dr. Ashley Walker. 5 star experience from start to finish! The office was easy to find, parking was a breeze, inside the office was clean and social distancing was in place in the waiting room, staff was friendly and organized and Dr. Walker was awesome. Very thorough and genuine. Her office staff has already scheduled me an appointment with a specialist Dr. Walker referred me out to within 24 hours - unreal! Thankful I found such a great office with a solid PCP in Dr. Walker after going years without one! 10/10 would recommend!

resp.text: We strive for 100% satisfaction, and we love to hear about these positive experiences! Thank you  for taking the time to provide feedback. We hope you have a great day!

name: Michelle Peterson
text: My family and I recently moved here from FL. I was looking for a family doctor, to treat everyone and came upon Grandview. They have an online scheduling system, so I used that for myself and my two daughters. Long story short, they called me a week prior to the appointment and told me they were canceling my appt for my youngest daughter because she is under 12. I mentioned my older daughter would need to be canceled as well, as she is also under 12. They informed me that they had canceled hers the week prior, but didn't call me. I verified I still had an appt, for myself on the 17th, they said I did. A few days before the appointment I got an email reminder for my daughter ,that was supposed to have been canceled already, but not for me. The morning of the appointment I woke up not feeling well. I called the office ,as it was a well visit, and asked  if I would need to reschedule or do a telemedicine visit. I was informed that they definitely would NOT see me, because I was sick, and they don't want ANY sick patients in the office, but they also told me I didn't have an appt. anyway because they had accidentally deleted my appointment and left my youngest daughters on, then canceled hers that morning (again without calling),  and had already filled the appt with another patient. On the following Monday (the 22nd) I received a voice mail. I didn't hear the phone and was still not feeling great. When I checked my voice-mail I was greeted with a SERIOUS attitude of someone who didn't realize the voice box had picked up. " I called this lady LAST week. I Dont't know, oh hold on! Hi Mrs. Peterson....". I don't know if Dr. Vines is a good doctor or not. I DO know that her staff is rude and need to learn how to use their own scheduling system, as well as learn how to call patients when they cancel appointments.

resp.text: We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to us directly at 205-971-3342 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Aisha Mahmood
text:
Dr. Vines was a great provider for my mother. Super friendly and easy to talk to.
HOWEVER the receptionists were awful. We were on time for our first appointment and they turned us away. They rescheduled my mom without even explaining the policy. When she came for the rescheduled appointment, they told her she didn’t have one. She showed them the paper with her appointment and then they found her spot.

resp.text: Hi Aisha Mahmood, we appreciate your feedback, as we are always looking for ways to improve. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to us directly at (205) 971-3342 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Ben Kuykendall
text:
This has been my primary care physician group for a couple of years.  Aside from having to wait a few minutes past the appointment time every time I've gone in (like every doctor's office I've ever visited), I've found them to be very accommodating of any last-minute scheduling or rescheduling needs (unlike some other doctor's offices I've visited).   My doctor has consistently looked for the least invasive and least pharmaceutical approach to solving health issues and kept me from having to visit a specialist or two.   But when I needed a reference for a skin doctor, I got a speedy referral into one of the best local dermatologists.  I love that it's in my neighborhood and is very easy to get in and out of.

Update: they've moved out of the neighborhood and into a busier area of town, we'll see how this works.

10/19/18 - visited the new location near the mall. It's a nice office, definitely busier and more traffic considerations.  And you can still expect to wait at least 15 minutes beyond your appointment time. That hasn't changed.  😁

name: Taylor Warren
text: I was very pleased with the staff and Dr Marshall during my visit. I wrote my appointment date down wrong and showed up the wrong day and they were so kind about it and accommodating to get me seen that day. I was in and out within an hour and felt as though Dr. Marshall was very thorough in my check up.

name: Michael Adams
text:
Well they are just lazy. It was 4:30 on the dot. They close at 5PM. Guess who was asked to come tomorrow? I

I haven't had a good night's sleep in 4 days because of a cough and they won't spend 30 minutes to help me.

I told them I would try somewhere else and that is my advice to you. The Hoover Emergency right across the road might be a good spot.

name: Morrie Chance

Your recommendation means so much to us and we're so happy to have earned it. Thank you again for taking the time to share your positive experience.

name: Crystal Brophy
text:
Updated 10/11/2016

Changing my review to one star,  do not go to this office!
In the past week and a half, I have called their office 5 times, with no call back yet.  I call during business hours (not during lunch hours)  and the answering service is always picking up.

It's like no one's ever there,  which would explain why it was a ghost town when I went for my appointment.

I just saw a doctor that they had referred me too,  they asked me how my blood sugar and my thyroid looked,  when I told them they didn't give me that information & didn't think they checked those things, the doctor was really annoyed.

He told me that it was imperative for them to check those things because of the shape I'm in.

So yea as I'd figured I did NOT get a full check up after telling them I hadn't had one in over 20+ years.

I'm disappointmented honestly because I really liked Dr. Vines attitude. She was very sweet, but ibbelieve she lacks and experience and I don't want to risk my health continuing to see someone who doesn't care enough to check me out thoroughly.

Well I haven't been to see a primary doctor in quiet some time. I've gone to the E.R or one of those doc-n-box places, so getting a full routine checkup was LONG overdue and I was a bit nervous.

My fanily has been riding me about getting a routine psychical and getting a full body check up, which is what I told the receptionist when I made appointment that I wanted.

When I arrived, I was a bit sketchy about the location it was in a super odd spot and the office was so "dead". I found it strange and started to get freaked out a bit.
When I walked into the office, I felt a bit more relaxed.

The receptionist was a bit odd, but that didn't bother me much.
The nurse, Alicia was friendly and super helpful. She called around for me on some other appointments and went out of her way to insure the best care.
The "blood guy" Miles was really friendly and I loved the red chair!

My appointment was with Dr. Kimberly Vines and she was really positive, friendly and she was really informative (although a lot of what she was saying I already knew from common knowledge).

I seemed to be in great hands and felt comfortable (maybe a little too comfortable as I had an emotional breakdown for a minute).

After my appointment, I told my family to relax and explained my appointment and a few different times now I've heard that I didn't get a full examination and so now I'm worried that my blood pressure may have pulled focus away from all the other stuff that they were suppose to check out.
After some thought I realized that when my husband had his full work up exam last year, that they did do several tests and the blood work was for more than cholesterol.

Just for reassurance, I called my husbands doctor to schedule him his yearly appointment and as I figured they told me to have him not drink or eat anything 12 hours before his appointment.
I told her that my doctor didn't request this and asked why it was different (maybe because he's male) and she said nope it was just routine because of the several tests that they do.

Now I'm just worried that I didn't receive a full check up and for someone that hasn't been to a doctor in over 20 years it would seem really important to make sure to get a full exam.

So if your going to this doctors office, make sure that you are informed of what their idea of a full exam entails.
I feel as though I may want to make another appointment just to see if I can get a full work up.

name: Laura Parker
text: We have just moved to this area within the year.  We have used this clinic several times.  They do not answer phones.  They call back 2-3 days later.  One time Dr. Vines was supposed to set up a specialty dr. appointment for me and I never heard from her. Two weeks later I called them and they said my number was wrong in the system, even though the Dr. had called me back a previous time.  I’m diabetic and I needed a refill on my diabetic medicine, of course they did not call me back until a day later after I had left two voicemails and they would not respond to my pharmacy’s fax. In my opinion this clinic is very unprofessional and unreliable.

name: RILEY BROPHY
text:
Ok, I have this review 2 stars I believe in my last review. This is ridiculous.

I have called the office twice now and both times were during business hours, yet I was connected to an answering service??

The first time was 3 pm Monday afternoon.
The second time was 11:45 Tuesday afternoon.
No call back yet and I'm just wondering what in the worlds going on.
I was given 2 referrals appointments to speciality doctors, which I was to call and confirm those dates and get the appointment times.

When I did, one of the doctors didn't have me down for the date this office had set for me. It also wasn't the same doctors office so I thought I had gotten the info wrong. It turns out the office had just changed locations and names but they still didn't have me down.

The appointment is suppose to be in 3 days and I can't get ahold of anyone to ask about this.

Might I add that the answering service staff are quite the characters. Monday afternoon lady was a real jerk and the woman Tuesday was a lot nicer but didn't have a clue what she was doing and had to repeat everything. Then she couldn't find the doctor and started naming doctors that weren't even at this office anymore.

So I've changed my opinion to 1 star.
No wonder the place was dad when I first arrived for my appointment. This isn't the type of place people want to go to for a reason.

text: Dr. Ashford delivered all three of my children and I’ve been going to him for years. Since 2009. However, the last few times I’ve been have not been the same. Extra staff has been added. Today , like the last two times ; I waited an hour and a half to go in the back. The CNA that called me back..... eyes rolling like she had a problem and didn’t want to be there.   The back is too crowded, and unprofessional. Nurses everywhere but still slow. Really don’t feel like a doctors office at all. Not going back , changing my doctor. I rather go to the health department.

name: Meshia
text:
If I could have done this review without giving any stars, I would have. But, this star is for LaTory Franks. She really deserves all 5, but this review is not about her. Dr. Ashford has been my gynecologist for more than 10 years, so needless to say, I trusted him. He performed a surgery on me that in turned almost took my life, because he continued to diagnose me inaccurately from the pain I was having after the surgery. I ended up with sepsis, diverticulitis, and an ostomy bag. I have never had any marks on my body, not even my stomach, but after Dr. Ashford's surgery, my stomach looks like a train track with connect the dots around it. This sent me into a depressed state. I have to see this every day when I look at myself.
After which he had no remorse or concern for. He was always nice until he did something wrong. He acts as if he is some type of god with people lives in his hand. But, everyone has to answer to THE MOST HIGH GOD!! I would definitely not refer my worst enemy, let along family, friends, or associates to him or cahaba medical. Even after I did my grievance report concerning this issue, and was notified that his attorneys told him to contact me, to this day, nothing has been done, and, no one from cahaba medical has contacted me since, because they don't care either.

resp.text:
Thank you for providing your feedback and letting us know about this issue, Meshia. name: Alyssa Rushton
text: Cahaba Medical came to BCHS to administer our vaccinations. My first experience with their staff was amazing. The nurse was extremely polite and answered all of my questions. The second nurse seemed to be a bit dismissive of my questions and would not give me eye contact. I am sure after vaccinating so many employees in one day it became routine to her. However, I would like to express my gratitude to the staff that took the time to show care and concern. I know it is not an easy task, and I had no side effects with the 1st round and very little to none with the 2nd round. I appreciate their staff for being so accommodating to the needs of our school system.  I have lost 2 people that are very dear to me since March of 2020 due to COVID-19. One was a 75 year old mother and grandmother, and another dear friend younger than myself. I appreciate the opportunity to be vaccinated during this scary time.

resp.text:

text: I typically glance at reviews and still give people a shot even if others have had a bad experience.  Well, I wanted to confirm a couple of the previous reviews here and agree this was not the best experience I have had.  My initial visit I felt as is if she rushed me through and was a bit on guard. But I chalked it up to well we don't know either other and decided to come back for my physical. Well! This is where I was totally shocked at the lack OF the physical.  Her first question to me was, "what do you want to do?" I was a bit caught off guard and then started to talk about what my previous doctor in Atlanta would do during a physical.  She wanted me to call my insurance to make sure labs were covered, WHICH okay I can appreciate that but again they typically are. I agree with the comment before of not wanting to touch people.  In my opinion I completely wasted my physical because she didn't perform one! My visit consisted of being on the phone with BCBS confirming I'm covered (which I was) and that was primarily it.  I think she's a nice lady but as far as what I am looking for in a doctor she's not it for me.  So take it for what it's worth, but I can honestly say I wouldn't recommend her to anyone who is looking for a doctor that will take time with you and not rush and brush you off.

name: Anne Sockwell
text:
I had a simply terrific medical experience at the Medical West Freestanding Emergency Department and the Hoover Health Center of the UAB Health System.  I fell on a flight of stairs and badly broke both the radius and the ulna of my forearm, below the wrist. The bones were badly out of place and I was very shocked and freaked out. We walked into the emergency room and it was a serene and quiet atmosphere. They told me I would be put into a room as quickly as possible and it happened very soon. People started tending to me immediately and I was given pain medicine. An x-ray machine was brought to the room so I was able to stay in bed while they did the films. As soon as they had the information from the x-rays, they gave me a “waking sleep” anesthesia while they moved the bones back into position (called reduction.). I felt nothing during the procedure, thank goodness.  When I woke back up, the pain was gone and my arm had been splinted so that the bones couldn’t move out of place. They put my arm in a sling and started asking me which doctor I would like to use for the surgery. We had no idea and started scrambling for information. We made some calls, and it was a week before anyone could even see us to evaluate.  The doctor who splinted my arm, Dr Herring, strongly suggested the orthopaedist in the building, Dr Stephen Gould. We looked Dr Gould up and he came from Johns Hopkins Hospital, so we thankfully said “Yes!”  Dr Herring had been sending all my films and information updates to Dr Gould from the  time I arrived. He was ready to see me that afternoon!  We simply walked down the hall from the room I had been in and I saw Dr Gould after a short wait. My surgery was scheduled in a few days and it happened at Medical West Hospital in Bessemer. There I had another Excellent experience from the UAB Health System!  The bones and incision have healed beautifully and I am sold - I am changing doctors so that I will be using this health system from now on. Thank you to Dr Herring and Dr Gould and staff who cared for me so well.
Anne Sockwell
Hoover, AL

name: PRIEST WARD
text: Dr Gould.... I was seen at the free standing ER In Hoover after a accident. I had a X-ray done and was told I had a fractured fibula. I was referred to Dr Gould@ UAB. Dr Gould advised me that there was a fractured fibula and it would take several months to heal. In my medical records a fractured fibula became a sprain ankle. Though there are x-rays showing a fractured fibula his office has refused to correct my records. This is totally unprofessional. He can make a mistake in his opinion yet he won't correct nor own up to it. Instead of orthopedic medicine you should just do autopsies.  You apparently don't have a clue as to what you're doing.

Hi Mr. Ward,

We are so sorry to hear you had an unpleasant experience at Medical West Hoover Health Center. We appreciate you taking time to advise us of your recent experience. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience we may have caused you. At Medical West, we strive to deliver quality health care in a patient focused environment. Thank you again for your feedback.
