text: Writing on behalf on my mom, Carol! she seen Dr. Gould he was in the room no more than 5 mins! He "glanced" at an x ray to say nothing is broke, he would tell her he would refer her for MRI. Bedside manor per my mom: arrogant, rushed, no concern for patient! My mom asked how much MRI would be, the nurse told her a $40 copay, also Med Ctr West Radiology told her it would be a copay of $40 when she arrived for the MRI, gave her a receipt for $40 showing no balance due but she gets billed later for $160 more dollars! Her credit is perfect, has  never filed a complaint nor negative review in her life! But I am for her because she hand wrote this doctor explaining everything, its been months and he nor his staff never contacted her! Now she is getting collections letters!  After hearing her for months upset but now understanding, I have gotten involved!!! I fight cancer and I have been fighting 9 yrs so I am familiar with the medical field and billing - errors do happen on their part! They are not beyond making a mistake! Radiology at UAB West who did the MRI should have told her the correct copay amount before getting the scan! To assure the patient can pay before services rendered and to assure they get their money. It is common courtesy and practice for a pre-scheduled test or scan like that for the staff to have the correct copay available for the patient! Well they did not and on the phone and speaking to whoever was over billing at UAB West the lady got very rude and and said my mom should know what she should have paid~ I have never heard of such and they need to learn how to treat customers, last I check, patients and insurance companies pay their salaries! Regarding the doctors office, there is a Amy that seemed kind and is to be following up with my mom on the situation.

I asked on the way out if there was anything I needed to do and was told they would "handle everything".  That was a Wednesday.   The following Monday afternoon I called the office to check on things as I had not been contacted.  Was told the doctor was not in not was the nurse.  The person on the phone was unable to look in the system to see if my information had been forwarded.  Said she would have the nurse check on it the next day.  Two days later still nothing and I call back.  "The doctor will not be in this week and I don't see any notes about who we were supposed to forward you too.  He won't be back till next week".  I am picking my xrays up and going elsewhere.

name: Jenny Clark
text: Oh boy!  I had a very awful experience with one of the female doctors at this practice.  Personally, if you are considering this place, I would just run like H3LL.  I had symptoms of acid reflux and had an ENT confirm what I thought it was.  I asked to get an endo done just to ensure my throat did not have Barrett's.  They referred me for the procedure and one of the female doctor's performed the endo.  Prior to this I had never met this doctor.  I explained my acid reflux and she said it could be my gallbladder since I had a child 1.5 years prior.  She recommended an ultrasound and hyda scan.  I went in for both and it was found that I did have a gallstone.  The hyda scan was normal.  The gastro doc immediately referred me to a surgeon to have my gallbladder removed.  I was blown away!  I had never had any typical gallbladder attacks or pain.  After doing more research I found out that having your gallbladder removed can actually cause bile reflux due to the constant free flow of bile into your system once the gallbladder is removed and the bile has no where else to go.  This doctor could not even read details of my ultra sound so I had to rely on some random doctor (over the phone) to tell me that yes, I have a rather large stone.  This female gastro doc never made any follow up appointment with me.  I immediately canceled the surgery.  I have since discussed this decision with other doctors (ENT and family doctor) and they agree with my decision.  My one gallstone while big is not currently causing typical symptoms.  There is absolutely no guarantee that removal of my gallbladder will fix the acid reflux.  And, recently, my acid reflux has been manageable with a proper clean (and green) diet. Folks, after doing much research, I am convinced that probably millions of Americans have gallstones.  Why?  Diet, it's that simple.  Our diet is just too high in fat, salt, and sugar amongst other things.  A lot of people have gallstones without even knowing UNLESS they have a gallbladder attack that lands them in the ER (or in my case was found just by chance).  In my opinion, gallbladder pain and recurrent attacks are reasons to remove the gallbladder.  Yes, you can live without your gallbladder but you can also live without your arm.  Your body functions better with both so unless you are having issues, think really hard about whether it's worth losing an organ.  In very rare cases, gallbladder disease in the form of stones can lead to major illnesses like cancer.  However, IF you drastically improve your diet, I do believe you can control your destiny.  Remember, everything begins in the gut!  Obviously, I am not a medical doctor, so these opinions are my own.  My last words of advice: get 2 or 3 opinions and remember that doctors are in the business to make money.

name: tfrank thetank
text: Will NEVER go back to "Dr." Anderson. I hardly had an entire 2 minutes to explain to him what was going on before I was all of a sudden waking up in the recovery room. No courtesy to say "hey, were starting the anesthesia." He was interested in the colonoscopy and getting it over and never asked me the first important question. And the symptoms I tried to tell him with details, kept getting muffled out by him talking to other medical personnel in the room. No chance to let him know that I was interested in having an endoscopy as well because my symptoms don't even pertain to my large intestine and possibly not even the end of my small intestine. So now my symptoms are still present and have no follow up appointment with him. Instead, they tell my wife to make me an appointment with a refered family doctor an entire month away. Not to mention my colonoscopy appointment took almost 2 months until they could do it.  Wouldn't have wasted my 500.00 that my insurance wouldn't cover, if I would have known that it wouldn't help me get my foot in the door to the gastro office. So here I am at square one.

text:
If it weren't for Dr.Carroll being the best doctor I've ever had; I probably wouldn't come back to this clinic.  I followed him from an old practice.  It was too difficult trying to make an appointment as a new patient.  Apparently some things on the site just don't work?

When I called, lady #1 asked me everything 3 times, kept fussing at her computer, and the call was eventually disconnected after 20 minutes.  She failed to understand me telling her multiple times I need an appointment for after 3:45.  She didn't even know when they stopped taking appointments for the day.  It won't take long, it's just to review test results.  She kept trying to give me morning appointments.  I kept telling her I work, and can't come in before then.

The next lady I called after getting disconnected was told the same thing.  Again, she wouldn't listen.  However, she told me about telehealth.  I told her multiple times I wanted an appointment after work.  She pushed the telehealth, and I chose that option.  She still managed to schedule me for an in-person appointment.  When I called that day to get instructions on how to do my appointment, the third person I spoke to said I needed to be, "rescheduled" for telehealth because it was coded wrong.  I told her about the trouble I had so far, and she did not act surprised at all.

My old doctor retired and I will miss him, but Dr. Vines is cut from the same cloth.  I absolutely recommend her to everyone.

name: Sonja Curtis
text: I scheduled an appointment on 1/8/20 and got a confirmation of the appointment. My appointment was for 1/13/20 at 2:00. When I arrived and sat down for a couple of minutes the receptionist called me back up to say I didn’t have an appointment. Dr. Vines doesn’t schedule at this time but and I can reschedule you. She said she tried to call me but I didn’t receive a call according to my call logs. Neither did she leave a message. So this receptionist actually lied, she never called me to cancel my appointment. The same way the contacted me to confirm they could have contacted me to reschedule via patient portal. I called back to the office to speak to a supervisor and I never received a call back. Not only did I take off work and miss money for this appointment. I am still in a tremendous amount of pain. This off is unprofessional, my money and time is very valuable to me. Not recommended

resp.text: Sonja Curtis, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We regret that you had a negative experience and will use this as an opportunity to improve. Thank you and have a great day.

name: Angel
text: Dr. Vines is fantastic - if you can get in to see her. I changed my previous PCP due to them never being able to see me when I am sick. When I met with Dr. Vines for my new patient appointment, she promised that would never happen at her practice. Since then, I've had to be "worked in", I've been told that if my normal doctor is there that day and they can't work me in then I can't see the other doctor, and as of this morning (11/12/19) I was told they could not see me until the second week of December and they could not work me in. I'm sick now and need healthcare now - not in a month! This is absolutely unacceptable and a shame that I pay for a PPO healthcare provider that is not available when I need to see them.

resp.text: Angel - please reach out to Brittany in Dr. Vines' office.  Her number is 205-971-2004.  Thank you.

text: Terrific, positive experience today on my first visit with this doctor.  She was caring and knowledgeable.  She took time to listen to me and ask follow-up questions. Her nurse and phlebotomist were great.  I highly recommend her.

At 10:30 I was still sitting there no paperwork had been given to me nothing had been said to me. This is not the best way to acquire New
Patients. I simply got up and told the receptionist to cancel the appointment. All she said was " Are you sure?" did not ask for a reason or anything. I am sure I can find a Dr. whose staff is more professional and cognizant of people's time. This was outrageous.

text: I found the staff to be very unhelpful and unresponsive. As a result, I'm likely  going to be paying $100s extra in my insurance premium.  I will most likely be looking for another primary physician.

name: Ashley Anderson
text: Dr. Karen Vines is an amazing doctor. She puts you at ease and really listens. My first appointment was this past Thursday and I was blown away to how caring and thorough she is. The building in which she works is not that attractive ( extremely dated) her admin staff cold ( her nurses and phlebotomist were sooo sweet) but NOTHING will keep me away from Dr. Vines. She went out of her way to get me on the right meds and do blood work. She even called me personally,  on SATURDAY, to explain my test results AND prescribe medicine moving forward! Who does that?! Most Doctors have a God- complex and will not spend more than a few minutes with you. Dr. Vines is extraordinary. You know the old saying, "diamond in the rough?" Dr. Vines truly is!!!!

name: greg lance
text: WW Kia

name: Cathy Jefferson
text:
Had a check up @ Dr James Robinson in Southside, AL.
Dr Robinson is AWESOME. He takes his time answering all your questions & concerns, he doesn’t rush you in like a herd of cattle. He’s very knowledgeable & seems to take pride in your health care. He explains everything where you can understand and is very thorough.
His staff is also very pleasant.
Keep up the great work and service you all provide.

name: Dana Sutton
text: I have been to this office at least 5 times, and each time have experienced excellent customer service. Yes the wait was a little long, but compared to other offices it's similar during these trying times. The nurse practitioner that I saw was compassionate, genuine, and though. All the office staff are very kind. I have worked in the medical field, and believe me being treated in a professional manner is something you will experience here. I do wish they would hold open slots for the elderly who are not computer or cell phone users.

name: Angela Formby
text: We live 30 minutes out from the office and, after signing in on the web service, waited until the wait time dropped to 0-30 minutes before leaving our house. We sat in the empty parking lot for an hour before we started to get antsy. We received a text saying they were almost ready for us after we waited another hour. We went inside to an empty waiting room and were told it would be another hour— all the while my sick child just wanted to go home. The receptionist reluctantly “moved us up the list” (again— empty parking lot, empty office, and enough time for her to play on her phone) but at that point I’d had enough. My husband was able to get an appointment with his regular pediatrician so we left. Needless to say, if it was possible, I’d give zero stars. Never. Again.

name: Darrell Spears
text:
-edit- why didn’t I read the reviews before I came?!?....

I called at 11:30 am and asked to make an appointment. I was told that they didn’t do those and to come around 5pm when they would be less busy. I arrived at 4:45 and was told that they were “at capacity” for the day... They “close” at 8 pm and stopped taking patients   over 3 hours before they close... I drove 35 minutes each way for this nonsense. My other option was another Main Street but that will not happen lol. Steering clear of this operation in Talladega or any other city thank you very much.

Long story short: AVOID.

name: Katrina Owens
text:
I was given a 3 hour wait time... Sick as a dog sitting in my car. After 3 hours, I was told it maybe another 3!!! Total wait time from registration to receiving the text to come in... 8 hours!!! E I G H T!!!
Thankfully, I'd already left and went to my local ER. In and out in LESS than 2 hours.
8 HOURS Y'ALL!!!! And I have screenshots of the messages to prove it!

name: Miki Fuller
text:
No matter what time you show up, youll.be able to eat two meals before youre even seen. Theres a 3-6 hour wait every single time. But if they know the walk in, bet they will be seen right away.

Save time and money by going somewhere else.

name: Shane Parton
text: Hard working nurses and Dr during covid 19 pandemic

name: John W.
text: Walk in Covid???? Walk in and wait 3 hours.  Do not tell you when checking in there is a 2.5-3 hour wait till questioned many times.  2pm and to be told people in line before that have waited many hours.  To to other clinic.  Bad Bad Bad

name: C Jones
text: I went in for Covid testing and was told that I had to register online. According to the receptionist, the registration opens at 6:30 am and closes when 40 people have registered.  There were several elderly people there that were turned around because they had not registered. This is a bad process as everyone may not have access to register or may not know that it’s required.

name: Todd Alexander
text:
Maybe tell people you aren't taking patients in that long recording before they drive 30 minutes at 11AM

Edit:  And again on a Wednesday at 1:00

name: Melissa Lemaire
text: I've been to this office twice now trying to be seen early in the day and have been turned away both times being told they have a limit on how many people they see a day. I am sick and need to see a Dr. Hours of this place are open till 8pm yet they're not seeing anyone? What kind medical care is this?  No service and told to come stand in line at 6am and hope to be seen even though I'm sick?

name: Estefani Colmenero
text: I hope this place stays open and with the same people for a long time. They are the kindest people that you will ever meet, especially if you are like me, afraid of a blood test. I have had 2 bad experiences with blood tests in the past, and they totally understood. They are very kind and gentle with people,they really are great about making you laugh and not worry. Thank you urgent care, I will be here for a long time, hope you stay as long as I'm around.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind works Estefani!

name: Lizz Garrett
text: Horrible service! Felt like nothing I told them mattered. The guy at the desk was down right rude! And we left with no resolve. Wasted 4 1/2 hours of my time trying to get my 1 & 3 yo kids well.

resp.text:
Hi Liz,

Thank you for reaching out about your experience. We will certainly follow up with our staff. If you have any additional details that you can provide about your visit, please email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com. We always appreciate the opportunity to improve. Thank you again for bringing this to our atteniton.

name: Blaire Butler
text: I went to MainStreet for a chest cold on a Saturday around 11:30am - I was the only patient when I arrived, filled out paperwork and got called back in around 15 minutes. Very nice waiting room, clean and comfortable. The medical staff were pretty quick in assessing my symptoms...did not ask as many questions as I would have liked and were pretty quick in prescribing me meds - I guess I just expected more of an exam/conversation but I just had a baby 3 months ago so am used to more involved doctors appointments! They did take my weight, temperature and blood pressure as well as listen to my chest real quick.  I was pretty descriptive of my symptoms as well as didn’t have much of a voice so diagnosing me probably wasn’t that hard! The nurse practitioner said she had seen a lot of what I had going around and knew what I could take with breastfeeding. Overall I had a great experience and will for sure be going back!  They offer water/juice/coffee hot cocoa in the waiting room too!  They followed up with a text and email and do seem to really care about their patients!! I am so glad we have an urgent care in Talladega!!

resp.text: Thank you Blaire! We are SO very happy that you had a wonderful experience during your visit. We hope that you heal better, feel better fast! Please let us know if there's anything else we can do for you!

name: Ashley Paris
text: Great Staff! Especially Katherine Owens! I hope I get her again, if I ever have to go back! Felt much better when I left!

resp.text: Thanks for sharing Ashley!

name: Megan Cagle
text: Never thought that the best doctors' office experience would come from an urgent care clinic, but it did! Everyone went above and beyond...from the front desk person to the CRNP. Highly, highly recommend for your needs. Sure do wish this clinic could be our primary care facility! Great work

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Megan! We love our patients and try to do our best to make you Heal Better Feel Better Fast! We hope you'll continue to choose MainStreet Family Urgent Care for all your urgent care needs!

name: Kayla Taylor
text: MainStreet is a convenient place to go when your sick. Katherine Owens does a great job making patients feel welcome and making sure they get treated in a timely manner!

resp.text: Thanks so much Kayla! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Matt Riley
text: Don't waste your time at the place nurse practitioner there is a joke. Went in for a sinus infection and she wanted to give me a bunch of medicine to cover up the symptoms instead of giving me the antibiotics I need to get rid of the infection like every other decent medical provider has done for the many, many sinus infections I've had in the past. If I wanted to try to mask the symptoms and not treat the cause I could have went to the piggly wiggly and got some nyquil. I came there to get my illness taken care of because I  got things to do and need to be well too work to provide for my family. I ain't got time to be laying in bed hoping some flonase and a steroid shot is going to get feeling well. It was a total waste of my hard earned money for nothing. Now I've got to go to a place that really cares about getting me well instead of trying to cover up my symptoms.

resp.text:
Hi Matt,

We’re sorry your experience was not satisfactory, and we appreciate you sharing with us! We will have our Chief Medical Officer review your visit to see what we might have been able to do differently!

name: W Stein
text: Wish they were my family Dr’s. Had a sinus infection and were here visiting Shocco Springs. This clinic was very professional, very clean up to date facility. My family Dr’s office is not this coordinated.

text:
Was patient since 2015. Never took advantage of prescriptions. One day I found out she cut me off because her incompetent nurse did not note a medication i was taking although taking both medication together for years. All the sudden she refused to return my calls, using her staff as a go-between. During my last visit she says "Wait here I will be right back. Waited for 15 minutes and her nurse hands me a script. I ask her where she went and was told by her nurse (with a deer in the headlights look on her face) "Oh. she is in with another patient."
Filing  complaint with Alabama Board of Medical Examiners. Plus she has had so many offices since 2015 it was impossible to find out what office she was in that week.

text: I went for my second visit, to have fasting blood work done, and a re-ck. I was told to fast which is super hard for me since I have low-blood sugar already. I got there only to be told I had to see the Dr first b/c I haven't seen her before, which I most certainly have.Then I was told I had blood work already done in Feb., and had fasted back then, which I had not fasted for. Then I was told no, my insurance would not pay for me to have any blood work done today. All of that was a BIG pain. Why couldn't they tell me all of that before I wasted all of my time filling out a ton of paperwork -printed out from home, waiting weeks for an appointment, and driving all the way over there for nothing but STRESS!! I wasted hours of my day, very frustrating to say the least. I WILL NOT BE BACK!

name: oxford local
text:
My family and I started going here as our new primary care. Well so many things have happened that we will no longer be going here.
1. Many times we have been here where the parking lot and the waiting room was nearly empty and yet still took almost 2 hours to be seen.
2. I had some lab tests done. I called back to get the results.  I was told I had to make an appointment to get the results. Which I had to pay a copay to get MY results!! It is patient rights to be able to have access to that information. We shouldn't have to pay extra money for that info. No other doctor's office has ever done that to me.
3. At the appointment to get my results I get told that I dont have an appointment and we argue back and forth on that matter.
4. If there is a girl that works there that is named Sunshine she told people I was there to be seen as a patient. Someone I know told me that someone they know (whom I have never met) was told by Sunshine that I was there. I have no idea what else she told them. I dont know Sunshine or what she looks like or what her position is. So therefore I have no idea what personal and private information she has access to and could have told people about! I feel extremely violated. I even cried because of embarrassment of the possibility of people knowing that stuff and talking about it.
We will never go back. If anyone I know asks about where to go I will definitely warn them about the horrible experiences we have had here.

name: Dillie Meeks-Alexander
text: I've been seeing Dr. Williams for a few years now.  Always thorough and personable.  This week I had a piece of extremely fragile glass in my foot.  I had driven it deep into the ball.  Using a razor blade, Dr. Williams gently shaved down the skin around the glass...no anesthetic. felt absolutely no pain.  "Surgery" was a great experience. :-)  He told me that if he hadn't gotten it all out to come back, and he wouldn't charge me for a 2nd visit.  His nurse called just now to make sure my foot was fine.  To echo another review on here..."doctors are people, too."

name: Andrew Reynolds
text: Not sure about the 1 star reviews.  I have been seeing Dr. Williams for over 15 years, and he is always thorough, patient, and caring.  His staff is good and I'm able to get in within a day or two most of the time, which is really important to me when I'm not feeling well.

name: Sean Jones
text:
Probably one of the worse docs my wife and I have ever used.  A family member who is a doctor in Montgomery, recommended that my wife get a full thyroid panel due to some ongoing health issues, e.g. always tired, soar throat, often feels like she has a cold, suddenly gaining weight despite a work out schedule, etc.

We got a full panel performed which came back with extremely high TPO results, and the family member recommended we discuss it with our PCP as the results are often a precursor to Hashimoto's Disease.

When we booked the appointment with Dr Williams we were asked "who authorized" us to get a test run.  And then when we spoke with Dr. Williams, he immediately dismissed my wife's feedback saying, "I can tell your thyroid isn't swollen just be looking at it", "you're probably anemic or have low iron".

One ultrasound and multiple blood tests later - surprise!  Her thyroid in enlarged, she's not anemic and the remaining panels came back negative.  Despite this, we can't get a referral to an endocrinologist and he can't explain why her TPO levels are high and she has the symptoms she does.

I've spoken with 2 other docs that have recommended an endocrinologist based on the very first blood test we brought Dr. Williams.

End of the day, Dr Williams was very dismissive of our concerns, seemed to have already made up his mind because we had blood work done without his "consent".

I wouldn't recommend Dr. Williams for anything more than the most basic care, and certainly not for anything that might involve a diagnosis or support that's not routine.

name: Chris Ward
text: Apparently I was released from the practice over a $45 bill that I have proof was paid. Instead of hearing his patients side or allowing them to show receipts, he will remove you as a patient. Obviously your wallet is more important than your health to this guy.

name: Jason Newell
text:
Great doctor, great man. My whole family goes to Dr Scott.  He gets hurried like any of us do when busy but he's receptive to you.  Ask him how his day is going and how well he's doing and he spends more time with you.  The bonus is he remembers stuff from over the years. Remember: doctors are people, too :).

My best visit was for a regular checkup. Scott noticed I had a ganglion cyst about the size of a large pea near my neck. His eyes got all big and he said, "would, uh, you, ..., like me to remove that?". I said, "sure if you have the time.". His eyes got even bigger and he said, "alright!  Woo!  I'LL BE RIGHT BACK!!!". He zooms in a few seconds later with a syringe and scalpel looking like the latest Publisher's Clearing House winner.  He explained everything he was doing and I THINK he might have mentioned something along the lines of "I wish you could see this because it's TOTALLY AWESOME" but I can't confirm that. Either way, he hit with a local anaesthetic, made a small incision, and talked about making sure none of it escaped his wrath else it could cause sepsis.  Then he was done!  A small bandaid and I was out.  No evil cysts have returned since :)

name: Shawn Mertz
text:
Hands down one of the best in town.  My entire family (in law's included) use Dr Williams as our primary doctor and love him.  I've also referred several colleague's from work to him and they have had the same great treatment.  It is always easy to schedule an appointment and be seen when you are sick, the staff is great about sneaking in last minute appointments.

I have had several issues lately that were a challenge to diagnose and Dr Williams was exhaustive in both his own diagnosis as well as bringing in specialist partners.  Never once did he make me feel like it was all in my head, when I even questioned that myself.  Even with existing medical issues Dr. Williams wants to solve the root of the problem rather than treat what's wrong with another pill.

I would recommend this practice to anyone, and appreciate the entire staff!

name: Matthew Hardaway
text: Ignore the five star reviews. I'm afraid some people must default to that if the doctor looked in their general direction. I went in for my first visit and was given a ten question test to determine if I was depressed. I wasn't depressed until I received a separate bill for the test to the tune of sixty dollars. My concerns were ignored because I'm "young". I' was 29 at the time and never went back.

name: Lorin Gilbert
text: Barely spent any time in the room. Maybe 2 minutes. Dismissed my 24 yr old boyfriend's high blood pressure and said "oh you're young, you eat unhealthy things." He didn't ask what my boyfriend ate, he didn't offer any interventions to decrease the blood pressure or anything. My boyfriend got labs drawn and the office never called to let him know the results (even though they said they would) and they told him the wrong appointment date for his follow-up. So my boyfriend showed up a day early. At this point, he decided he wasn't going back. I was very disappointed in this doctor's bedside manner and blatant lack of helpfulness.

name: Jason Jarnagin
text: Always available and a very thorough doctor... highly recommend.

name: Cathy Stevens
text: Has been my primary physician for over 10 years. Has been instrumental in finding my heart, skin cancer, gynecological issues and sending me to the right specialist who are now handling these issues that are now in control.

name: Cassidy
text:
At first I thought Dr. Williams was a good doctor but it seems it was just that I hadn't been to a doctor in years. After seeing some specialists in the last few months for some allergy problems I've really seen how GOOD ATTENTIVE doctors treat their patients.

He RUSHES through appointments and will be walking out the door as your still talking. I've more than once had to loudly interrupt him or get the nurse to bring him back because he treats his patients like a paycheck. Each time I've went I've waited an hour or more for 5 minutes of him talking quickly and running out before I can ask anything.

He was very rude and condescending to my husband about some delicate matters. My husband has not liked him since day one.

He is not very invested in diagnosing problems. For both me and my husband he's ordered tests for problems we've had, but when results came back clear he didn't do anything else. It was like the thought bloodwork would somehow cure an illness. No referral to a specialist. No follow up visit. Just a phone call from a nurse saying the bloodwork didn't show anything. Not helpful and definitely not what I want in a doctor.

The office staff is horrible about getting back to calls. They have not called me back almost every time I've called. As it stands now I don't have a refill for asthma meds that Dr. Williams was very serious that I take regularly because I called for a refill and no one called me back to tell me I needed to come in for an appointment. Finally after over a week I called back and left a hateful message and finally got some service.

But I'm not going to come in every three months and pay a co pay and wait for over an hour for a condition I've had for 20 years that I need daily medication for. It's just greedy on their part. I've never in my life had a doctor that expected me to manage my asthma this way.

I HATE this practice. At this point I'm searching for a primary physician in the height of the worst season for my asthma, unmedicated, because of the laziness and greediness of this practice.

Do not waste your time or copays. Go to a doctor that has time for you.

name: John Heikkinen
text: Great doctor and the office personnel are always friendly and helpful.

name: Curtis Elledge
text: Dr.Williams is the best doctor I've ever been to.

name: Anesah Sharif
text: Apparently he can’t be my doctor anymore due to  owing a fee that I was not aware of.  If you are looking for a long-term physician this is not for you

name: jo dur
text: A doctor that always care... Joel D

name: Billy Munsell
text: Dr. Saxon was able to put together a program and schedule that fit my needs and schedule. And i have definitely improved because of that.

name: violet welford
text: Welcoming environment. I went in just expecting to get my hips realigned, and my back popped. And the session was above and beyond what I expected. I will be going back.

name: Jessica Earnest
text: Dr. Gewin is wonderful. His office staff, is an entirely different story. Good luck getting them to answer without immediately putting you on hold after waiting. Good luck getting a refill, and if they need something (ie physical) to get you the refill, they will just toss your request out the window instead of letting you know what is needed. The entire office needs new jobs, they are too comfortable.

name: Michael Hammons
text: Great b-side manner, great listener and a very thorough competent caring physician.

name: Meredith Pate
text: Excellent physician and LOVE his CRNP Megan! Very thorough and easy to talk with about anything. Never felt rushed and they actually listen to you!

name: Katherine Pennell
text: Amazing experience! I had tried another pediatrician before him and she never once sat and talked to me, introduced herself or asked me my name. Dr. Gewin took the time to chat with me, ask questions, and actually care! He was extremely kind and informative. I feel very confident in using them as a first time Mom! Will recommend to everyone I know.

name: Michael Hammons
text: Dr. Gewin is a very competent physician and I respect his Christian faith however he is handicapped by the fear of reprisal from the the DEA if he were to help treat patients for pain. So sad to see but it's true. I have spinal stenosis so bad that other pain specialists have given up on my condition and Dr. Gewin refused to help me. That's why I give him 3 stars

name: suzette Fisher
text: Love Dr James Gewin! Good Christian man with wonderful bedside manner,  he is a very good doctor and takes the time to be thorough and check back up with you and make sure you are doing well!  I recommend him to everybody! So refreshing to see a Doctor that actually takes time to talk to you and Truly cares about you!

name: Lori Sparks
text: Dr. Gewin is the the kindest most humble doctor we have ever seen!  I am so thankful that I heard about him.  I have children ages 6 to 12 and all four will be seeing him as well as my husband and I.:)

name: Stacy Allen
text: I’ve been seeing Dr. Gewin for almost 10 years. They don’t make doctors quite like this anymore. He spent almost 45 minutes with me during my yearly visit and addressed each one of my concerns. I have so much anxiety when visiting doctors but always leave this particular office feeling seen and heard.

name: Kristen Blaylock
text: We love Dr. Gewin. If you are looking for a doctor who truly cares, he's the one you're looking for. He's not arrogant, or rude, but kind and considerate. We even take our kids, and we drive quite a distance.

name: Mal Sinclair
text: We recently moved to Alabama, I took my 4 year old to see Dr Gewin yesterday and I am so excited to have found such a caring Dr. I was a little hesitant to go with a general practitioner over a pediatrician but I am so glad I did, Dr Gewin has a very paralell mindset on health as our family which is hard enough to find but his entire staff was so kind and welcoming as well! Dr Gewin took the time to get to know us, we weren’t rushed like a lot of pediatricians seem to be these days, he genuinely cared about my concerns. I could not recommend him enough!!

name: Mariana Burnett
text: Best place in town. So happy I found such carrying people that take the time and care about your health.

name: Cynthia Timmerman
text: Best Dr ever. Caring Christian man. Takes his time with you. Calls you himself with test results.

name: Lynette Marie
text: What a sweet and amazing Doctor. I was pleased to meet a doctor that puts health before wealth those type doctors are truly a dying breed.  Very pleased with our care and both our daughters seemed to like Dr. Gewin and after being vaccine injured in the past and going thru so much they are usually afraid of anyone in a doctor setting but Dr. Gewin is great.

name: Cynthia Thomas
text: So kind. So attentive. They don’t make them like Dr. Gewin anymore.

name: Jih-Ying Copper
text: Dr Gewin always kind and professional.  We are his patients for about 10 years.

name: Jayson Duncan
text: I couldn't ask for a better group of individuals, from the receptionist to the Dr. They were exceptionally nice and polite. Given the fact that I happen to appear as if I had just been released from prison they still respectfully listened and helped me. The Dr, (Bonuel) was outstanding and honestly was concerned about my well-being. I was blessed to have located this office.

resp.text: Dear Jayson, Thank you for the awesome feedback. It's great to know that we were able to provide you with the highest levels of service. We look forward to serving you many more times in the future! Hope you visit us again soon!

name: Chris Kendrick
text:
Do NOT go here. A routine visit for birth control ended in tears. The doctor had no bedside manor, and stated that she was "pushing the limits of what I can do" in doing so. Her words, not mine. She then proceeded to berate my wife on all the other various things that could be done. We paid the full $175 ( for those uninsured), to be seen with the same level of care and compassion anyone would want to experience from a medical professional. Instead, now I have a wife in tears. Instead of giving any confidence in where things are at, they filled her with anxiety, took our money, and shoved her out the door.

They use different rotating doctors between their locations, and I personally have had good doctors at this location before. They all left. Not just due to other factors, but because how they themselves, as doctors, are treated. Educate yourself, and read other experiences to make your own conclusion, but neither I nor anyone in my family will ever set foot in this building or any other AFC location again.

name: 7childwillie
text: My son went there this morning with sore throat, body aches. No covid test, no strep throat test, nothing! Told him to come home and take Niquil!

name: Jase Buttram
text:
My sister went in there after the staff TOLD her to come to the office to pick up a form. The girl at the front desk was rude and embarrassed my sister, not to mention the potential HIPAA violation by disclosing her medical condition to anyone sitting in the lobby. I can’t believe this is how you treat your patients. This place is a joke. DO NOT GO HERE!

**UPDATE** Not at all satisfied by this canned response. I would imagine you would want to seek resolution.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Rebecca Smith
text: 10/10 would recommend

name: Stacy King
text: This is the worst place to visit as far as doctors offices go. They do the bare minimum and honestly could care less if anything happens to you. Worst experience ever and would never go here again. They’ll gladly take your money that’s for sure.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Melissa Deleo
text: I love this place! The Staff and Doctor are both wonderful. However, I cannot seem to get them on the phone. I had some questions about my medication and possible refill. The lines just ring and ring. Other than that, this place is wonderful.

name: Allen Stinson
text: This has got to be my worst experience ever. I went in to get tested placed my name on the list at 0807. Yes it was a full sheet then she said it wold be a 4 hour wait. I was at the counter and the check in receptionist was unprofessional. In the middle of my check in she started talking to another employee totally disregarding that I was there. I left and waited on my call back. After waiting 6 hours I still didn’t receive a call back I drove to the clinic. She started I was next to get called but there was 5 people ahead of me. Finally got called in at 3 pm and sat in a room for an hour. Mind you I’m still waiting for someone to come in. As I’m looking around the floor is nasty, hair everywhere and some even waxed into the floor. This place is definitely unprofessional and I will NOT ADVISE ANYONE TO COME!!!

name: beth elilio
text: Nice staff but the wait was SO RIDICULOUSLY LONG! Me and my 86 years old injured mom with a Dementia had to wait two and half hours just to get her covid-19 test done.

name: Dobasai
text: Unfortunately my insurance only covers me to go here to visit Dr howton in my area. They made me fill out my physical forms, took my $50 dollars and then I waited for 15 minutes. Dr howton then appeared in the doorway, looked at me, and told me I need to go to the emergency room (in the middle of a pandemic.) Obviously if I was in an emergency situation I would've gone to the emergency room. Doctor is very lazy and doesn't truly care about her patient's well being. Not sure how you can diagnose someone or refer them somewhere without coming within 15 feet of them. What a joke of a doctor she gives this whole place a bad name. Wouldn't come back here if I were on my death bead. Because they would probably just charge me $100 and refer me to a funeral home.

name: Armekia Houston
text: Miss Kelli the care manager was very polite and helpful when it came to taking care of my sick child needs. Overall each staff member I came in contact with was friendly, knowledgeable and well capable of performing their job duties in a timely manner.

resp.text: It's experiences like yours that really keep us motivated! Our teams strive to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out! Thank you so much for the positive review!

name: Beth Chapman
text: Nurse who gave me my DPT, was awesome!! Very skilled at what she's doing!! Didn't hurt when she stuck me and no pain today! Everyone extremely nice and caring! Thank you all!! My finger is getting better!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Letoya Smith
text: Great staff!!! I was very impressed with how quickly I was registered, and then called straight to the back. The doctor I saw (I apologize for not remembering her name) was very detailed in discussing my issue with me and I really appreciated that. Great service!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Shawn Castaneda
text:
I took my son here yesterday, to verify a fracture. The staff and the doctor were fantastic. Quick, professional and good sense of humor.  Dr Houghton was a peach! Makes me think she raised a boy or two as well.
Having boys, I'm sure I will be back for more casts, stitches or something.
Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! Our teams strive to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out. We can't wait to see you again, have a great day!

text: The office was extremely clean. The staff was friendly and efficient. Dr. Handley was attentive and listened to me describe my symptoms before beginning his examination for diagnosis. I will definitely return here when needed. Excellent!!!

resp.text: We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Kathryn Carter
text: I waited for over three hours to learn that I was negative for strep, flu, and mono. The doctor didn’t give me ANY suggestions of treatment or over the counter medicines. With the diagnosis of “viral syndrome” I feel like I wasted my time and money at this location. I still feel TERRIBLE and was given ZERO suggestions or help by the doctor!!!!!!!

resp.text: It's upsetting to hear that your experience was anything but stellar. We would like to work towards a resolution, so if you are willing, please reach out to us at (205) 722-9500 to discuss this further.

text: Been here for 3 hours in a full lobby of sick people and they have only taken 2 patients back since opening.  They are not even checking anyone in to treat them. Worse office I have ever seen.  Only excuse from front desk is they are busy but hard to be busy when you wont check anyone in.

name: Gina Grantham
text: From the front desk staff to all the nurses, my experience was excellent. Dr Akhtar was my doctor in Birmingham and I followed him!  AFC is a TEN and I will go again!  Thank you kindly!

resp.text: We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Michelle Alazzam
text: The second doctor I seen was incredible! She sat down and LISTENED to me. Most doctors seem to come in and be "in a hurry" or like their trying to rush you, but she didn't. Which made me feel at ease and could remember all the questions I was wanting to ask and more. I had no anxiety talking to her and she answered all my questions with detail.

resp.text: Thank you again for taking the time to let us know how we did. We hope you have a great day! Thanks again for taking the time to leave us this information about your recent visit. Take care!

text: Excellent staff and care! Not a long wait at all.  Everyone was friendly and super helpful.  Place was clean and inviting.  I would definitely recommend this place and will be back if ever a need.  Thank you,  American Family Care for taking great care of my husband and me.

text: I went in to the clinic 5 minutes before they closed. I honestly didn't think they would take me, but they did. There was no wait to get seen. All of the staff were very nice. I told them my symptoms and everything but I passed out when they tried to take my blood. They were all really helpful and gave me something to eat and drink. They told me to come back tomorrow if I was still feeling bad because they didn't want to continue to prod at me when I was faint. A nurse walked me outside. They called my mom the next morning to see if I was okay. Very kind and professional.

resp.text: Thank you very much for sharing these comments, Lauren Dennis. We always love to receive great feedback.

name: April Rico
text: If I could give them a zero I would. I went in there on a Sat at 5 with a bad earache and mouth was broke out from another medication. Dr come in looked in ear said it's nothing and looked in my mouth said I don't see nothing. I knew he was lying bc I was in pain and I feel stuff draining out of my ear and my mouth had irritation on it. He was so rude. I had to leave there and go to another clinic and it's a funny thing another Dr sees fluid on my ear and irritation on my tongue and mouth. I was given antibiotic and something for my mouth. Never again will I go to this place and I recommend no-one else goes. I wish I didn't have to pay him anything bc it's not fair that I had to leave this Dr and go to another one. 😡

text: "Manager" does not get back with you, nor is she available when I call in the morning and evening. It is not a first time occurance. Doctors are fine at the clininc but the service and admin personnel are either under-staffed or not doing their job.

text: Worst care ever. Not even worth going to. Have been sick as a dog for three weeks straight. Not to mention the physician never introduced herself so we have no clue what her name was and she BURPED IN OUR FACE and did not even say excuse me. Sorry excuse for a doctor, obviously does not take her vow of patient care seriously.

text: Kelly was absolutely incredible as well as the rest of the staff. I have never been treated with such care and kindness!

resp.text: Stephen, we are so happy to read such a great review about American Family Care - Tuscaloosa! If you're ever in need of more help, please let us know!

name: Jennifer Brand Browning
text: You know, I've read several of the ratings on here and just to say... I work in a medical facility, and I have been here 3 times for myself and 2x for my children now today with my husband. Usually I'm in and out within an hr to and hr and a half. I've never had an issue with the physician listening to my concerns  or the staff treating me or my family in an unprofessional manner. Generally, the staff is very warm and welcoming. I would not go here for everyday care but for care management after hours I recommend this place over the Emergency room. Especially if you only have a cold or something simple. That way the ER can serve it's purpose for medical emergencies.

name: Denise Lawrence
text: Incompetence, bad attitudes. Refused to fill out paperwork for my employer causing me to get red mark. Botched narcotic prescription wrong date causing me to be put in handcuffs and driven by police car to station.  Took 2 hours in cuffs.  Almost doesn't night in jail. Stay far far away from this place.

name: Ronnie Wilburn
text: The staff was very rude and ghetto for lack of a better word. I could here the nurses making fun of me through the door of the room I was in. The doctor told me I needed to see a specialist for stitches and refused to answer any questions. Very unprofessional.

name: donielle robertson
text: After several years of a horrible experience, I decided to go back to AFC needless to say I WILL NOT ever return. I understand there is a closing time but I was there Way before closing. As soon as I was rushed for X-rays for my knee I was never given feedback and was rushed out the door with an ace bandage on basically since they only had extra large braces... Excuse me for intruding on your time and paying your wages... NEVER EVER AGAIN!!!!!

resp.text: Greetings, I am the patient advocate with American Family Care. I am truly saddened that you are dissatisfied with American Family Care, as we strive for 100% patient satisfaction. In keeping with the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act, I cannot post a response that directly addresses the concerns mentioned. I do, however, welcome the opportunity to personally address all patient concerns, and ask that the patient or authorized representative be forwarded this message as it details my contact information. I can be reached directly by telephone at (205) 403-8902 ext. 2269. The patient or authorized representative can also complete a secure patient satisfaction survey at www.americanfamilycare.com. On behalf of American Family Care, I wish you and your family good health now and in the future.

name: Toreatha Bostic
text: Best staff nice treatment and make you feel comfortable. Kelli, Ericka,Malika and Saferia. The best.

resp.text: Toreatha Bostic, we're happy to hear you had such a positive experience with our team!

name: James Luther
text: This place is awful.  Went in three days ago- told them I did not have insurance so the lady said the co-pay for me would be 155, which is higher then the majority of other clinics around town, but I decided to go ahead and see the doctor. Not sure what the doctors name is, but she was large and had curly brown hair. The lady did not care whatsoever in diagnosing me.  I had insect bites, that I was thinking are fungal infections, so I asked for a simple KOH test to make sure it isn't- she told me she doesn't have it, its at her office, so she decided to prescribe me some cream- THATS ALL. didn't ask me anything,what the symptoms were or anything. So I made her give me a steroid shot to see what exactly it is, since she didn't care.  She had no compassion or anything, and then as I walked out, I saw her on her computer playing some yahoo game. Clinic looks nice, however the doctor I had was extremely inconsiderate.  Big waste of money, I will definitely not return. if you see a big brown curly haired doctor, ask for another doctor.

name: Ellie Cochran
text: Horrible patient care and service!! None of the receptionists, nurses, or even doctors seem to care at all about their line of work. Not sure if they just have bad attitudes, or if they simply don't care about their patients. Either way, there is no excuse. I had been sick for 3 weeks and had specific symptoms that were very basic and straight forward. The receptionist and nurse were both very rude. The doctor saw me for a total of 30 seconds before sending the nurse back in to give me a steroid shot, as if that was the cure to all medical issues. Avoid at all costs.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, and welcome the opportunity to address all concerns. I am the patient advocate, and I can be reached at (205) 403-8902. You can also submit concerns via a secure satisfaction survey at www.americanfamilycare.com. Thank you for allowing us to learn from you. Stay well.

name: Michele Jones
text: I have been here multiple times even a month ago. I did not have my insurance card this time. So as I was pulling it up online the front desk girls put 3 people ahead of me because they said they needed my card which they already have. Perhaps this is why there is never anyone in their waiting room

resp.text: Michele Jones, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We regret that you had a negative experience, and will use this as an opportunity to improve.

name: Amy Nix
text: Five stars is for Dr. Klaiss, she is wonderful. Dr. Howton the last time I saw her was nice and considerate.

name: Shelby Davis
text: Went in today because I have a stomach virus and I never take my insurance card with me because they have it on file. I didn't have it with me so I told the lady they should have it on file and she said yes but it's a new year so I need it. (Which is untrue bc I work at a dental office and as long as they have the number they can pull it up online themselves to see what my co-pays are.) I went on my insurance website  and couldn't find the card but could find my policy and number and she said no I need you email the card to me, I said okay can you find it since you're saying it's on here and she said no I'm not allowed?!?! The office manager takes my phone to help me look and she couldn't find the link either so she writes my policy number down, verifies my insurance and collects my copay. But the front desk lady being rude and making me cry because she wasn't being helpful and I didn't feel good was uncalled for! Usually good people and good service BUT there are those rude ones you ocasially come across.

resp.text: Greetings. We appreciate your feedback. We welcome the opportunity to address all concerns. I am the patient advocate, and I can be reached at (205) 403-8902.. Thank you for allowing us to learn from you. Stay well.

name: Steve Chambers
text:
I don't write a lot of online reviews but when I was looking up the phone number for AFC I saw how poor all the other reviews were I felt compelled to share my experience.  I visited the clinic yesterday for a suspected broken collarbone.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  (And, yes, my collarbone was broken.)  I was given some prescriptions, discharge instructions and referred to my orthopedic surgeon.  Without asking, they made a copy of my x-ray to carry to my ortho.

No trip to the dr is "fun" but this one went about as well as possible.

name: Karam Maatouk
text: Best service I ever had, definitely best place to go in Tuscaloosa

resp.text: Karam Maatouk, thank you for sharing your positive experience!

name: Linda Travis
text: The provider and staff were very helpful and attentive to my needs. I also received a follow up call today.

resp.text: Linda, we are so pleased you enjoyed your visit to American Family Care - Tuscaloosa! Please don't hesitate to reach out if there's anything additional we can do for you.

name: Donna Davis Porter
text: Don't bother to even stop here if you are sick! My dog gets better care from her vet than what these quacks know. Total waste of time and money.

name: Kristin Kernop
text: This is by far the worst experience I have ever had at a walkin clinic. I have a history of kidney stones. I have been seen at AFC twice within the past several months with kidney stone like symptoms- pain, blood in urine, vomiting. The doctor I saw a few months back at a Birmingham location was very nice. However, I have relocated and visited the clinic in Tuscaloosa. The doctor I saw today was rude and completely neglectful. She walked in and said I have been seen at the clinic before and she couldn't help me. She asked which ER I wanted to go to and she discharged me. The entire point of me going to a walkin clinic was to avoid the hassle of the hospital. I left and went to a clinic a few miles down the road. This doctor took a simple X-ray of my abdomen and spotted the stone in my ureter that is causing me so much pain and discomfort. The doctor at AFC should have and could have done the exact same thing and she would have seen the stone. She could have easily treated me. Instead she was rude and sent me on my way. In short, I paid for her to send me somewhere else bc she was too much of a judgmental witch. I WILL be contacting her supervisor tomorrow and they will reimburse me. I will NEVER go back to this awful place. Don't waste your time or money.

name: brandy mcelrath
text: The lady at the front desk lied and said it was their policy to check blood pressure she said they did check mine and my husband's these were two separate days the nurse checked our records and said o yours weren't wrote down and your husband's is 122/something and that's a lie his is always high they bluntly lied.  They never checked them

name: Anya Nowicki
text: Basically had me do an MRI then told me they couldn't do anything. Sent me to the emergency room but didn't even send over the x ray so payed for 2 copays and an xray for no reason.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, and welcome the opportunity to address all concerns. I am the patient advocate, and I can be reached at (205) 403-8902. You can also submit concerns via a secure satisfaction survey at www.americanfamilycare.com. Thank you for allowing us to learn from you. Stay well.

name: Micah McKinney
text: Trash trash trash people extremely rude. Went there one morning after cutting my arm open & the employees there did not want to help getting an attitude with me as if why are you hear making us do work. They literally did the worst job ever. They did not stitch my arm up but used medical glue then didn't even close the cut all they way. Then just put peroxide on it & sent me on my way.

resp.text: Greetings. We appreciate your feedback. We welcome the opportunity to address all concerns. I am the patient advocate, and I can be reached at (205) 403-8902.. Thank you for allowing us to learn from you. Stay well.

name: S Hall
text: Very good place to go if yourin need of a Dr

name: Mike Rodgers
text: Terrible service. I had to go a little late because I can't leave work until 5. Seemed like all the staff had an atitiude and were just ready to get out of there. The doctor barely looked me over. Made up her own diagnosis. Gave me some shots and got me out of there. my symptoms have got progressively worse. I have had the same exact expierence at one of the other clinics. It's worth it to wait and try to get appt with your primary doctor because this place is a joke.

name: Edroy Francis
text: Reading the reviews had me a little worried but everyone on staff that I met was considerate and friendly. I left without any negative to say about my visit.

name: Morgan Carter
text: Horrible place to go. Went there a couple months ago, and the lady said I had a bill, I know I don't have a bill due to my insurance covering it all. So she gave me the corporate number and I called them, I've had the same insurance for a while. I go today thinking that the corporate office took care of it like they said they did and nope, never took care of it. They refused to see me. The lady was extremely rude to me at the place and even over the phone. I will NEVER go back there. And I will not pay that "bill" they say I owe. Couldn't even give me a print out or anything about what the bill was related too.

resp.text: Greetings. We appreciate your feedback. We welcome the opportunity to address all concerns. I am the patient advocate, and I can be reached at (205) 403-8902.. Thank you for allowing us to learn from you. Stay well.

name: Irene King
text: This place lost my liscense and I talked to corporate and they won't pay to get my liscense.. they don't have a camera over front desk just when they walk out of the front office area.. I was there for a while ... when I called corporate the lady was rude and she hung up on me! They are rude and I will never go back!

resp.text: Hi Irene, we regret to hear that you are displeased with your recent experience with us. Thank you again for taking the time to let us know how we can improve. We hope you will consider us again in the future. Take care.

name: Briana Whitson
text: The door says 7days a week 8-6 here at 8:30 the doors are locked and no has been answering the phone. Good thing i dint have a medical emergency.

resp.text: Briana Whitson, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We regret that you had a negative experience, and will use this as an opportunity to improve.

name: Kenny Burns
text: I came here for a pre employment tb screening and immunizations that the employer required (healthcare setting job that I did not end up accepting).  The mmr titer screen shows if you have ever had measles mumps rubella. I was immune to all but one, no big deal. And they told me that day I could get a measles shot if I wanted one. I didn't - I'm over 50 and see no need. I am not involved in direct patient contact either, business office.  A month later I got a letter saying one of my tests was abnormal - a little scary.  I called them, they said "We don't give tests results over the phone. You have to come to the office."  I went to office and they said, "you really need to see our doctor." Scary again. I said, "I just want my results and I'll see my own doctor." And they gave the print out of the measles screen. Wow... they just wanted to talk me into an immunization and used scare tactics to do that. I was thinking diabetes, or something terrible.  They do a lot of pre employment screening and are probably using this tactic for those who don't understand what this is about. Money. Rip off place - don't go here.  This is Angeline Burns

name: Cool Dud3
text: Always friendly and quick service.

resp.text: Brantley Harris, we strive for 100% satisfaction, and it is great to see you had such a positive experience at American Family Care - Tuscaloosa. Thanks again for taking the time to leave us this information about your recent visit. Take care!

name: MultiplesOfNico
text:
I really did like this clinic. They always took good care of me.
Until I need a refill on my medicine. I called it in at CVS for a week straight. Wondering what was going on, I called them. I need my medicine ASAP. Was told they needed my doctors permission to refill it. Called AFC and was told since I wasn't seen by the regular doctor, to call that lady. Called her and was told I had to make another doctors appointment to get my refill. She was very rude. Hang up on her and got one from Dr bobo, no questions asked.

I also came to ACF for an injury I had at work. The wait was longer than usual. Yet I'm in HORRIBLE pain. It was a little over 30 minutes. Yet no one was there but me. The staff wasn't even busy. They were eating, laughing and joking around.
Finally was taken in and diagnosed correctly. My medicine was supposed to be sent to CVS. I had no script. Was also told by one of the nurses that it was sent. CVS didn't have my meds. I'm in a lot of pain. I called AFC and was basically treated like I was stupid. Repeatedly being told "Is it in the paper's we gave you?", more than four times. -____-
Surely I know what a script is. After telling them "I wasn't given one", they keep putting me on hold. For two thirty minute on call waiting, I'm VERY upset and in PAIN.  I hanged up and went to DCH.

NEVER GOING BACK.

name: Nikki Yarbrough
text: Dr. Day has horrible bedside manner and staff is very rude and inconsiderate. Never expect to be seen before at least 1.5 hours wait and there will be no one in the waiting room nor will there be any cars in the parking lot. Would not recommend this clinic to anyone.

name: June Allen
text: Very courteous staff and really quick. I was in and out in about 30 minutes.

resp.text: June Allen, we are very happy we could provide you with a positive experience!

name: Patrick Hall
text: Myself, my wife and my son, all on 3 different visits were very unhappy with diagnosis and treatment.

resp.text: Hi Patrick, we regret to hear that you are displeased with your recent experience with us. Our manager would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at (205) 722-9500. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Christopher Wigington
text: Dr. Howton is talking to someone on the phone about what Christmas presents they want while I cough up a lung in this room waiting. I will never return to this place.

resp.text: Christopher, we regret to hear that you had this experience with us. Please reach out to us at your earliest convenience so we may further assist you in working towards a resolution. American Family Care - Tuscaloosa (205) 722-9500

name: Kristy Crews
text: Convenient and very helpful with polite staff!

resp.text: Kristy Crews, thank you for the high star rating!

name: Kristi Williams
text: Terrible experience with Dr Howton and Kelly the manager. Very unprofessional .

resp.text: We are disappointed to hear that you did not have a more positive experience with us at American Family Care - Tuscaloosa. Please reach out to us at (205) 722-9500 when you can so we can address this situation directly. Thank you and have a great day.

name: andy daffron
text: Friendly great staff

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Adam Miller
text: Friendly and fast. For a clinic, they do very well.

name: Koty Turner
text: Literally no one here. No sign on the door, no notice on the website. I called corporate for them to tell me that they're just not open today.

resp.text: Koty Turner, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We regret that you had a negative experience, and will use this as an opportunity to improve.

name: Patty Moore
text: Staff is always nice and helpful. Never have had to wait very long.

resp.text: Patty Moore, thank you so much for the positive review!

name: Heather B
text: Great staff and great care!

resp.text: Noon, thank you so much for the positive review!

name: Ricky Bayes

resp.text: Ricky Bayes, thank you so much for your high rating!

resp.text: Greetings. We appreciate your feedback. We welcome the opportunity to address all concerns. I am the patient advocate, and I can be reached at (205) 403-8902.. Thank you for allowing us to learn from you. Stay well.

resp.text: Greetings. We appreciate your feedback, and welcome the opportunity to address all concerns. I am the patient advocate, and I can be reached at (205) 403-8902.. Thank you for allowing us to learn from you. Stay well.

text: Very nice to me and kind

resp.text: Chanel Glenn, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback.

name: Ashley G
text: Called back and could only speak to the corporate office.  They refused to let me speak to the office where my husband was seen.  They had forgotten to give him a form back that he showed them and I requested it be mailed.   They denied our request and kept repeating that he could come pick it up if it was still there.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, and welcome the opportunity to address all concerns. I am the patient advocate, and I can be reached at (205) 403-8902.
