name: Triarii Cat
text: When I cut my finger they stitched me back up in no time

name: Shaniece Morris
text: Nasty receptionist horrible attitudes.!!!  Went for a physical for a job never want to return.!!

name: Whitney Wahl
text: Clean ans efficient.

name: John Ellis
text: After several years of subpar customer service, significant waits inside the lobby, and continual shifting in and out of physicians, they have shown some signs of improvement within the last 6 months.

name: kimberly arnold
text: So thankful and impressed with the care I received today. Dr.Thompson and his staff were so sweet, attentive and caring today.  Considering my bad circumstance, the visit could not have been any better in any way.

name: Xylair Sanchez
text: Called a week in advance to make an appointment for the covid test. I was told it is a walk in first come first serve. Was the first person in the door and the first to fill out paperwork. Had seven people get called back for the test before me. The staff said they did not know how the process works. Meanwhile members of staff not wearing maks as well people were not being told to wear masks.

name: HC Forgot
text: If it's Sunday or a Holiday and there are no other options available in Dothan, get in your car and drive as far as it takes to find another medical facility rather than going to this place. Dr. Travis Thompson is a joke. An MD who has no idea how to even ATTEMPT to communicate with a sick, anxious child that has autism. He was rude and extremely condescending. Instead of answering my son's questions he berated him. Instead of addressing concerns he belittled a sick, autistic child. Go somewhere else.

name: Dee hu
text: The people in the office were super nice and helpful. However, I was charged for the same service 3 times and after 3 days of trying no one will return my calls or emails. The one person at their cooperate office I did talk to was rude and unhelpful at all. They say they put patients first, however this clearly is just a saying

name: Alexis Brown
text: The staff is really friendly, everytime I’ve come here I have been in and out! AFC Dothan is amazing and have the best staff around!

name: Tammy Casteel
text: Was told I had to pay $20 co pay for covid test even though my insurance company(bcbs)states no co pay for covid testing. I paid receptionist $20 then she asked for my debit card to put on file. I wasn’t feeling well and wasn’t thinking at the time. I will be calling my insurance company to report this place. The NP was great, but the front desk receptionist was horrible.

name: Angie T
text: Emily Ingram, CRNP is wonderful and the best NP. She truly saved my life. Your company should be honored to have her as a NP at your facility! Thank you again for everything!

name: April Smith
text: I have been waiting for a solid week for afdc to make sure i get a medication they say that only a mail order pharmacy can fill. I called them wed and fri and today and i was told it would be fixed. Hours later nothing still has been done. I call and the medical staff does not answer the phone and if they do answer they pick it up and immediately hang it up.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We sincerely apologize about the issues you experienced, and we hope to make this right. Please reach out to pateitnadvocate@americanfamilycare.com so we can rectify this issue. Please include your full name, DOB, and a brief description of your experience.

name: NA
text: DON'T EVER GO HERE. They won't run your insurance correctly or even run it at all and when you try and contact them, no one answers. This place is also running a scam for covid testing. Testing is free at CVS, walgreens, and walmart go there because AFC is charging patients for it.

name: Jamie Trail
text: Any time I'm sick I go there, they are so helpful.  Yes sometimes it is slow but they can only help so many people at one time.  They are so kind and have thoroughly helped me Everytime!!!  I would absolutely recommend this place.  I've never had one person in the 5 years I've been going there ever be rude or anything but helpful and kind.  Some doctors/nurses have zero bedside manner, they hardly listen and you feel judged... It's the absolute opposite with this place, I don't have a primary care doctor simply because I love going to this place.  ❤️❤️❤️❤️ So thankful for providers that take their time and make you feel comfortable!!!

name: Jessica Umbarger
text: 30 people are ahead of me. This clinic is always slow as hell, but the ER would probably be slower. Which is where I was recommended to go when I told them I was in pain and my stuff would probably take very little time. I’m probably the only one in that waiting room in pain and to be honest I know what I probably have and just need a test and some medication. In other states you could just take this same test at home and get medicine from the local pharmacy. Really don’t even need to see the doctor. Just need medicine and to get home. I hate this place.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Jonathan L.
text: Waited about 5 hours, upon going inside to check my wait they said something like "We wrote your number down wrong". I know this is a lie because 1. the lady who wrote it down verbally verified she wrote it down correctly 2. I could see my number on the list written correctly. Of course they refuse to correct this mistake by putting me where I should be in line or moving me up the queue. Stupidity and incompotenency rule here, will avoid in the future.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Laura Wright
text: I waited an appalling amount of time to be seen by a doctor, close to 5 hours. When they first called me back in to retrieve my Id and insurance card after an hour they told me there were 6 more people in front of me, after originally telling me there were 20 ahead of me. And then after another hours time I went in to see how much longer and they said there were 9 people ahead of me. I was extremely ill, unlike most of the people there who I presume were getting rapid covid tests, and was extremely disheartened to hear this. The girl at the front didn’t care and chalked it up to a mistake being made earlier, wasn’t apologetic or anything. I hated them in that moment. The nurses and doctor were actually very nice and got the job done, but the wait is unacceptable. I DO NOT recommend this place.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Whitney Faulk
text: Everyone on staff is always friendly and professional. The medical field is tough to work in, yet they are always friendly and show great care and concern for their patients. The office is always clean and they are following all of the COVID guidelines. Thank you, AFC!

name: Andrea Rea
text: I loved everything about A.F. urgent care!!! The best urgent care I’ve ever been to. I was very impressed with Dr. Thompson who was very caring, thorough, professional, knowledgeable, and took his time with me, conducted necessary tests and lab work, and helped me with securing the next step in getting a specialist. I would like to make Dr. Thompson my primary care physician.  He’s the kind of doctor you dream to have. Bianca and Bee, who are his nurses and tech were wonderful, friendly, and caring.  Everything is very clean and covid 19 safety measures taken.

name: Chelle Ham
text: Called to get a COVID19 test just as a precaution before visiting family for Thanksgiving and they do not test patients in their cars. This method seems much safer as that leads to less foot traffic in the office. I will not be going to AFC Dothan!

name: Carol Buie
text: Have been trying for over 3 hours to get someone on the phone and when I do I get transferred to the back where no one else answer the phone. Just trying to my prescription transferred to another pharmacy. I waited for 5 hours on Christmas Eve to been seen. They need management and phone nurse.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional.Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Carlos Marin
text: Excellent staff and service even in Covid times, great local solution for Covid testing for international travel purposes

resp.text: If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Pam Smith
text: My first time with this facility.. I was very impressed. At the no long wait time..the friendliness of the entire staff. They addressed my concerns and my needs very quickly,  friendly and professionally. I will go back again. Thank you!!

resp.text: If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Jay D.
text: I will state that the people are very courteous, friendly, and inviting!!  As prompt as possible, which is a good thing during 2020!!  If the need arises, I will be sure to visit them again!  Bed side manner was very comforting, as well!!

name: HEATHER ANDRES
text: I wouldn't even give this place a 1 star, it just won't let me post ithout it. I would NEVER go here again. They gave me a prescription at a dosage for a child not an adult. I waited 5 hours just to be seen. The front desk lady was rude and acted like she hated her job and had no compassion or just thought of others. I paid them to tell them what I had. I had to tell them 3 times what I was allergic to. They don't take any kind of history. DO NOT GO HERE!

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Andrea Bergman
text: The Dr. is excellent at this facility. He listens and tries to see another perspective before looking at his own. Excellent!

name: Mr. Dan Blk
text:
I had to make another visit to AFC this Saturday morning due to foot Issue. The Staff member upfront was very friendly. But the Dr. and staff in back was even better. If you have to get a shot you want Ms. McKinney she knows her business.

This is that place to go for service within and hour.

Keep you the great service.

Dan Blackman

name: Travis Eidson
text: Staff are professional and display a caring attitude. I was very impressed by the services I received.

name: Scottie Penley
text: Everyone was very nice and kept me informed of what was going on. Other than the expected wait, it was a pleasant experience.

name: Carol Deal

name: Bobbie Houston
text: I called 15 minutes before closing because my daughter had injured her arm.  They told me to come on and they would see her.  When we got there EVERYONE was so nice to us. We were not rushed and they didnt act like we were imposing.  We received wonderful treatment!

name: Peace Bomba
text: COMPLETE NEGLIGENCE!! I was treated very poorly at this urgent care. I went in feeling very ill (Fever, Sore throat, cough, nausea, stuffy nose) and wanted to get tested for Covid. The wait was over 45 minutes, then once I finally got inside the room, my vitals were taken I was swabbed for covid (inaccurately, I may add). After being swabbed, I waited about 30-45 minutes for my results which the nurse stated was negative. I was provided with some papers, one of which had random prescriptions. When I asked about them, the nurse gave odd explanations as to why it would still work. I noticed that the vitals and my symptoms were also documented incorrectly as I had a fever that was over 100 degrees. When I mentioned my concerns, I was completely dismissed and disregarded. Once I got to the pharmacy, I realized that I was provided a completely different patient’s paperwork. THIS IS COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE and a major HIPPA violation. I went back to this urgent care to get things situated, and the staff gave me nasty attitudes and not one person cared or provided an apology for this negligence. The staff is irresponsible and I don’t recommend this place at all. I will also be suing.

name: Aline Roberts
text: This office is so professional and patient oriented. From the time you walk in, through the intake and seeing the physician, you are made to feel comfortable and welcomed. text: INSURANCE FRAUD: we are covered by Cigna insurance company. American Family Care has a contract with them @ they do accept our insurance. Our insurance requires my husband @ I to have a yearly physical, no out of pocket cost. On August 2019 I had this same physical done at this facility @ no charge. Today July 22, 2020 they are demanding $50 per patient for a the same physical what a rip off. My insurance agent has stated that this is against their contract @ will be reported. If u find that u are having the same problem u can go 2 All South Urgent Care here in Dothan @ u wont have 2 come out of pocket. What a shame I've used AFC for years. But I'm  taking my health care needs to the above mentioned facility.

text: Came in for a simple sports physical for my daughter at 11:40. Everything progressed normally and they didn't seem busy with just two other parties in the waiting room. She said she would find out and be back, but didn't come back. A little before 2pm we gave up and went to the front desk to get our money back and our physical form back. They did refund us and apologize for the wait but this should have been addressed long before a patient walks out.

name: Brian Smith
text:
TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED!
I went into American Family Care  on June 29th for a Covid19 test.  Got there early and was out by 8:45 am.  I was told it would take 3-5 days to get the results.  After 5 days I had received no results nor calls from them.  On the 8th day, July 6th, I called and got the "I guess they're backed up at the lab" story.  Then the girl told me "I'll give you the number to the lab and you can call them and find out what the problem is".   It would seem to me that's THEIR job not mine.  I finally got my results today July 9th at 5:15 pm. I was the one that called them! It was nine days after I'd taken the test.  The person there had the gall to tell me they tried to call me today.  I've had my phone with me all day and have no record of them calling on my recent calls log.  A simple phone call explaining the delay would have eased a lot of my stress.
Pretty bad...

text: Don't waste your time at this joke of a clinic. I came in for a sinus infection and a cough. I waited to be seen for two hours. Once I got to the back they drew my blood for labs. After spending an entire night in the ER waiting room...the hospital said I was completely fine besides having the sinus infection and acute bronchitis. Let me rewind and say that the Nurse Practitioner that I seen at AFC didn't even treat my symptoms that I came in for, the ER doctor had to write me a prescription for antibiotics. I called the next day and spoke with the office manager and all they did was offer me a refund on my $20 copay. GO ANYWHERE ELSE BUT HERE!!!

name: Cindy Kelly
text: I was very pleased when I got home after my visit to see I had a copy of my vitals, prescription print out, and a detailed receipt for my records. Then today I got a call from my nurse checking on me to make sure I was doing better. I will definately make this my place of service in the future and highly recommend you to friends and family. Thank you for a speedy and thorough evaluation when I was there as well. You made me feel like was an important asset even though I didn't get there until 5:25. Made a big impression!

name: Ronald Grosser
text: I am very pleased with the care I received from the nurse practitioner and the staff. Thank you.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Darja Byrne
text: This place is horrible!  We have had to wait over 3 hrs and still haven't seen the doctor. He's so busy I think with all of 7 patients when we arrived and the 7 includes the 2 of us!!! After 3 hrs we were brought back and had to wait an additional 1 hr. My grandson became faint for lack of food we didn't eat because we were told there was a 1 1/2 hr wait. When I asked if they had some orange juice, gatorade or crackers they said no. What doctor office doesn't have items in case patients sugar levels plummet because they have to wait for over 4 hours? Not the ones I have worked at!  So the Dr. ARRIVES and diagnosed him without any kind of strep or nasal test and puts him on steroids,  antibiotics and cough syrup.  And that took all of 5 min. Perhaps 10 since he was there when I arrived with the food. While we were in the room waiting the girls were having all kinds of fun laughing great customer service!  I'm going to send them an invoice after all our time is just as valuable as theirs.

resp.text: Hi there, I would like to get some more details about your experience with us. Our manager would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at (334) 677-6001. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Elizabeth Harris
text: Staff seemed to really care about their patients. Was not along wait at all.  I thought it was great they called me back the next day and wanted to know how I was feeling.  Was very willing to listen to my complaints that I was feeling about the other facility I had went too. Very caring.

resp.text: Hi Elizabeth, we are very happy to have provided you with such a positive experience! If you have any further questions, please don't hesitate to reach out!

name: Karrie Sedor
text: Great place when in need

name: Tony Walker
text:
Anyone looking for quick and friendly place for medical i give AFC a 10.  I have been there several times.  Has always been a great experience.

Dr Lee Thomas and his staff are great.  Dr Thomas is great to visit with.

I hope you not have to go to Dr soon, but if you do; this is place to go

resp.text: Tony Walker, thank you so much for the positive review!

name: Liz Diggs
text: I always go to this walk in clinic when sick. I have sinus infections a couple of times a year. This time had an infected finger from a cut. Needed a tetanus  shot and antibiotics.   Always get in and out quickly and get excellent care. I recommend them all the time.

name: Deon C
text: Doctor sent lab work to LabCorp instead of Quest as we instructed. As a result our insurance denied our claim and we are responsible for the full amount and it would have been zero if the had done a good job. Thy have a contract with BC&BS and knew and agreed to their rules, but apparently they don't care.

resp.text: Deon C, we're disappointed to hear of the negative experience you had at our location. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

name: Danny Thomas
text: Very punctual and professional care! If an emergency room and a doctors office had a love child, it would definitely be American Family Care! Big thanks to Dr. Thompson and the AFC staff!

resp.text: Hi Danny Thomas, thank you so much for your positive comments about American Family Care - Dothan! We are always more than happy to assist you if anything else comes up. Take care!

name: rebecca
text: Very friendly and prompt. Traveling from out of town and everyone was very helpful.

resp.text: We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Jeanie Mann
text: I could not have been more pleased with American Family Care. I've tried other urgent care offices in Dothan and will only be going to American Family Care from now on. The front office staff was friendly, the staff who took my vitals was cheerful, even at work on a Saturday, the wait time was less than 5 minutes, and the doctor was very friendly and caring. The best part was before I could even make it home, I had a text from my pharmacy letting me know that my prescription was ready for pickup. To top it off, I received a call today from AFC to see how I was feeling. Great experience!

name: Onyx Cutts
text: The office was spotless and very modern looking. Excellent care, even when very close to closing time. My girlfriend had a UTI and was in great pain. We went to All South on 231 first, and they were very rude so we left. The care here was great, and everyone was extremely nice. We spoke to Erin when we were first called back. She was very accommodating. The nurse practitioner was was upbeat, understanding, and down to earth. The office even called her the next day (ON A SUNDAY) to check and see how she was doing. Highly recommended!

name: The Cooleys
text:
Since we lost our primary care physician a few years ago, we have used AFC for pretty much everything. The staff is friendly and the doctor(s) are helpful.

The wait can sometimes be a little long, but it is an urgent care facility so that should be expected.

We have and will continue to recommend AFC to others.

resp.text: Hi The Cooleys, thank you so much for your positive comments about American Family Care - Dothan!

name: Jessica Marienthal
text: Never been but called today. One of the only clinics open. The receptionist was rude when I asked if they took Medicaid. Why is it so hard to find a walk in clinic that takes Medicaid in Alabama????????

resp.text: Our manager would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at 334-677-6001. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: matthew quinn
text: Broken two bones in my foot and Heather was the best part!

name: Bryan Stewart
text: Dr. Thompson had a very Down to Earth manner that made me feel comfortable and relaxed.  Erin was very professional, and was glad to accommodate my special request of getting my wife to the examination room for me.  Overall it was a positive experience.

resp.text: Thank you very much for sharing these comments, Bryan Stewart. We always love to receive great feedback.

name: Bobby Bergeron
text: Very disappointed. Brought my child there on a Sat while her pediatrician offices was closed. She had a fever and a body rash. They literally said they didn't know what was wrong gave her an antibiotic and a steroid and sent us packing. No improvement of symptoms whatsoever. Brought her to the pediatrician office that Monday. She had full blown strep throat for at least five days that manifested into scarlet fever causing a rash according to her Dr. with the correct antibiotic her health improved rapidly. They were amazed the other Dr. couldn't diagnose it. I understand somethings are hard to catch, but a toddler with strep is not one of those things. I would think that's med school 101. They were either careless, incompetent, or lazy, take your pick. Don't flush your hard earned money down the drain here.

resp.text: Bobby Bergeron, we regret that you had a negative experience with us, but are glad you brought this to our attention. Our manager would really like to help turn your experience around. If you would be willing to give us another chance, please contact our manager at (334) 677-6001 to discuss what we can do to help.

name: Eleanor Ashie
text: I was seen by Abby, CRNP who was very professional with good bedside manners. To me that's excellent service! Thanks to all the AFC staff for taking good care of me. God bless you all!!

resp.text: Eleanor, we're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations! Our team strives to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out!

name: Paige Lincoln
text: Dr. T us so kind, professional,  and caring. He never rushes in and out the door. He listens and cares for the correct treatment for his patients . I drive further just to see him because he's so caring and thorough.

resp.text: Hi Paige, thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us at American Family Care - Dothan. We're happy we could meet your expectations! If you have any further questions, please give us a call. We're always happy to help!

name: Jo Ann Sutton
text: I have used AFC many times and have always found personnel to be professional and very helpful.

resp.text: We are always more than happy to assist you if anything else comes up. Take care!

name: Robert Forehand
text: Very satisfied! A bit of a wait but Dr was through. Very pleased!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Shonda Newsome
text: Dr.Travis Thompson is a wonderful Dr and he's the only one i see there. He genuinely concerned about your health and will pull all stops until you are better. I have only four stars because the receptionist(s) need better customers service

name: Chad White
text: Whenever a kidney stone drops then you want to trust that the Google reviews and hours are accurate especially when trying to avoid a ridiculous e.r. co-pay.  For this place....they are not.....the physician not only was not there at 5:30 p.m. but they also close at 6 p.m. now instead of the 8 p.m. listed.  Please update your hours and rather or not a physician is there as perscribing aspirin for a kidney stone is worthless.

resp.text: Chad White, it's upsetting to hear that you did not receive the top-notch service we strive to provide. Please contact us at (334) 677-6001 so we can work with you to make this right.

name: Chas Cambo
text:
Thanks for the prompt courteous service.   Even though many people preceded me the wait was not long at all.  Today I'm all fixed up & feel great 👍🏻

Thank you AFC

resp.text: Chas, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here at American Family Care - Dothan! We are always more than happy to assist you if anything else comes up. Take care!

name: Joann Bradley
text: Jessica and Miranda were both so genuinely sweet. I overheard four patients asking if Dr. Thompson was in,  and after seeing him I realized why. He was friendly, personable, and asked all the right questions on how I was feeling. I was in and out within an hour. I was going on a week feeling miserable,  but was able to get a steroid shot and medication sent to my pharmacy. This staff has changed my perception on urgent cares. Thank you so much.

resp.text: Joann, we're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations! If you're ever in need of more help, please let us know!

name: Megan Collins
text: Phenomenal staff from the time I walked in until the time I left. Lacie, aj Welch and Dr. Thompson were great and I was in and out in less than 45 minutes. Already feeling better in less than 24 hours. Thank you for a great experience.

name: serena Robinson
text: My provider was awesome.. very impressed that they followed up the following day.. I feel great now

resp.text: Serena, we are so happy to read such a great review about American Family Care - Dothan! Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you; we are more than happy to help!

name: Marie “Ellie” Hatcher

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We hope you have a great day!

name: Tasha Burgess
text: I really love American Family Care. The nurse and doctor were friendly and fantastic!! I especially like the printout they give you at the end which gives you all the details about your visit. I truly appreciate the quality of care they provide.

resp.text: Tasha, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here at American Family Care - Dothan! We are always more than happy to assist you if anything else comes up. Take care!

text: AFC is the best Urgent Care office in the Dothan area. Wait time is wonderful ...The only place me and my family will go to from now on..... Dr Thompson is the Best!

resp.text: Phyllis, thank you so much for the positive review! Please don't hesitate to reach out if there's anything additional we can do for you.

name: Carmeshia Walker
text: I have to say I was extremely pleased with my care today. I've been in so much pain for months, but Dr. Thompson assured me that he would help me. The atmosphere was pleasant and they are very kind-hearted. I will most definitely recommend this practice.

resp.text: Hi Carmeshia, thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us at American Family Care - Dothan. We're happy we could meet your expectations! Thank you again for letting our team know how we did! We look forward to helping again in the future. Take care!

resp.text: Candace Devine, we're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations! We do hope we can be of assistance in the future. Take care!

name: Lindsay Morrison
text: It was an u expected visit. Everyone was super helpful they even helped me choose a pharmacy since we were from out of town. Definitely recommend them!

resp.text: Lindsay Morrison, we're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations!

name: Patricia Donovan
text: I went there very ill and it is close to my house.  After an hour I ask how much longer and find out that she hasn't even put my paperwork in the computer yet and it could be another hour.  They don't do triage. .. I find that inexcusable for supposed Urgent Care!   I could barely sit up any longer or walk so I left.  Apparently if you've been there before you get a free ride to the back and newbies have to wait for an incompetent receptionist to get around to them.

resp.text: Hi Patricia Donovan, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience. We are disappointed to hear that you are not satisfied with your visit. We would like to have a better understanding about your experience. Please reach out to us at (334) 677-6001 at your earliest convenience and we will do our best to resolve this with you.

name: Margaret Jackson
text: I have brought my daughter here several times. They always provide great service. Will recommend this clinic to all my friends and family.

resp.text: Kendra Jackson, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We always love to receive great feedback.

name: Christi Wood
text: Feeling like I had been hit by a truck, I decided it was time to let a doctor diagnose and medicate me.  My husband suggested we go to AFC so we went.  The doctor was very attentive and went so far as to make sure I had an excuse for work which, being sick, I didn't even think about.  Doctor knew what he was talking about because I feel 110% better since my appt yesterday!  Thanks AFC!

resp.text: Christi Wood, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We are glad to hear that you had a positive experience!

name: Wendy Parker
text: I had to take my husband into the office this past Saturday. As always it was a easy check in & a short wait. The staff is wonderful & Dr Thompson took  the time to listen to what was going on with my husband. American Family Care is the only walk in clinic that we will use.

name: Danny McDuffie
text: Convenient

name: Jay DoubleU
text: Not very impressed with the facility. The receptionist was lacking in the personality department. The nurse was actually very good at his job. As for the Dr. Not very professional. talked to me more about voting for our next president, than what was going on with me. All in all it felt like I was giving money to a charity, without the feeling of doing something good, because I truly received no care. The total office visit lasted  nearly 3 hours.

name: Paul DeBeer
text: Fast, professional care.  Very informative.

resp.text: We can't wait to see you again, have a great day.

name: Daltrey Fryer
text: The staff was great and the doctor was great they really make you feel at home and welcomed there. I would definitely recommend this facility to other people.

resp.text: Daltrey we are so pleased you enjoyed your visit to American Family Care - Dothan! Thanks again for the recommendation, and have an amazing day!

name: Edward Cook
text: Be aware, there is a doctor there ONLY mom-thurs.

resp.text:
Thank you Mr. Cook for your review.  We strive to provide quality service to all of our patients.  You may call the clinic to insure that there is a medical doctor on staff that day if necessary.  Our nurse practitioners can also see a very wide range of medical issues.  Thank you again and we hope to see you again in the future.
Cindy Dumas-Director

name: Catherine Cole
text: If I could give minus stars I would! At the start the blonde receptionist should not be greeting people she has a bad attitude definitely not a customer service people person! Makes you feel like you’re bothering her. Secondly I was there two hours waiting just to get approval to see a Dr. nothing my office or headquarters or Workman’s comp Ins sent was good enough. I finally said should I go to PrimeCare? Because my manager said we never had all this problem there. She says “ yeah you should”! I was like wow! Ok ! Thank you very much! And walked out! Went to PrimeCare they had me approved and waiting in the Dr room in 5 min and very sweet!!! GO TO PRIMCARE NOT THIS PLACE!!! Horrible service horrible attitude not professional at all!

resp.text: We regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us 334-677-6001 to speak to our manager directly.

name: James Lanley
text: Wait time was not long. Receptionist, RN, and the Doc “Cowboy” were excellent. I’d highly recommend going there if you need care. -

resp.text: James, we are so pleased you enjoyed your visit to American Family Care - Dothan! If you're ever in need of more help, please let us know!

name: Bernie Alexander
text: With the exception of having to wait almost as long in a hospital waiting room the overall experience was over the top.  The greeting was very professional and the concern that was given to. My personal need make you want to firgef about the hospital ER and go back here..

resp.text: Hi Bernie, we are very happy to have provided you with such a positive experience! We do hope we can be of assistance in the future. Take care!

name: Mrs Richardson
text: Everyone was nice and had good attitudes for having to work on Labor Day.  We were there a reasonable amount of time.

resp.text: Hi Mrs Richardson, we are very happy to have provided you with such a positive experience! Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you; we are more than happy to help!

name: Elizabeth Peavey
text: Went to see Dr. Abby about 3 weeks ago. I was very happy with the care I received while I was there but the after care likes much improvement. The specialist I was referred to was given the wrong information and because of that I now have to wait until March of 2018.The problem I having keeps me in a lot of pain so I called back today to talk to someone about medication to help me and I was rudely told you will have to wait until you see the specialist. So wow thanks for nothing. I guess if  I get where I can't walk thats ok too.

resp.text: Elizabeth, we regret to hear that you had this experience with us. Falling short of meeting your expectations is not to the standards we strive to achieve, and we humbly ask for the opportunity to make this right. Thank you providing this information so we can improve upon our services. We hope to hear from you soon.  American Family Care - Dothan

name: Robin Bundy
text: Took my daughter to find out about some leg pain she was having.   They did X-rays and then scheduled her for other testing at hospital.   We haven’t heard anything about the results, so I called.   They “can’t” give me the results over the phone.  They “can’t” mail us the results.  So now, I have to go pick them up at the office.  My daughter will be in pain a total of 16 days (at least, because she never tells me stuff right away) before we will be able to find out why she is having the pain and inability to put weight on her leg.  REALLY???  I do not recommend going here if you want the people who ordered your tests to do their job and let you know the results!!

resp.text: Robin Bundy, we regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. Thanks for bringing this matter to our attention. We would like to get more details about this; please reach out to us at your earliest convenience at (334) 677-6001.

name: Stacy Johnston
text: The Staff and Doctors are all courteous, professional and very thorough in their assessments. We go for Preventive care, PPP, and "no need for ER" boo boos. Extra points fo ALWAYS having a very clean and tastefully decorated waiting area which makes you NOT dread going to the doctor's office.👍👍

resp.text: Hello Stacy, thank you; we appreciate your feedback! Please don't hesitate to reach out if there's anything additional we can do for you.

name: Jennifer Riffee
text: I walked in on a Sunday to sign in. First thing out of the woman's mouth, 'We have a 3.5 to 4 hour wait' that was my greeting. Six people in the waiting room. I chose not to stay but because that is insane.

resp.text: Jennifer, we pride ourselves on providing exceptional service, so we are disappointed to hear that your visit with us was anything less than satisfactory. Please reach out to us at (334) 677-6001 so we may assist you in moving forward towards a resolution.

name: Andrea Bergman
text: Thought I had exceptional care.

resp.text: If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Amber Jowers
text: Front desk was extremely slow about getting people check in. I waiting in the long area 43 minutes before she called me up for my copay and checked me in. But the back half was amazing. I was very sick and vomiting unable to drive and they called my husband to come get me. Put my in a room kept check on me and making sure I was ok until my husband got there to get me. They were more worried about my wellbeing then to just let me drive out and get in a wreck or something worse. To me that is everything and I would recommend this office to anyone, they are wonderful people who care.

resp.text: Amber, we are so pleased you enjoyed your visit to American Family Care - Dothan! If you're ever in need of more help, please let us know!

name: Judy Crowe
text: Great staff. I've never waited long.

resp.text: If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: MHatcher
text: Went to this place because I was having severe pain on my right side. They did tests and an x-ray guessing it may be my gallbladder. Said they were gonna make me an appointment for an ultrasound the next day, they made one and the appointment isn’t until 4 days later. Called back asking if they can prescribe something for pain to hold me until the ultrasound. Their reply was go to the ER. If you plan on coming here for anything other than a cold you’re better off just heading to the ER because that’s what they are gonna tell you. They expect you to spend thousands on an ER visits instead of actually listening to the patient. I’ve never taken anything beyond ibuprofen in my life.

resp.text: Mhatcher, thank you for leaving us feedback. We are disappointed to hear that your experience was not a positive one. We appreciate you bringing this experience to our attention. If you are willing, please contact us at (334) 677-6001 so we can work towards a resolution. We look forward to hearing from you.

text: Awful experience. Don’t recommend using this place.

resp.text: We would like the chance to turn your experience around. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us at 334-677-6001 to speak to our manager directly.

text: 10 + The staff was very helpful and friendly and Dr Thompson actually listened to me and had a genuine concern for my health. I will definitely visit again.

resp.text: Alan, we really appreciate your positive review! We can't wait to see you again, have a great day.

text: Love how my son can be seen when the regular doctor is closed.  We were even able to get his vacancies update.

resp.text: Ashli Hancock, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback.

name: Lisa Green
text: Very nice and helpful staff, doctor's treatment helped me feel better and on my way to getting well!

resp.text: Lisa, we are glad we could help! We can't wait to see you again, have a great day.

name: Roger Sasser
text: Everyone was so nice! From the receptionist x-ray tect. to the Doctor!  Very professional! Answered all my questions. Thank you so much! This was my first visit. But not my last!

name: Rachel Ivy
text: Waited for at least 30 minutes after vitals were taken before someone came to see me, but the real issue I had was their sending my prescription to the wrong pharmacy. Not only did they send it to the wrong pharmacy, but they told ME to call my pharmacy and the pharmacy they’d sent it to to fix their mistake. I did, but the pharmacy they’d sent it to was already closed. I called the office back to ask them to just fax it to my actual pharmacy, but, by that time, their office had already closed.

resp.text: We are disappointed to hear that you did not have a more positive experience with us at American Family Care - Dothan. Thanks for bringing this matter to our attention. We would like to get more details about this; please reach out to us at your earliest convenience at (334) 677-6001.

name: Bart Norton
text: I always pleased with the level of care I receive. They also follow up with to see how you are doing.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! We're glad to hear we delivered such a great experience. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help!

name: Stephanie MacKenzie
text: My boyfriend just left here.  He specifically asked before paying and waiting if they would be able to help with his eye problem or if he should go to the ER.  He explained what was going on and what he had already done for it.  The girl at the front told him that they could help him here.  The doctor looked at his eye, gave no diagnosis, and told him to go to the ER.  Now we are out $175 with no resolution.  We could have used that money to go to the ER in the first place if the girl at the front had been more honest instead of just wanting to take our money.  What a waste.  The only reason I have one extra star is because the wait time that he was quoted was actually about right, even though it was still 3 hours.

resp.text: Greetings. We appreciate your feedback, and welcome the opportunity to address all concerns. I am the patient advocate, and I can be reached at (205) 403-8902.. Thank you for allowing us to learn from you. Stay well.

name: Brenda Sikes
text: I am well pleased with the treatment I received at American Family Care. The staff were professional and efficient. I would recommend AFC to anyone needing medical services

resp.text: Brenda, reviews like this give us motivation and help us ensure we provide high-quality care. Please don't hesitate to reach out to us if there's anything more we can do!

name: Cody Tarter
text: Very positive experience. Friendly folks. Will definitely come back for urgent care needs.

resp.text: Cody , reviews like this give us motivation and help us ensure we provide high-quality care. Thank you, and have a fantastic day!

name: Brenna O'Connor
text: My visit was great. I came in for vaccinations for school and it was a very pleasant exprience. Dr. Thompson and the entire staff was great.

resp.text: Thank you, Brenna O'Connor, for reaching out to us. Your opinion plays an integral part in our customer service. We always love to receive great feedback.

name: Marcia Bryant
text: I went into the facility and upon signing in the receptionist stated the wait will be 1 hour and 20 minutes, with only two people waiting before me. As much pain as I was in, I waited because the emergency room would have possibly been a longer wait. I went in because of severe chest pains and back pains. Needless to say I was prescribed a medication for stomach ulcers. And given a long speech about drinking soda, keeps him making money. Left still in pain and know understanding of why my chest has been hurting for a week, I will never go there again.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, and welcome the opportunity to address all concerns. I am the patient advocate, and I can be reached at (205) 403-8902. You can also submit concerns via a secure satisfaction survey at www.americanfamilycare.com. Thank you for allowing us to learn from you. Stay well.

text: Thank you so much for being attentive, kind and meeting my needs. I'm already feeling better.

text: Wow very impressed! They got me in and out and the prescription that was prescribed has me feeling a lot better just a day later!

text: I Have been Going THERE for 3YEARS  PEOPLE THINK BECAUSE YOU DON'T SEE DOCTORS NAME ON BUILDING THE DOCTORS COME AND GO NOT TRUE IHAVE BEEN SEEING DOC THOMAS HE IS MY PRIMARY YOU CAN FIND ONE THERE IGO WHEN I AM SICK HURT REFILLS FLU SHOTS ANY THING AND THE NURSE'S Know how to NOT BRUISE WHEN YOUR DOCTOR TELL YOU NOT TO DAY GO THERE WANT WAIT LONG.

name: Jonathan Noble
text: Staff is friendly and professional, and the facility clean. If you have a fairly simple, straightforward problem or difficulty, then AFC might be the place to go (although the upfront cost is $175).  My own experience, however, was less than satisfying. For a total of $225 over two visits, I had six vials of blood taken and a review of the results but without any real treatment of my ailments. The physician who saw me to review my blood test results (for $50) basically told me to take fish oil and would not even consider a refill on the prescription the first physician had given, much less any other medication and/or treatment for my ailments. All in all, then, I have to say I was/am dissatisfied. (Also, their feedback form does not come up when clicked on, soooo you cannot provide feedback directly to AFC!)

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, and welcome the opportunity to address all concerns. I am the patient advocate, and I can be reached at (205) 403-8902.. Thank you for allowing us to learn from you. Stay well.

name: ChiLover !
text: My husband went in to get his BP medication refilled because we moved here from out of state and do not have a Dr here. They charged him $150 for that and that is all they did. He was told when he had to go back that it would only be $50 if it was just for his medicine refill and nothing else ( and this is a med he has been taking for about 7 years and he can't go without it). But when he went back they charged him $175 (even more than the first visit). He is on SSDI and doesn't receive Medicare yet so he has to pay cash! I think this is ridiculous to charge that much just to get a medication refill and not have anything else done! You would think they could have a little compassion on someone that is disabled and living just off Social Security and has low income! And the visit only took the time it took for the Dr to write it out! Actually he probably could have just seen the nurse for that!

resp.text: Mary Flanagan, thank you for leaving us feedback. We are disappointed to hear that your experience was not a positive one. We would like the opportunity to address your concerns. Please reach out to use directly at (334) 677-6001 when you have a chance. Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Samantha Johnson
text: I went in for common sinus issues, knew I needed a shot or Zpack and cough meds my horrible cough. They prescribed me cough meds that wasn't working. AFC called me the DAY AFTER to check on me. I informed them the cough meds weren't working. The receptionist told me to hold and she would check on it for me. Well couple min later she tells me she can't have another doctor prescribe me anything bc the doctor I had saw yesterday wasn't in until Wednesday the next week. I was informed I would have to come in and see a different doctor and pay another co-pay. I called again today to see if they could speak with his nurse  to see if I could get anything done. NOTHING they didn't offer anything other than come in pay again and see another doctor. So I have to spend more money and time I don't have for something that is a simple fix. This is my first and last time ever using a AFC.. On the plus side Dr. Thompson was great I just wish they wouldn't have called to check on me they aren't going to do anything to help.

resp.text: Good morning. I am the patient advocate. The experience you depict does not meet the service expectations American Family Care has set. text: Very disappointed In this company. I went in for a physical and was told that the cost would be $50 for the service. I was ok with that being as how I paid for the service. A couple of weeks later I received a bill in the mail for $87. The description of the bill says office visit that is it. No other description on the bill or from a representative. I called and they said they would file a claim for the bill but never herd anything back. AFC you will never get any of my business or any referrals from me. Sending someone a "office visit" bill a few weeks after your original office visit is crooked no matter if it's $87 or $87,000.

So If you want to do business with a doctor who refuses treatment to a 10 week pregnant woman with a bleeding toe and a ripped off toenail, this is your place!

name: Al Brennan
text: I wanted to follow up my previous review concerning my experience with Taylorville Family medical. I have to say, the experience I received has been and I believe will be one of the best experience I will ever receive. The entire time I was there, from check in to examination and then my release, was over all,  a very good experience. They are truly very kind through my experience and I definitely will recommend them to anyone looking for a primary care physician and facility. I can’t thank them enough for their overall healthcare.

text: I had hardly any wait time.  The nurses and technicians were quick but thorough.  It was a very positive experience.

name: Gabrielle Myers
text: I really like Jodi and Dr. Burdette but i had a bad experience that was horrible. The financial lady embarrassed me in front of a full waiting room a while back instead of pulling me in an office or something. She was by no means quiet either. I will never recommend to anyone now.

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback Gabrielle! We apologize for the uncomfortable experience that you faced, we will look into it further.

name: Lillian Rogers
text:
If I could give this place less stars, I would. I have given this places multiple chances seeing as I have gone here since I was a kid. However, the NP laughed at me, belittled me, and embarrassed me during my last Pap smear.
I decided to give this place another chance a year later for a physical, I was transferred THREE times, repeated what I needed THREE times, and placed on hold for over 5 minutes. This place has gone downhill. Save your time & money.

resp.text: Thank you for being such a long term customer at TFM Lillian! I apologize for the inconvenience that has transpired, we will look into the issue further! Thanks for the feedback.

name: Rex Perkins
text:
I was a patient of Dr. Burdette's for over 10 years. A great doctor she is. However, she no longer owns TFM and it seems like the greedy corporation take over has ruin what was once a great doctor's office.

I showed to an appointment recently that was badly needed, as I had some concerns about me health including new issues. I had no prior contact with the office in any way before my appointment or was told nothing at previous visits. But money is what they wanted. I had no idea I had a bill, but the first thing they told me was "you can't be seen today" and then go on to tell me about the bill, which I offered to pay on, but I didn't have my cc with me at the time and offered to pay when I came back in a few days to get blood work results.

They gave their spiel about how doctors need to get paid too, and would I work without expecting to get paid, and blah blah blah. I' believe people deserve to get paid for good services. After all, I had been coming there for over 10 years and paid ever single bill prior, so why would anyone think I wouldn't pay this one. I've my own business before, I know it's important to get paid.  But shouldn't human decency and kindness be the first form of communication one starts with instead of the "I want my money first" attitude?

For me, I felt abandon by a doctor's office that I had been coming to for years. That I trusted my children with. I was given zero notice before being told I couldn't be seen. I was over due for certain treatments that I have to see the doctor or nurse to receive. I had concerns about my blood pressure and other issues that were important to prevent increased medical problems. I didn't want to hear their spew about "working for free" or we have to be paid to continue services, I wanted to hear. "Ok, what can we do to help you out? We're here for you." Treat people like this first I guarantee you will always get paid.

Or at the least I wanted the bare treatment until I had enough time to find another doctor for treatment, but I wasn't even given that. Yes, they offered to see me again, but made it clear I was going to have to jump through some hoops and pay, always with an emphasis on getting paid, never about what I thought doctors first priority was supposed to be: to do no harm an give their patients the best medical care they can ( not for free of course), but a good doctor put's people first. Dr. Burdette always did this, but this new corporation or whomever owns Taylorville Family Medicine now, IS ALL ABOUT THE MONEY AND COULDN'T CARE LESS ABOUT YOU. It's sad, and I foresee more year long patients leaving in time, as well. It's not the same anymore.

resp.text: Hey Rex thank you for taking the time to write us a review! Our payment policies have changed, but they are still ethical to our patients. Our patients are still atop our value hierarchy and always will be. Thanks again!

name: Molly Sanford
text: My middle child was seen last week and myself today. I absolutely love this practice. All the nurses and ladies behind the desk are so nice and informative. Everybody you see talks yoy through what is happening, what they are thinking, and what is going to happen. My other two children will be seen this Friday and my husband after that. I couldn't be happier that we made the switch.

resp.text: We are ecstatic that you are satisfied with our switch to Taylorville Molly! We have a very personable staff to connect with any patient that comes in. Thanks for leaving a detailed review!

name: Sheila Richard
text: I have been coming here for 2 years now. Just for annual check ups. Today, I got a chance to finally meet Dr. Burdette. She is amazing! So loving and caring towards her patients! She answered all my questions  and made sure that I had all I needed. If you are looking for a kind and a compassionate doctor she is definitely it.

name: Raymond Hendrix
text: Quick and easy rapid test.

resp.text: Thanks! If you ever have questions just message us Raymond!

name: Ishmael Rudolph
text: Great use of technology to speed up process.

resp.text: Yes, we pride ourselves on keeping up with modern trends. Thanks for visiting Ishmael!

name: Tammy Sawyer
text: The doctors and nurses are always polite and really care about answering your questions and helping you deal with the issues you are facing. They listen to what you have to say.

resp.text: Yes! Our doctors and nurses always put our patients first and we let our family take care of yours! We hope you enjoyed your time spent at Taylorville Tammy!

name: Francine Rodgers
text: For my very first appointment with you all I have to say you all were very thorough and helpful. I left out of the appointment knowing I made a very good decision in choosing you all.

resp.text: We are jubilant that your debut appointment went as smooth as possible. We hope you continue to have a pleasant experience with us. Thanks for the review Francine!

name: Yuanqin Holman
text: Good environment.  Reasonable waiting time.  Considerate nurses and practitioners.  Treatment for long term health benefits for patients.  Very pleasant experience.

name: Etta Richardson
text: I use to love this place I had the worse experience last week. I had an appointment and the day of they text to tell me I had a balance and I call while I was enroute to my appointment. So this guy said he was in management and had a very nasty attitude I had told them that I will pay something on it. He was very very Nasty.  I wish I would had gotten his name because he would be put on blast.

resp.text: We are very clear about our payment policy. Imagine a boss refusing to give a paycheck to an employee for the hours that the employee put into his job. That's how physician's offices feel when they do not get paid for their work.  Past Due payment is due before new credit is extended.

name: Laura Williams
text: The front office staff is wonderful. Elizabeth was very professional and I was seen in a timely manner. The NP Kim was very kind and attentive. Also last but not least Dr. Burdette's care and bedside manner was remarkable. I would highly recommend this facility.

name: Kim Drish
text: I absolutely love this doctors office. The staff are very warm and welcoming. The Nurse Practitioners are very concerned about what is going on with you. I like them all. I am glad my friend told me about them.

name: 2wonderful2u
text: Based on the staffs  response to the negative reviews, I can see this is not a very professional staff. Nor are they interested in correcting their wrongs, as they feel they have no wrongs. I definitely will not be a new patient.

name: fanchu meng
text: Dr. Burdette is very sweet and she takes good care of her patients. Her staff are so friendly and professional. The nurse practitioner Jodi is awesome! It's such a blessing to be her patient and I recommend Taylorville Family Medicine to everyone.

name: Susan Looney
text: Everything is very professional and I highly approve of their service.

resp.text: Yes, we pride ourselves on professionalism and we highly value your stamp of approval Susan. Thanks for visiting!

name: A Fondren
text: Don’t waste your time. What a joke. Got there to my doctors appointment at 9:45 and my appointment wasn’t til 10. I didn’t get to be seen til 11:25! I had to go the the receptionist to see if Dr. Burdette was behind. Long story short. She only sees two patients and with 15 minute delays. 😑. Seriously! Only because they only have a few rooms. Not my problem! Maybe they need to get a better place with more rooms instead of 4 or even put a sign up saying “you will wait at least an hour or more for your visit”. I wished I knew that before I even became a new patient or I wouldn’t even waste my time....finding a new doctor. 👋🏻

resp.text: The information you are sharing is incorrect, but due to HIPAA we will not be able to comment further.  We appreciate you giving our practice an opportunity to provide you medical care.  We also realize that not every patient and practice is a match, this being one of those cases.  We wish you the best of luck finding a primary care physician who can meet all of your expectations with NO wait time.  Good Luck.

name: C Davis
text: My family and I have had several bad experiences here. Some of the examples are being misdiagnosed, not being told about potential issues in the blood work that was done, and waiting for extended periods of time to see the a nurse practitioner when the waiting area was nearly empty. To top all of that, they have even sent us bills on different occasions for things that had already been paid! I would give this office a 0 star rating if possible. If for some reason you choose to use them, keep your receipts!

name: Marcy Weinberger
text: Dr. Burdette is an excellent physician, in my opinion. She is careful, comprehensive and purposeful in her assessment and treatment of me without wasting my time or healthcare dollars on unnecessary tests and procedures. She and her staff also are very kind and listen carefully to my concerns. Finally, she provides referrals to talented specialists when appropriate. I have been a patient of hers for about two decades and I hope she never retires! BTW, I have never had to wait an excessive amount of time in the waiting room.

text: The staff is always friendly and helpful . They work with you to see a doctor even when you don’t have an appointment . Shout outs to Tonyia Jones and Kimberly Carver

name: Kayle Vaught
text: Mikayla or whatever her name is, is so rude. Do not waste your time here. I will be reporting to HR and corporate about how unprofessional she is.

resp.text: We apologize for such a response. We have been attempting to reach you but it seems that you are NOT a patient with our practice.  If you could please contact our office about this review since we are getting conflicting information.

name: Cristal Robertson
text: I've used Dr. Burdette for years and have been treated great by all staff members

name: Rebecca Cowan
text: I have used Dr. Burdette for years and I have always been completely satisfied with my visits. However, she now takes same day sick walk-in visits and I am over the moon excited!! Last week, I was walking around the UA campus.....looking for some fun, of course.....and I tripped over a curb and landed on all fours. You can imagine my embarrassment....bent over on all fours looking up at a sweet, blue-eyed gentleman, asking if I was ok. Well, I wasn't ok, but this lady was not going to let him see my pain as he hoisted me up off my knees, then had to unbend my back as it popped and groaned at him. As soon as I could get back to my car, I drove straight to see Dr. Burdette. Well, as I walked in the door, the sweet receptionist, Elizabeth, quickly helped me and didn't even laugh at my humiliating story. I was in and out from seeing Dr. Burdette in no time at all. Thank you, Elizabeth and Dr. Burdette!!

name: Donna Tittle
text: I was a mess medically when I moved here over 8 years ago and since then with Doctor Burdette and her staff, I now can move, breathe and have a chance of a longer happier life.Thanks for all your hard work. If you need the best. Here's your answer.

name: clara hostetter
text: The staff is VERY rude, won’t call you back!!! Don’t waste your time, not a place to trust your health care.

resp.text: Hi "clara",  we would have loved the opportunity to have discussed this issue before such a negative public rating.  We will be more than happy to forward your medical records to the physician of your choice, if you will call our office and identify yourself.

name: Hunter Standridge
text: Rude staff

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback Hunter! That is definitely an area we are continuously improving

name: S C
text: I have used Dr. Burdette for several years after my primary physician passed away. Today I had an appointment scheduled with her that I had been waiting months for, my appointment was at 3:15pm at 3:00pm I received a text that said they were running behind and my new appointment time would be at 3:31pm and that they would text me again before my appointment to confirm. At 3:30pm I received the same text. I went ahead to the appointment because I needed to be seen and I would just wait in my car. When I went in and checked with the receptionist she told me that I was 45 minutes late and that they would have to reschedule my appointment. I showed her the texts and she said that they only sent the one text that was generated when I did not show up for my appointment at 3:15pm. THIS IS COMPLETELY UNTRUE!!!!  I was very upset, she told me that it would throw them completely behind to try and see me and that she talked to the owner and he said that I would have to reschedule. There was absolutely no one in the waiting room. While telling me this a woman walked in and said are you still open? She said yes and checked her in for bloodwork. But they can’t admit their mistakes when it comes to texts that cause problems and let me be seen. They then sent one of the medical assistants out to talk to me. He was VERY RUDE AND CONDESCENDING, after telling me that I should have come and checked in at my appointment time he went on to tell me that he was always at least 15 minutes early for ever appointment he has ever scheduled. When I told him that was foolish for me to come and sit in a reception area for an undetermined amount of time in the middle of a pandemic-he told me I could have waited in my car. When I told him that I was working and felt that was ridiculous he told me that he was a single parent to 2 children whose mother had died and that he had to be both parents to his children and still keep his appointments and go to work everyday to support them. This all in a raised voice that apparently carried. When he finally stopped his tirade, or I could have possibly interrupted him to tell him that my husband passed away in 2012 and that I also have 2 children that I have had to raise myself while working and keeping appointments and yes I raised my voice too. At that point, the nursing staff came out and told me to leave and that the owner would call me. That I was upsetting the patients in the office. Really??? I have always been at my appointments, I have watched this office deteriorate over the last couple of years, I like Dr Burdette but it is clear from all the things that have happened and from the way they have treated me (and others if you read the google reviews and not all the five star reviews they have on there site which I am positive they solicit and approve) that Dr Burdette has absolutely no control over what happens with her patients. I am certain that the owner will never call me and if he does it will probably be to tell me not to come back. Which he doesn’t need to do because I will not be treated like that and will find another doctor. One that actually cares about the needs of their patients and does not treat them like they treated me today. I am extremely disappointed in Dr Burdette, I feel like after 10 years she should have at the very least - have talked to me herself, but she did not, I feel very sad that she cared so little for me as her patient but I guess I just misjudged her as well. This is not the first problem I have had with them but it will be the last. The NP’s there miss a lot of things and you almost never see Dr Burdette unless you specifically ask to and then things like this happen. I expect them to not release my records without a fight also. Please think before you make an appointment here and please don’t put yourself in risk if you feel that you are not getting the care you need and deserve at this or any of their clinics. I will be reporting all of what happened to me today to my insurance company and to the state medical board. No one should be treated this way - ever!!

resp.text: Thank you for visiting and leaving a review detailing your experience SC! We are continuously improving all of our protocols and procedures regarding issues like these to make them obsolete. This occurrence seems to be an anomaly and we will be stay cognizant of such situations. Again, thanks for your review and our apologies for what has transpired.

text: Really seriously considering taking my mom somewhere else. This doctor's office is like being in a health department. You cant pay me to believe that they have a short staff because if they had a short staff then why would they expand when they know they dont have enough people to work there? They dont answer the phone when you call, nor do they return any of your phone calls, they charge you a 25 dollar cancellation fee if you cant make it to your appointment and dont notify them within 24 hour notice. Omg what if you end up in a car accident, or get stuck in traffic, or dont have a ride, what if it's a storm? what if something sudden just happens? Because of course things do sometimes that's beyond our control.  guess that's just your fault for inconveniencing them by not showing up even though they keep you waiting all day long even though you do have an appointment. Maybe we should charge them a 50 DOLLAR LATE FEE for not seeing their patients ON TIME according to the time that is their appointment. If you get sick while under their care and end up in the emergency room guess what, THIS DOCTOR WILL NOT COME FROM THEIR OFFICE LONG ENOUGH TO CHECK ON YOU (THE PATIENT) THAT PAYS FOR THEIR HEALTHCARE SERVICES!

text:
Disorganized,fired too many experienced staff leaving mostly young inexperienced staff. Expect long waits from over booking patients.We waited almost 2 hours on more than one occasion due to staff inability to triage patients,forgetting to sign patients in on arrival,not allowing appropriate time for new patients to be seen.Just to name a few.
Also,for months we have heard "our fax machine is old and doesn't work right". I suspect the staff cannot trouble shoot or even work it if the "go" button doesn't work the first time..or it is an extremely old machine that needs replacing and no one wants to spend money on it..faxes have mysteriously gotten "lost" far too often  to be just an accident. We have to go in person and stand at the counter and complain to get anything for another Dr to see.
The technician/Drs who read the CT results are 100% unreliable. 2 ct's can read wildly different even within a couple of days of each other. The X-ray situation is soso.
Staff with minimal in house training take the various scan,ultrasounds etc  and readings..

Mainly,it's a crapshoot on care here.Which has gotten much worse since our Dr died in a 4by4 accident.
I say avoid if at all possible

text: My mother goes to this practice and her Dr is awesome, but the office part is unorganized, rude, and plain unprofessional. Today I called about a refill and have been trying to get this refill now for over a week and eventually instead of helping me they hung up on me. I just am beyond aggravated. My mom really likes her dr and his nurse is so sweet, but it's getting to the point that I'm seriously considering finding her another doctor bc of the fact everything about the front desk is just so unprofessional. When we gofor my mother's appt I'm going to complain about this and try to get a number that is a direct line to my mom's Dr or his nurse. name: Janice Nix
text: They are professional, and have patience. They really work with you to get your health in order.

name: K
text: At 19 years old I became a patient of Brad Ginevan MD. After my current pediatrician, Dr. Rivas, advised it was time to transition to an adult provider. During the time he was my provider, Dr. Ginevan worked alongside my psychiatrist to continue maintenance of my ADHD and when necessary, he worked with specialists to manage my delicate GI condition. This included references to appropriate clinics and scheduling of applicable tests ie. Colonoscopy, EGD, etc. I truly trusted Dr. Ginevan and was incredibly grateful to have found such a wonderful physician. I never minded the fact that his office was always moving locations or that his appointments had become a nightmare to secure. I still referred only my closest of friends and family to see him. Always assuring them they'd be nothing less than satisfied with him as they're provider. Those were the old days... in 2013 I moved away to live on base with my then husband. I moved back in 2015 and returned to Dr. Ginevan. He and his staff had undergone a complete restructuring as they were now a part of the mega-merger trend and had merged with the tri-cities health giant Shoals Primary Care LLC. Due to the merger Dr. Ginevan no longer had any of my previous medical records from all of my time spent under his care which led to massive complications to my continuity of care. (I now understand the importance of my responsibility to secure medical history documentation and maintain my own current updated personal medical record.) Also, SADLY, due to the implementation of a governmental-esque standard of operating procedures, it is my opinion that Dr. Ginevan no longer maintained the level of patient care he had became known for. His office staff has always been grade-A; to be commended. If you are considering seeing Dr. Ginevan as your primary care provider this review is for you. In closing I want to say that this review in no way, intends to slander or cause malice. This review is my personal experiential reference/opinions of Dr. Ginevan meant solely for the purpose of socially informing fellow peers.

name: Shelby Stanford
text: Most of the staff is nice but they are very unorganized. Too many hands touching paperwork

He is very professional, courteous, and extremely intelligent, most of all, he is thorough . DR SYED  will perform tests needed to evaluate your concerns .In my opinion, he IS the best

name: Kimberly Heupel
text: I have seen many Drs from all over and these Drs has done a complete work up on me I am at Dr now and shoals primary Care has all the Drs you could need in this building I'm very pleased with them and they have their own machines here so you don't have to go to the hospital for any kind of scans  I give them 5 stars

name: Diamond Love
text: Dr Karr is a wonderful doctor.  He really cares about his patients well being.

name: Em Means
text: I had planned to start seeing Dr. Martin as a new patient after my husband's first visit (where they had down on his chart that he was a 60 year old female with impacted bowls). I ignored that fact and still decided to give the doctor the benefit of the doubt because I could understand things sometimes happen. However, upon my scheduled visit as a first time patient it was for 7:30 am, and I arrived at 7:15 am for new patient paper work. I signed in and no one even showed up at the front desk until my appointment time, where I  then asked for my paper work and filled it out. About ten minutes after that, another woman called me by the wrong name and when I corrected her, I was made to feel as if I had done something wrong. Also, you can not hear when you are being called because the TV is loud, so people are talking over the TV, and I have two ear infections. After filling out my paper work, I was then called back to the window, where I was asked to write down my SSN, but I had already written it down twice on the form already. This told me they obviously were not paying attention to the information they were entering. After this, and already feeling on edge from just the front desk experience, I am called back by the doctor's nurse practitioner who tells me to step on the scale, and with a horrible tone says, "you're going to have to take some of that off." Meaning my purse. I ask where I should put it in case of a designated area, which seem to make her even more annoyed and she replies with, "I don't know." Very snappy. I am a new patient and felt like I was asking a very simple and non offensive question. We then walk to the exam room where she informs me that I would not be seeing the doctor and that he also would never been doing my exams or ever seeing me other than a quick peek in the room. Which, as someone looking for a long term doctor, it does not feel comfortable not even meeting my doctor on the first visit. When I tried to explain that I was uncomfortable with the fact she would only be relaying my issues to the doctor, and that I didn't feel comfortable having my health looked after in third person, and that I didnt understand why they wouldn't tell a new patient to begin with when making an appointment that he or she won't be seeing a doctor. She then got upset about it and told me I could reschedule or abort because she had been doing this for 40 years. Which is fine and I explained to her I was fine with her seeing me, but that I didn't feel comfortable having a doctor diagnose me without speaking with me and knowing me as a person. She gets more upset and I said I think it would be best just to cancel because at that point, being someone who has been diagnosed with a generalized anxiety disorder, I was overwhelmed and ready to go home. She proceeded to then say to me, "Fine then. Adios." I feel as if the entire situation was unprofessional on many different levels. I decided to keep searching for a new doctor. I would not advise this practice if you want to get to know your doctor for long term use, or have anxiety issues, seeing as how it is the only doctor's office I have ever been in where the lobby is loud and over packed.

name: Shamea C
text: I really like Dr. Ridgeway alot, I've been seeing him for over 5 years. He is an excellent pulmonologist, but his front desk ladies are really very rude..

name: Martin Painter
text: Dr. Karr is the best doctor I’ve ever been with!!!

name: Samantha Smith
text: Well where do I start.... First I guess I could start off with the fact the receptionist are very rude. Next I am being seen by Dr Aaron karr aka his assistant for a blood clot in my liver. So as I'm being processed for my visit the nurse asks me." Ma'am which side is your blood clot on".........eeerrrmmm. unless I have 2 livers it is on my right side. I over looked that. NEXT , I go in for my inr check and my levels are still below standard so he send me to Hellen Keller to do bloodwork and says he will call with the results. No call..... Instead I call up there later in the day and she says you need to come pick up you medicine. So I go get it they have switched my medicine with no telling me no nothing I am a breastfeeding mother. He switched me to a medicine that I cannot breastfeed on without any consultation. I had to Google the risks and side effects. Totally unprofessional and a headache. I will be switching doctors asap!

name: Jennifer Sandy
text: This is where I work.  Busy place, but doctors really care about their patients.

name: Jennifer Faulkner
text: Waiting time long

name: Jason Smallwood
