text: Everyone (front counter, dr, Med assistant all treated me like I was only one there. They came to the waiting room to assist me and make me comfortable until I could be seen, which was only 3 minutes. We did paperwork after being seen, which the urgency of my condition required.

name: Lindsey Woodall
text: I was seen very quickly. I love that this location is open until 11PM. Everyone was very nice and helpful! Would recommend!

name: Rachel Johnson
text: In and out supper quick, certainly cheaper than a go at the ER. When you're sick you don't feel like sitting around waiting to be seen, that was not the case here. Super happy with my experience and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

name: Mary Wynne Kling
text:
On Saturday night my daughter was bouncing on the bed, fell and needed stitches near he eyebrow.
Wanting to avoid taking a five year old to the emergency room, we went to Twilight Urgent Care. Dr. Cunningham and the staff did an EXCELLENT job caring for my daughter. They were quick and efficient, we spent so little time in the waiting room we couldn't even get the admission paperwork finished before they called us back. They were very patient and understanding with my daughter, but also worked to get her taken care of as quickly as possible.
I couldn't be happier with the care we received, and are so happy to know we have someone great to go see when Moore's Mill (our daytime urgent care of choice) isn't open.

name: Mary Jewell
text: Awesome experience!! Everyone one was super nice and concerned!! Very clean facility. Also didn’t have to wait long to be called back or see doctor.

name: Carrie Berkstresser
text: They were really quick and kind to me. The only problem I had was that they called my medicine in to a different pharmacy because mine was closed, but they didn't tell me. They were really helpful at getting everything straightened out the next day when I was confused away CVS.

name: Lisa Brooks
text: Stopwatch Urgent Care is a great place for urgent medical needs.  The staff are knowledgeable and friendly.  The physicians are thorough and respond appropriately to your concerns.

name: weenona schassler
text:
I don't feel that the PA took the time to truly assess my complaints. "It could be a staph infection, it could be cellulites. You might have strep, you might have pharentitus (not sure if spelling). I'll give you an antibiotic that will treat it regardless." I didn't come in for a two minute consult. No strep test was done. He just glanced at my leg. I have a knot the size of a lemon on my leg that is inflamed and hot to the touch. It is painful and itches. I'm very uncomfortable.
Not happy at all.

name: Jon Benson
text: Dr. Washington was very dismissive of my report of past history. He declared I was suffering from allergies before he had even examined me. Even after the x-rays showed signs of bronchitis he prescribed me allergy medication. I feel highly offended and wish to lodge a complaint. I am currently struggling to breathe properly and he showed no sympathy and would not help. Additionally he had multiple pieces of incorrect information in my report which he said he would change.

name: Larissa Kay
text: We were visiting from out of town and my almost 3 year old ended up with a UTI over the weekend. This clinic was very easy to work with and professional. We were in and out within an hour.

name: Paula King
text: Everyone was quick and caring today! Dr. H was excellent! Listened and answered my questions about my being sickly so close to my trip overseas. Gave me several options of things she does when traveling. Thanks again StopWatch Urgent Care!

name: Angela Mcminn
text: Service was good til they made me go to ER for a catscan and still charger my card and didn't even do anything to me ... I will be reporting to the BBB on this and 4 weeks later my card still has not been refunded...

name: Deidra Mcgill
text:
Great experience for my first visit
Everyone was very nice.  Got in and out and picked up my RX next door within a short time.

name: Kacie Tyson
text: Just went here today to get tested for the flu. I went about 9:30 and there was zero wait time. They got me in and out in less than 30 min. Staff and doctor were great! Understanding and took care of my needs. Will definitely see them for future illnesses!

name: Jerry Mays
text: Initially, I was favorably impressed with the facility and staff. I was there because of an acute pain in my back, which has begun early in the week. My visit was on Saturday morning. After a discussion with the doctor and an examination, he determined that I may have a kidney stone. He said he would request a CT scan at Bridgeway Diagnostic and that they would call me “tomorrow”. I did not get a call Sunday and, checking their website, I learned that Bridgeway is closed on the weekend. Today, Monday, I called Bridgeway and learned that Stopwatch Urgent Care never sent the CT scan request.

name: Kenya Mann
text: This was my first time visiting Stopwatch. It was actually a pleasant experience.  The staff is very professional, prompt and friendly.  I will definitely return for future visits.

name: Skip Courtney
text: New patient process was wuick and easy. 5 minute wait. Dr was very knowledgeable and also very personable. Provided immediate relief

name: Jaimie Spencer
text:
Always fast prompt service. They don’t leave you in the patients room for long before coming in!
Friendly staff. Always my first choice to go when I’m feeling ill

name: Lisa Beasley
text: Everyone was so friendly. That helps when you’re not feeling well. They took very good care of me.

name: Nicole_222
text: Very good service! I was only there about 30 minutes and I feel better already! This is the best place to go for fast but wonderful care!

name: Morgan Riley
text:
The take my insurance(BCBSAL) just not my specific plan without getting a referral... for Urgent care... at 10:30pm. $140 to see if this pain is a serious problem or something to heal own it's own.
Everything so rushed I didn't even have time to think of all of the details to tell the Dr. He looks and touches a little but doesn't see clear evidence of anything... give it another week and if it's still hurting call us back.
🧡PAIN🧡

name: Larissa Kay
text: We were visiting from out of town and my almost 3 year old ended up with a UTI over the weekend. This clinic was very easy to work with and professional. We were in and out within an hour.

name: Diane Corbin
text: Excellent service.   Will recommend to all my friends.  The Dr was very thorough and kind.

name: weenona schassler
text:
I don't feel that the PA took the time to truly assess my complaints. "It could be a staph infection, it could be cellulites. You might have strep, you might have pharentitus (not sure if spelling). I'll give you an antibiotic that will treat it regardless." I didn't come in for a two minute consult. No strep test was done. He just glanced at my leg. I have a knot the size of a lemon on my leg that is inflamed and hot to the touch. It is painful and itches. I'm very uncomfortable.
Not happy at all.

name: Morgan Riley
text:
The take my insurance(BCBSAL) just not my specific plan without getting a referral... for Urgent care... at 10:30pm. $140 to see if this pain is a serious problem or something to heal own it's own.
Everything so rushed I didn't even have time to think of all of the details to tell the Dr. He looks and touches a little but doesn't see clear evidence of anything... give it another week and if it's still hurting call us back.
🧡PAIN🧡

name: Kimberly Key (A Southern Mama)
text: Every visit I have encountered has been great. 90% of the time I'm so nervous and forget what all I wanted to ask so I'll even ask sometimes for the doc to come back in. They are always prompt and caring. I've never had issues with any staff members. Each member does their job accordingly. This isn't an ER or hospital setting .. Therefore they are limited. Some people sadly fail to realize that. I have called several times to have meds changed or even added.. Or maybe even a recheck. They are always prompt and kind. I do not have a primary care physician. I use them when needed and hope to continue. Don't judge every place based off someone else's experience. Go and see for yourself.

name: Teresa peppers
text: The staff was pleasant and friendly. I appreciate the after business hours, that's the reason I chose coming to your location. My wait time was a couple of hours too long. If I had known, I was going to be seen by a Nurse Practitioner and not a doctor, I probably wouldn't have waited that long and gone somewhere else the next day. I requested cough syrup to ease my cough and that would help me sleep; I received a prescription for cough medicine with anti-nausea medicine in it. Nausea isn't one of my problems. I just wanted to stop coughing and finally get some sleep. What happened the cough medicine with pain medicine?

name: Norma Cusanek
text: I arrived back in the US with what I thought was a nasty cold but knew something wasn't right...so I looked up StopWatch (I've used them before) but the one in my area was closed.  I scrolled down to discover that the one in Opelika was open.  So I drove there straight away.  They got me in and diagnosed with 20 minutes of my arrival.  Staff are courteous, compassionate and professional.  I'd choose them again if I need urgent care    Thank you Opelika Stop Watch Urgent Care!

name: Annette Screws
text: I was very pleased with the care that was shown to me while I was there the staff was awesome!

name: Elizabeth Millette
text: I would recommend this Urgent Care to anyone in the Auburn/Opelika area. I particularly like the Opelika location. It is open late (11 pm). I went on a Saturday at 6:30. There were about 4 people ahead of me and I was seen in less than an hour. What I like most about the Opelika location is the Dr. (I really wish I remembered his name)! He is great! Very friendly, takes time to explain everything and answer questions. I would definitely choose them again if I need urgent care.

name: Jerry Mays
text: Initially, I was favorably impressed with the facility and staff. I was there because of an acute pain in my back, which has begun early in the week. My visit was on Saturday morning. I did not get a call Sunday and, checking their website, I learned that Bridgeway is closed on the weekend. text: Got in and out quick, the dr we saw was very nice and helpful, but the price of the office visit was ridiculous.

name: Lydia Blanton
text: All staff was super super nice and very efficient. I was in and out with a diagnosis and good direction in 40 minutes.

name: Alnita Edwards
text: The attendant didn't check his vitals.  A stethoscope was not used.   Blood pressure was not checked.  Strep test, pulse and  temperature were taken. Lympnodes were felt eyes and ears were checked.  That was it. This morning he says his chest hurts when he breathes.  Getting his prescription transferred was not a problem since CVS didn't have it.

name: Brittany S. Deyerle
text: Staff is professional and very friendly. I was in and out in less than 40 minutes total! I appreciated the quick diagnosis and treatment, especially when you're not feeling well!

name: Michael Tolbert
text: It was fast i still do not understand my copay being as much as it was but over all everything seem to be fine

name: Kristen King
text: Everyone is amazing! From the front desk to the clinic staff! Thanks for all you do! 😊

name: Latonya Hicks
text: I went to Stopwatch this morning with two different issues, I was told that since it was an urgent care that I can only been seen for one issue. I was stunned about this because I have been to  urgent care facilities and have been seen and treated for multiple issues. I was also told to take my pick of which issue was worst and if I chose to do both issues that my insurance was only going to pay for the cheapest one and I was going to receive a bill for the other. This is not right because the two issues was at the same pain rate that I was experiencing. I haven't ever been told to choose one out of multiple issues to be seen for. I couldn't get an appointment with my regular doctor so that was the reason for the visit. Never again I would ever let someone tell me what I can't do especially when I'm in pain. Sad how people who work in healthcare facilities don't care about someone's health.They are just there to get a check and I have a degree in Health care and can't even get a job in that field. I see why because they hire people like those at Stopwatch who don't care. Yet, I'm still in pain with my other issue and probably have to visit another urgent care for that problem.Unnecessary money being spent for no reason at all.

name: John Waldrip
text: This Urgent care is the best. I like going to Urgent Care because when I am sick, I can’t get an appointment for a couple of weeks. I can’t wait a couple of weeks. I either be well or dead by then.

name: David Chapman
text: There were 15 people ahead of me when I arrived. My total time spent was 2 hours. No too bad.

name: Bubba Harrison
text:
My first visit at Stopwatch was in January of this year. There was no wait time and was seen immediately! The nurse practitioner, I’m sorry I can’t remember her name but she was very smart and beautiful, diagnosed my problem, she administered the meds I needed and I had a complete recovery!

This second visit was just as remarkable! Again, no wait time and was seen immediately! This time I was given a card with the receptionist name, Halie, medical assistant, Luisa, x-ray tech, Lisa and doctor, Adams! They were all awesome! Once I told the doctor what was going on, again, he immediately diagnosed my problem, administered the meds I needed and I had a complete recovery!

I can’t  comment on the negative reviews of this office cause I wasn’t there but my two experiences were totally awesome and will continue to visit them every time I have a health problem! Much easier to be seen immediately here than my person physician! Please give them a try!

The personnel and doctor took

name: samantha sperduto
text: The worst experience I have ever had. In March, I fell down the stairs and badly injured my ankle. It was to the point that I actually had to cut my sandal off because of the swelling. Since it was after hours, and I did not want to wait hours in the emergency room, I decided to go to the Urgent Care Twilight on Opelika Rd. Upon checking into the location, the receptionist and staff were very short to answer any questions I was having. On top of that, their bedside manner was terrible. I could not even walk on my own because of the swelling and pain, to the point where I was leaning on a friend. Seeing us struggling, they did not have the decency to offer to help my friend who was trying to support me. They actually made me stand at the counter and fill out paperwork, instead of letting me sit down to finish filling everything out in the EMPTY waiting room. The staff did not offer any wheelchairs/crutches/anything to steady myself, forcing me to walk from the check in, to triage, then to a room.  Once I was FINALLY sitting on an exam table, they had taken X-rays and arrived back shortly saying it was "just a sprain" and it "should be fine in two weeks." Then they wrapped my ankle in an ACE bandage, charged me $150 (w insurance), and STILL did not offer any assistance in my mobility. On top of all of that? Months later, it is still swollen and I am still having difficulty with my ankle. I went to go see another doctor, and turns out, my ankle was fractured, not sprained. Definitely do NOT recommend wasting your time or money just to have your well being jepordized by an unfriendly staff that seemed to be there just to make a paycheck.

I'm not sure what I did to this women as a paying patient but I would assume the owners and supervisors of this clinic would not be satisfied with her behavior. I'm not sure if i bothered her by asking questions I didn't know the answers to and trying to explain what the uab clinic wanted. But I am not educated nor wish to be in this field I don't like having to go to the doctors lol but when I need to understand something I expect, especially when it has to do with my back, to be helped in the best manner possible.

name: zmthornton
text:
This office told my wife that they were a Blue Cross Blue Shield provider, but then called her back to see an RN that wasn't fully certified by BCBS. Because of their error, I was billed $200 extra. After long waits on the phone with BCBS, I found out the story above.

At 9:30 am today I called Stopwatch to ask about how we could have been charged if we confirmed at the front desk that we were covered. They told me they would contact billing and return my call. When I didn't hear back from them in 30 min, I stopped by the office to ask in person about the error. After waiting for 20 minutes in the waiting room, I ended up calling the billing office myself and actually having to pass my phone to the receptionist to get their error fixed. After all that, they admitted fault and adjusted my bill.

My kid was sick when I went in to talk about billing, so I thought I might as well have him seen now that the billing issue was worked out.

We waited a reasonable 20 min, they did a flu test, and released us with an RX called in to CVS.

I had to call twice, but they finally said they were resenting my RX. I assumed it'd be ready in an hour.

Wrong again. After trusting them to call in my prescription twice now, I went to Walgreens around 12:30, only to have them tell me that it hadn't been called in. So I had to call the office a FOURTH time now, and get them to actually call my prescription in.

Stopwatch forgot to cancel the RX at CVS, so I had to call CVS for them and ask them to cancel that prescription so that my finally called in RX could be filled at Walgreens. I got my kid's medicine at 1:30, after sitting in Walgreens for an hour for a prescription that was supposed to be called in and picked up. My sick kid fell asleep sitting up because of how long we had to wait.

Dragging my sick kid all over town and having to wait multiple hours because of Stopwatch's errors makes me positive that I'll never use this Urgent Care again. They have serious communication issues.

text: I do not know what background issues are going on here but I certainly feel that my current level of care here is inadequate. Had some prescription refills at the time,  later found out that insurance needed further justification.  My pharmacy contacted the drs. office and I've contacted them twice now.  I've yet to have my calls/questions returned and apparently they've never contacted my insurance.  Called again today (Thursday) at 2:45 and got a message saying they were closed, no explanation why.  I'm moving out of the area soon or I would definitely find a new dr. and office

name: Ansliegh Hall
text:
They take forever to answer the phones. The people in the office were really nice but when you call you can expect to be on hold for 30+ minutes. I had to sit in the health department for 30-45 minutes on hold just to ask for a fax number. It's really ridiculous and unprofessional that they can't answer the phones in a timely manner.

Update: I continue to be unimpressed with this office since we've moved to TN. I filled out a release form to get my sons records from this office (that's why I was calling for the fax number before) and they took almost an entire month to send the records, then to top it off they didn't even send all of his records. They only sent records up to July even though he had shots in September as well, so the lady at the Health Department had to call them herself and tell them to send the rest of the records. I just can't believe how unprofessional this office is, I had literally no issues with them when I was taking my son there but now that we've moved away they have made it so hard for me to get my son the healthcare he needs.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Hall. We are sorry to have kept you waiting. We will let the Practice Administrator know you are frustrated with being placed on hold. For future reference, our fax number is (256) 428-4912.

name: Limanman Strange
text:
This office many times will not answer their phones. This has happened more than once. Today (a non-holiday Thursday) I called at 1:38pm only to get their answering machine which said office hours were till 5pm with lunch from 12:00 till 1pm. Well it was 1:38pm!
I stayed on the line and was connected to their answering service. When asked if the office was closed, the lady with the answering service first told me they were closed for lunch and would be back at 1:15pm. When I pointed out it was 1:38pm, she had me hold and then later came back and said they had rolled over their phone lines for the day and so were indeed closed! Unbelievable!!!

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback. On the day that you called, we had closed early for mandatory staff training on our new electronic medical record system. We should have noted that on our voicemail and apologize for any inconvenience.

This “Dr.” literally yelled and spoke to me in a very condescending manner without having any general knowledge on my file, only my appearance. Not only did she walk out the room without notice but also seemingly threw my results paper at me.

I spoke with Jamila, who sincerely apologized. She also said that she would inform her manager, which I have not heard from since visiting.

Unable to connect with someone for assistance, I set up the online portal and finally found the results online. The review is a suggestion of staff training.

name: olivia hawthorne
text:
My daughter encountered very poor medical treatment  at this urgent care today.  A negative covid test alone, does not mean that patient’s are not sick. You are the health care provider and should know what diagnostic testing is needed based on symptoms,  but I guess you would not know what a patient’s chief complaints are if you are not gathering your clinical data. The female physician was not very professional at all. She did not seem very interested in finding out what was causing my daughter’s medical complaints.
I work in the health care profession also and I understand that we are all stressed to our limits but it still does not change the fact that our main focus is the patient!!
First and last visit!!

resp.text:
We would like the chance to turn your experience around. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us at AFC PriMed -  Eastchase (334) 323-1330
to speak to our manager directly.

text: After a 1 hour and 45 min wait to get in the building (with an appointment), the doctor spent less than 60 seconds with us.  Dr. Kidd behaved as if we had wasted HER time because my daughter tested negative for covid.  I did not make an appointment for covid testing, but that is all they did, no solutions to the symptoms that brought us there.  The doctor literally told us to "come back if symptoms worsen" then turned her back and walked out.  The nurse who took vitals was extremely rude as well and asked my daughter, "What's wrong with you?" (in an annoyed tone) because she was tearful that someone had just stuck a stick up to her brain!  I use AFC in Montgomery all the time, but never again at this location.

text: We had a very pleasant experience. The receptionist, nurse and doctor were all very nice and helpful.

name: Daniel Schrader
text:
Terrible service. I made an appointment for a covid test, and got there on time. They gave me 5 papers to fill out and said "wait in your car for a phonecall." After almost an hour, I go back in to ask what's going on, only to find out that the papers are for a doctor's visit and there's 10 people ahead of me.
Only then was I told I can skip the doctor and pay $150 to take the test. So I do, and get told to drive to the back to get swabbed. The lady at the back says it'll be 15 minutes, and I could stay where I was. Less than 10 minutes later, I get told off by someone else saying I can't park there and need to move.
So, I park in a nearby spot where I can see the door and wait. After 15 more minutes, I go back in to ask for my results, and get told there's someone at the back.

All in all, I was there nearly 2 HOURS for a test that should be 15 minutes, and I spent the whole time being told conflicting info. Never once did I get a call, and things only moved when I called or went inside to ask directly.
Never been here before, and never going here again.

resp.text: We regret to hear that your recent experience was anything less than exceptional. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will use your comments to refine our efforts to ensure this issue does not happen again.

text:

She's very knowledgeable and it's apparent that she enjoys what she does! She always makes me feel very comfortable and ensures that I leave satisfied. Kendra was also very nice as always. She's personable and always asks about my daughter who she's only met once, but to remember her is something that shows me that she is genuine about her connections with her patients. Brad was very nice as well! He walked me through the X-ray process and ensured that I was confident and comfortable with the information I received! My overall experience was great! Better than any location I've ever visited!
-Jakia😊

name: LATONYA LOVE
text: The staff was amazing! The care they gave was top-notch. This place has the best nurses and Practitioners ever! If you’re looking for the best care for your loved ones, you can count on them! Really not going over board, but for a 12 year old to come back in the room speaking great things about them says a lot and she’s very scary!

name: Shakeria M
text: I went to them because it was closer than my original doctor and they were very nice. They kept me aware of the time I would be seen and I didn’t have to wait long at all. I would recommend going here if you can’t get to your own doctor!

name: Dare Watson
text: I don't usually review places, but this has been on my mind since I got home yesterday. I went into this AFC because I have been feeling ill with sinus pressure and body aches. Everything was quick and easy at first, I got signed in, filled out my paperwork, paid my copay, and in less than 10 minutes, I was in the back getting my vitals done and such. The nurse was very nice and thorough. Then I met the doctor. I didn't catch his name, as he didn't introduce himself. Rather, he walked into the door and commented that I had gained 15 pounds since my last visit. (Keep in mind, I'm here for my cold symptoms) He asked if I was okay with this. (I'm not even remotely overweight or unhealthy) Then he comments on my acne and asks what I'm doing about it. I have hormonal acne and it will flare up when I'm sick or for other reasons. These two things had absolutely nothing to do with why I was here and it left me feeling embarrassed and ashamed. My primary care doctor is who I would talk to about those things, not an Urgent Care doctor. I would understand if it had anything to do with why I was there, but it had nothing to do with it. I will never be back to this location because I would rather not be made to feel embarrassed and humiliated, especially when I already don't feel well physically.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback about your experience with us. We would like to have a better understanding about your experience. Please reach out to us at (334) 323-1330 at your earliest convenience and we will do our best to resolve this with you.

text: The receptionist Katlyinn in the front , has a horrible attitude. She barely lets you get a word out.

name: B Eut
text: I've been going to this place for years and I'm normally very satisfied. I went twice in January 2020. My mom went once. We were both exhibiting flu like symptoms. They never swabbed us even tho we asked them to. Even said, "No, you dont have the flu. It's an upper  respiratory infection. We later found out they tell EVERYONE this same thing. "Needless to say,  we went to Urgent Care.......Me, my mom, and my 4 yr old daughter have the flu. This is something we attempted to catch early on. However, they were so quick to rush us out and misdiagnose us, until the flu was pretty much in rare form by the time we actually were treated for it . I never want to visit this place again.

name: Kara Lynn Moncrief
text:
My experience with Paul Jordan, just hours ago, was horrific.

From saying “wow you smell so good” .. to proceeding to ask, what the exact fragrance I was wearing was.. and constantly attempting to “rub” my right arm and right leg and back was just the the start.

Shea (unsure of her position there as she was not wearing a name badge) was disturbingly rude; lacked OVERALL common sense, especially when needing to aid the WONDERFUL receptionist at the end of my visit, to simply print my paperwork.
She also compared my diagnosis of a viral infection to “AIDS” ..  in-which I kindly suggested that she NOT use that comparison to any other patients moving forward-

I left extremely bothered, disrespected, violated, forgotten about, ALL while feeling even more sickly
with no solution to my illness.
Again, I am beyond discouraged as I trusted my health to be taken seriously.

Being asthmatic, dealing with PAUL JORDAN (whom only practices medicine IN-OFFICE ONCE A WEEK (Friday’s) & SHEA.....apparently closing up that clinic shortly after 6PM was more important than completing the submittal of e-processing my inhaler. [My pharmacist was VERY TROUBLED by this]

I strongly urge others to NOT seek medical attention of Paul Jordan.

This is not a Google rant review as I will be reporting this to the appropriate boards-

name: Amy Dowling
text:
I went in today, as I was assigned this location and a specific provider, Dr. Kidd, by my insurance as my new PCP. Needless to say, I will be asking for a new PCP. Although I did come in for a complaint, which she did not even explore— only listened to my heart and offered me a “shot or pills”— but knowing she was suppose to be my new PCP, she didn’t even inquire about past medical history. She asked me nothing about my problem, nor did she even access any body part that had to do with my complaint.

I’m a nurse practitioner, which I NEVER tell other practitioners when I’m a patient. I was absolutely appalled at not only her lack of professionalism, but also her actual medical practice. This is a great way for something very serious to be missed. Save yourself time and money and go somewhere else. The clinic was also unclean in the rooms. The lobby was nice, but the exam rooms were not.

name: UnbiasedReport
text:
Great staff. Great nurse practitioner , very caring. This was one of my better visits coming here yesterday. Dr. Pita was very kind and was not rushing. He was gentle. He did let me know I have a virus and that taking the ejection was not going to do anything. He did give me some antibiotics. The place was clean, staff was friendly. I didn't feel brushed off or that someone was just telling me what they think. They did take the samples and made it efficient . I also liked the follow-up call. Thanks.

My most recent visit lead to an awkward interaction. The receptionist placed my cards on the counter whereas I handed them to her in her hand. I politely told her I wanted my cards in my hand and thanked her. She may have understood. That didn't  show. I'm changing my review to reflect the experience.

text: Fantastic doctor and staff. I was treated almost immediately and my problem was solved.  I had part of an earphone stuck in my middle ear.  The doctor removed it and I experienced no pain.  My problem was solved.  If I ever have another medical emergency, this place will definitely be my first choice.  The entire staff are some of the nicest people that I have ever met in my entire life.  The world could use more people like this staff.

name: Brandon Richardson
text: Went last week for a dot physical. I arrived at 11:45 am and didn’t leave until a little after 5. The dot doctor seem unfit in my opinion. She wanted a full squat with feet together. Which is very strange since that’s about almost impossible. A normal squat was needed for my last 2 exams.  Staff seem confused on what forum to use. The staff was very nice and helpful tho. In general I try to avoid afc due to previous issues.

text: I am pregnant, and I've been having coughing fits. I was told to go somewhere like AFC by my O.B. office a couple of months ago when I had the flu. Right off the bat the doctor was rude. The doctor told me that I likely have walking pneumonia, but said she doesn't treat pregnant women. That would have been nice to know 2 hours ago before you took my insurance money. She told me I need a prescription of antibiotics, but she refused to write one for me. 🙄

name: Nikitta Forbes
text: DO NOT go here. They are misleading and will misdiagnose you. PLEASE DO NOT COME HERE. Went in for a DOT physical only to find out a health condition prevents me from getting my CDL. The doctor knew of this condition prior to the physical (I overheard her discussing my case with someone outside of my room) but did not disclose this info until AFTER she'd given the physical. During the physical, she rushed through it...she didn't even introduce herself. She hopped on this chance to take advantage as she gave the WORSE and rushed physical.  DO NOT SEE DR. DIXIE KIDD

name: Katrice Wright
text: AFC is my 1st choice for urgent care. They are quick to help, comforting, and friendly. They've taken care of me and my children with top-notch precision and even called back to make sure we're ok. Thanks friends!

name: Whitney Jackson
text: Very friendly and helpful all of the staff went out of there way to comfort my son while he was extremely sick

name: Mason Chandler
text: This is the most incompetent medical clinic I have ever visited.  I went to them during the summer of 2015 for allergy injections.  Each time, it took an hour after I was in the examination room to receive my allergy injection, which is something a nurse performs, not a doctor.  The staff was constantly changing, so they always had to verify what amount to inject and had to call the clinic in Birmingham that makes the serum as no one could find the written record from the previous visits.  My last visit with them was in September of 2015.  A year later, I received a call from a collection agency saying I owe them money.  No letter came in the mail to me letting me know I owed them money because they put a different address into their system than where I lived.  I wrote on the check-in sheet on the very first visit where I lived.  They mailed statement letters to an incorrect address and never made a phone call in an attempt to receive payment from me.  When I called them about this, they could not explain why my address was incorrectly put into the system and said it was not their policy to make phone calls.  I would never recommend this clinic to anyone, and, in fact, would recommend finding anywhere else to go for medical care.

resp.text: We regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us at 334-323-1330 to speak to our manager directly.

text: 10 Great service Kendra was very gentle while giving my injections and my X-ray she made sure I was not nervous and comfortable the entire time..I will definitely be coming back if I have any other health problems

text: The best experience I have ever had at this type of care center. From the front desk staff to the medical assistant to the Doctor, they were top notch.  Dr Williams was outstanding.

name: JSDRTR
text: Everything was going good till I was put in a room four 3 hours. I never saw a Dr. That day. Just wish someone would have keep me updated.

name: Donna Lovelette
text: Went in because of coughing,sneezing, low grade fever, slimy white mucus. Vitals taken at 1:17, went to exam room 6. Within minutes tech came in to do flu & strep swabs. He informed me the test would take about 17 minutes. After sitting a long time, dr came in asked what my symptoms were. Told him. He then looked in ears, nose, throat, listened to lungs. Said I have a viral infection, then asked if I had swab test done. Said yes. He left to check results, came back said they were fine. If I wanted him to prescribe medicine for cold, otherwise over the counter medicine would work. He left room. Tech came back in with a script for Alahist, information on upper respiratory illness with wheezing, walked me to check out. I checked out at 3:15. 2 hours!!! For a 17 minute test, 5 minutes with doctor. Terrible since my husband was sitting in lobby and saw people come in & leave before I came out. The script was useless since pharmacies don't carry that medicine. It would have to be ordered, available on Monday! Pharmacist said to get 3 over the counter medicines that contain what Alahist has in it and take that. Problem is they all have different duration times. Spent night up coughing, no rest. Today I'm still coughing, low grade fever, sore throat, green mucus now. Ribs hurt from the deep coughing, added Tylenol for fever also. 1:45 minutes of being ignored. I will not go back to this facility, nor recommend it to anyone!

name: CORINE JUNE
text: My experience with AFC was totally awesome, front assistance was helpful and professional, I give front office a 10.  My nurse was very knowledgeable, helpful and professional, I give him a 10.  The physician was awesome, he explained eveything to me and was very caring. I give the physician a 10.  AFC was great and I would recommend to others.

name: Michael Maddox
text: Great, friendly, and very hospitable to their patients. Fast service is always key which they have mastered. Great doctors and staff.

name: Riley J Szabo
text: I hadn't intended on posting a review,  but upon receiving a phone call asking me to change my review about their clinic because "it does not reflect them and their service", I feel it is necessary. If you're sick, don't bother going here. I went in at about 11:00 and I was the only patient in the lobby. I signed in and paid my $20 copay the woman at the desk insisted I had to pay, even though my insurance card (which I handed her to look at) says "copay $0"). I am brought back pretty quickly by a nurse who takes my vitals and I have a low grade fever. I get seated and the doctor comes in decently quick, but she is cold and seems to be standoffish. I tell her my symptoms and she looks at my ears, throat, and listens to my breathing. She quickly orders the flu test and walks out. The nurse student says that the test will take about 15 minutes and she swabs my nose. I wait for a total of 48 minutes until some other nurse walks in, hands me a paper that says Influenza Type A on it and tells me to read it. She then walks right back out without seeing if I had questions (which I did!). While I waited, I could hear the nurses and doctors sitting there talking about their lunch plans and weekend plans, not doing their jobs. Also, after about 20 minutes of sitting in the room, I hear the nurses start talking about how my flu test was positive, and they were being super loud about it. That is a HIPPA violation! I then wait another 15 minutes for the student nurse to walk back in and give me my perscriptions and school excuse. Not once did anyone bother to come in and tell me I had the flu and bronchitis or to see if I had any questions. On top of it all, I heard the doctors outside my door arguing about whether or not I could continue to take the Tamiflu with my iron pills, and they still never told me if I should or should not take the Tamiflu and my iron pills. These doctors couldn't even tell me if my medications would conflict or react with the perscriptions they gave me! Overall, my experience was unprofessional, excessively long, and completely rubbish. I will NEVER go back here, and neither should you.

name: Quanda Williams
text: Great staff and didn't keep me waiting longMy provider and the staff were all wonderful.nice,friendly and took care of my needs in a timely manner I would definitely recommend you all to my family and friends

name: Bessie Lucas
text:
I arrived at the east Chase afc on 10/22 for a blood pressure check,  it was very elevated.  The MA was very concerned that i be seen. I spoke to Tiffany Humphrey for a few minute and then signed in. I was having a medication reaction to coreg. Dr. Robinson evaluated me and stop the coreg. Prescribed me losartan. My bp has gone down out of the danger zone. Afc east Chase is great. Thanks staff and
provider.

text: Truly recommend this location. The wait time is always minimal. Everyone here was very professional and EXCELLENT bedside manners. Thalia Turniseed is the manager and is doing an oustanding job.

The whole staff is not friendly and they are in no hurry to see patients..waited over an your and half they even made us change rooms. My daughter was very nauseated and feeling terrible the last thing she wanted was to play musical rooms.

text: I came here once 2 years ago and the service was great. I've been back a few times since and it seems it gets worse and worse! The doctor is not friendly, the staff is not friendly, it seems like you are doing them an injustice by being the patient! This will be my last visit here! 3 hours later, still no resolve!

name: Susan Goldthwaite
text: LESS THAN 2 MINUTES WITH THE DOCTOR AND THE WRONG DIAGNOSIS:  I went to AF before closing on a Sunday evening due to a horrible sore throat.  I was quickly taken back as very few people were there.  Once in the back I was swabbed for strep.  When the doctor came, he stated I did not have strep.  He Check my ears, nose, and lungs and told me I had drainage that was making my throat hurt.  He never looked in my throat.  He gave me a steroid shot and a week of amoxicillin. Over the next days I got worse.  After visiting another doctor, it was determined  that I had a bacteria in my esophagus and needed to be treated with a different class of an antibiotic.  Here is my review:  after a $50 co-pay, the doctor spent less than 2 minutes with me, doing a very poor job of considering all the possibilities for my sore throats and just treating me like I had a sinus problem.  He never looked at the back of my throat to see that it was not inflamed and the problem with further down in my esophagus.  I will never go back.  If you choose to use AFC, be sure you get the doctor attention to look at all possibilities as to the cause of your illness.  The doctor is working for you.

text: The worst one ever. Don’t go there. They are damn slow and unprofessional

When I asked the xray tech about her qualitfications for helping the lab tech draw my blood without success, she replied: We are all trained to do all the jobs. The Practicioner precribed 6 different meds in one visit, two days later the MD changed all the drugs. Very confused professionals, not a team to take care of the patient. Professionals seen, lab tech, medical assist, techs, techs, 1 LPN, 1MD one visit. A whole bunch of office assistants just roaming around.

text: I saw Dr. Sarah Bragg as a new patient.  She was so nice, thorough, and listened to all my issues.  She made suggestions with which I agreed.  When I was really sick and out of town she had a telehealth appointment with me and solved all my issues.  I highly recommend her.  She is the tops!

text: Dr Bragg and Nurse Christina were very professional, nice and understanding of my needs and concerns as a new patient. I'm happy to entrust my health to Dr Bragg and her staff.

name: Ashlee Green
text: Even though I was little bit late for my appointment I was screened and went right to the back. Every person I interacted with was very nice. Love the team of Dr Amy Boone and Rhonda. Clinic was very clean as I could tell that they take COVID-19 precautions seriously.

text: Horrible dr. And staff is even worse.  Extremely rude and poor patient care.  Extremely long wait times.

text: Everyone was very friendly.Although my husband couldn’t stay with me they made me feel so much support and security here. I appreciate the staff being friendly and Accommodating.

name: Eric Dunklin
text: Wonderful clinic very accommodating and convenient best thing to  have it so close so you don't have to fight that downtown traffic or lines down their that seem to never end and the exhaustion of all that walking Love this clinic .

name: Donna Shrewsbury
text:
I recently saw Dr. Sarah Braggs. She is absolutely precious! She was very attentive to me. She also was very thorough. I went to her as a new patient and left feeling like I had known her for years! I highly recommend her!

Also, my son and husband see Dr. Russell. He is an amazing doctor!

Great place! Great team!

name: Traci Miller
text: I have not had an overall physical in years and decided I needed to have one. I had to wait a couple of months to get in to be seen and now I know why! My appointment was at 10 am. Since I was a new patient I had a couple of short forms to complete even though I was able to complete new patient paperwork online. I had barely finished and was called back to be seen. Dr. Carlie Stein was my doctor and she was fabulous! She took time to ask me questions about concerns I may have, answered all my questions and didn't seem rushed at all! She recommended tests I may want to have done since it had been a while since I had a physical. I needed to have a mammogram done as well as a tetanus shot and blood work for tests. I was out of their door by 11:20!! And while everyone made sure to move through what had to be done efficiently and quickly, I did not feel rushed and or that they didn't answer my questions. I recommended this office to anyone that is looking for a primary care doctor!

name: Jacinda Dees
text: No wait time. Everyone was nice, polite, and caring. The needs of the patient are a top priority for them.

name: Christina Jones
text: Convenient but missing Physician/patient relationship focus. My family started coming to this location as soon as the paint dried on the walls. We found Dr. Russell to be a wonderful physician with excellent bedside manner. Unfortunately we never get to see "Our" doctor. In the years we have been patients of Dr. Russell we have seen the Nurse Practitioner 9 times out of 10. Though we have no complaints on the Nurse Practitioner we had hoped to establish a strong lasting relationship with Dr. Russell. After talking with several friends who use this practice, they all have very similar experiences. If you are not concerned with long term care from a single doctor then this practice is amazing. We just want a doctor for life, if possible.

name: A Hall
text: This clinic is top notch. Dr. Russell has been our family doctor for several years when he was at UAB Moody.  I would recommend him and his staff to anyone.

name: Nancy Cork
text: I am sure no one wants to go through diagnostic tests but if you have to, this is the place to go! As a retired Nurse Practitioner, I cannot say enough wonderful things about the staff I interacted with their professionalism. I was scheduled for 3 tests and they realized I had another one at the end of the month at Kirklin. They asked if I wanted to do that one today as well! I had 4 tests, 3 technicians, and I was done in an hour. Everyone was super kind and great at explaining what was going to happen. I cannot recommend using this Diagnostic Center enough.

name: Tracie Smith
text: I am writing this as I leave the UAB Leeds radiology clinic.  This was my first closed MRI experience.  I have been apprehensive about it.  Thank you so much to the professional, caring staff at UAB Leeds. Ariel, Ashley, and James, thank you so much for making my experience a positive one.  I highly recommend this facility and staff.

name: SANDRA MARSHALL
text: I have been with UAB and Dr. Russell for 7 years. I am very pleased with Dr. Russell but very displeased with the lab. They have made some changes, and I have been very displeased. Be prepared for the lab to give you an inaccurate result, only to call you back with an accurate result much later (which runs up the cost). My little boy had strep for over 2 weeks due to a break in communication from the lab. Very unacceptable! This has happened several times.

They were all friendly  ànd professional.  I especially  want .mention Carla who performed  the Ultrasound and Amy who performed the X-Rays.  If UAB teach a class on  professionalism  and customer service, they should ask both of them to demonstrate how it"s done.  Thanks  to all of the staff.

I was then given an appointment to meet with a nurse practioner which was also cancelled because they insisted that I had to meet with a doctor first so I made another appointment. This third appointment was made for a date 20 days later than what I had originally agreed to so I was already being inconvenienced by this delay, then today I got a phone call stating that my  appointment was yet again being cancelled with no explanation. This is now beyond ridiculous and I will be calling to be removed from their system.

text: I went in for right upper quadrant pain. Instead of telling me that I had gallbladder problems (which I did), he told me that I had a stomach virus (which would have been vomiting and diarrhea-symtoms that I did not have). A few days later I made MYSELF an appointment with a GI doctor and a couple of weeks later I had my gallbladder removed. At UAB Leeds I received no medical treatment at all. Not even blood work or a precription for nausea. They did absolutely nothing for me at all! Waist of time and money.

He is the best doctor that I have been to and I don’t plan on ever leaving this office! I struggle with anxiety and have always been super skeptical about Doctors and who I choose to see. It shouldn't take three or 4hrs to see the Dr no one never came to the room, they think that you're unaware of the time that you sit in that room waiting on the Dr once they have went to lunch. This is really unprofessional where can I email higher up. This wasn't at the Dentist office it was the healthcare office. Where is Ashley Sullivan

name: Charlotte Johnson
text: This place is a joke. The woman who works up front to the right is a miserable person, obviously. She’s beyond rude and she takes it out on the patient. I waited over two hours just to be completely checked in. I was the first one signed it and after two hours the last to go back. She made sure everyone went back before me. After two hours I had to go ask for my license back. Now to move on to the back, the Doctor is beyond lazy and slow. Three hours and only four patents had been taken back and she hadn’t finished with the first one of them. She’s a Medicaid/Medicare drainer. Also, if you have more than one issue, they make you come back again and again for another one. This place needs to be completely shut down. In no Doctors office does the Dr take this long to see patients. She’s lazy and hates her job apparently. I’ve complained higher up to try and get them to get another Doctor. You should be able to take more than six patients in over 5 hours. Being the fact that they only see you for one issue at a time, what in the hell takes this long? Again, look elsewhere they won’t helo you and who wants to spend that many hours waiting just to pad her pockets? Find a real doctors office

name: septic guy
text: They are really good but it take 5 hour to see anyone

name: Tulane White
text:
You get what you pay for
Getting my tooth pulled was great but when it comes to me getting my fillings done. He did a very poor job on them. Then the ones I let him do hurts me everyday now. Nice prices but poor work
He’s not friendly at ALL
I wouldn’t recommend this place

name: Jerid Riley
text: Don’t waste your time or the 25$ it cost to see the doctor here. Waited 5 hours to see the physician. Then they can’t  write any pain medicine even if all your arms and legs are broke. I have mild anxiety and in order to get my klonopin refilled you’ll have to see a counselor three times then see their psychologist... -5 stars.

name: Melissa Presley
text: Love the staff in this place. They have always been so good to me. Sam, Aretha, and the 2 nurses in the back plus the dentist. She can be hard on me sometimes, but she's over all a great dentist. If these people are rude to u, then u must be the one causing them to be. I love the staff. We always laugh and cut up with each other when I'm there. And Mrs Aretha,  I owe u that lunch!

name: David K
text: After showing up 15 min prior my appointment I sat in the waiting room for 3 hrs before I had to ask what the issue was .. We are behind is all Igot .. I watched 3 people that had been seated prior me get up and walk out .. There was no sence of professionalism,  at no point did they come out and explain what the wait was for .. The receptionist did manage to got out for a hour to eat lunch so no one was there at the window to ask ... After the 3 hr mark and no definite answer how much longer i needed to wait , I left and asked for a refund...2 months after ..They sent me a bill .. After discussing my case as too why I would not pay the 25  dollar bill The rude office manager talked over me , told me the bill was going to stand and that he would not give me the number to his supervisor ... I told him that i was going to record the phone call and he hung up on me ......Stay away from this place ,,, The reviews  do not lie and they treat you like garbage .. I found a great Dr that listens to you answers your questions and treats you like a human........I do not normally write reviews  , but this needed to be told .....I hope it helps others that expect to be treated like a person...STAY Away .....

name: Apryl Turner
text: Very poor customer service. I was seen, told that I needed 3 teeth pulled (scheduled a week later), then given a prescription for antibiotics and pain medication. They called and cancelled my first appointment, which was fine, but then when I tried to go to my rescheduled appointment, I was told that my name was not in the system. They told me that I did not visit their office, and only believed me when I told them the dentist's name that examined me. When they finally "found" my account, they had the appointment set up for another week and a half later. This is completely unacceptable, I have been in severe pain for almost 3 weeks now, and they refuse to refill my pain medication. It would be different if the rescheduled extraction appointment was my fault, but they rescheduled it, not me. Also, every time that I have called the office, I am put on hold for a very long time, if they even answer the phone at all. Initially, this entire process was only supposed to take one week, and now its being dragged out to almost three.

name: Mary Blackburn
text: Had a appt at 10:15 i got here at 950. I sat in the waiting room til 12. Here it is 1:08 and still have not been seen. They either need to stop scheduling soo many people or speed it up insurance or not. Nobody wants to sit here all freaking day. This is bull.

name: The Solitary Eclectic Witch
text:
So far so good :-)...was a pretty good experience overall ..i do recommend this office if your low on funds but are in pain 💗
Im so sad to see the negative reviews...i never! Waited that long...the longest my wait time was 45 min past my apt.time...i still go here from time to time and have never waited over an hour past my apt. Time...so sorry others are having such a bad experience😢

text: I love quality health. I have the best doctor.I love her.she is so sweet n caring.

I wish I was able to rate this place LOWER THAN POOR!

They did not even have a doctor in the building! They have a very rude nurse practitioner who did not even LAY A FINGER ON ME!!! She stood across the room with her arms across her chest and listened to me with a smirk on her face. When I finished talking she said there wasn't anything they could do and for me to come back in 6 weeks! I thought I was getting help but just ended up wasting my money!

I WOULD NOT suggest you go there!!!

name: Joe Herd
text: Ive been here twice both times staff and dentist was nice and listen to you and offered several options, the wait time is kinda long but overall good for this type office

name: Kayla Sands
text: Rude. Rude. Rude. Will not help me get my child's medicaid card to get her medicine over the phone. Told me I had to drive down there. When I explained I didn't live even remotely close anymore, they said "sorry"

name: shannon sexton
text: there hardly nice to anyone and you cant take care of anything on a phone if you go up there you just end up paying for something you take care of on phone.

name: faron johnson
text: This place sucks they will not call yanna prescription when you're out because you have to see the doctor when your doctor is on maternity leave they still will not call it in A sample blood pressure medicine is crazy

name: Lynn Bowman
text: I love the Doctors and staff

name: Becca A. Ali
text: 5 stars ! Super friendly staff

name: Papyrus Snowden
text:
Uncaring Doctor didn't bother to walk in the room to tell me she wouldn't refill my meds or why.
At least they refunded my copay.

name: Faye Murner
text: This is the absolute worse place I have ever been I have been here for almost 5  hours.  It's not like they are busy either.

name: Sitrinah Truss
text: Slow! Don’t come here, unless you wanna stay here all day

name: MZDEBDYANN DEXTER
text: My son had a serious stomach intestinal problem he went to this facility two or three times Urgent Care there in Talladega and the emergency room and still 2 weeks later he's in pain no results but I and his father are out of money and our son is still sick and missing days of school and time on his scholarship this is horrible.

name: LORENE JORDAN
text: Horrible we were there form 9:30am till 2:45pm I use to like it when the other Dr. Was there something needs  to be did about the wait time & the way it is operated

name: Trina Oden
text: The Doctor is Great it's the rest of the staff that's the problem! ESPECIALLY THE RECEPTIST!!!!

name: Hannah Lott
text: This staff is absolutely amazing!! The receptionist, the nurses, the nurse practitioner, absolutely everyone there is amazing!! They try their best to get you in and out as quickly as possible. They are so friendly and make you feel so comfortable. They are very personal with children to make the kids feel comfortable and like they aren’t even at a doctors office. They seen my son, Bentley, my daughter, Grace and myself all together, when I never expected them to, they just did it to make it convenient for us. This staff is truly wonderful and everyone of them deserve a raise. My husband and I LOVED bringing our children here!

name: Lillian Jackson
text: I was told when I arrived that there was a two hour wait and that I could sit in my car until they called. I asked them if they would still take me even if they hit closing time and they said yes. It hit closing time and I was one of the only people left waiting, and I got a message that my appointment was cancelled. When I went up to the window, they had locked the doors. I knocked, they saw me, and hid. They ignored me, and I had to leave after waiting two hours. I was in a lot of pain, and I needed to be seen. :(

name: Amy Smith
text:
My husband and I each had an Instant Covid-19 test here (both were negative). We provided all of our BCBS insurance information and we thought everything would be covered, or at least mostly covered… Nope! Apparently mainStreet Family Care in Mobile is not in the BCBS Ntwrk. Be warned if you have certain BCBS Insurance or don’t have insurance at all you’re going to pay $125 a pop.
My husband and I each received a bill this week saying we owe $125.00… $250 for both of us! $250.00 out of our pockets for Covid tests…. Well technically it looks like the majority of the bill is for “management of a new patient”. That seems pretty high to me. Those were fees that we were not expecting. I wish we had known ahead of time. Hopefully this review helps somebody else avoid a surprise bill in the future. I definitely would have gone somewhere else and will not be back. Not to mention, it was about an eight hour wait.

name: Cassie Armitage
text: They were all so nice! I had to wait a little bit for my Covid IV and One of the nurses bought me lunch. I believe her name was Ellen. So amazing!! I feel for anyone in health care rn and no one here seemed down. I would recommend 10/10

name: Kimberly Black
text: HIPAA violation at my appointment. The person checking me in at the desk (who did not seem like she wanted to be there or want me there) asked me to check in online. I sat down across the room to do so with 2 other people in the room and she asks me across the room what I am being seen for. I asked her if she was supposed to ask me that in front of everyone and she said "well there are some things we don't treat here." There are other ways to go about this, i.e. lists or just waiting the 3 minutes for me to complete my online check in which tells you my ailment. I had to call out that I had a UTI in front of two other men. It felt embarrassing and really inappropriate. The only reason they are getting 2 stars is because the staff in the back were very kind and friendly it was mostly the front desk issue.

name: Keely Nicholas
text: I used to really like this place. They were open late and the staff was super friendly.  My appt yesterday changed my mind. I was perscribed two medications and asked what pharmacy I use. Unfortunately I didnt know my pharmacy closes early on Saturdays until i got there to pic up my meds. I immeadiatly called Main St thinking they coukd send my medicine elsewhere. They were closed. At 4pm. double cheked their website and confirmed that their clinc is open 7 days a week until 9pm. I was frustrated but there was  nothing to be done. I called them this morning and explained the situation. I was told by reception that they were busy and no one hsd time. I told her i was in pain and im sorry to inconvenience them but i really needed my medicine. She said she woukd try to get the PA to send it in but it woukd be a little while sincd they were do bus . I told her its fine-, gave her the nsmr of the pharmacy and asked to be called or texed when it was done. She said she woukd take care of it. That was a lie. I called my other pharmacy and thdy had no idea what i was talking about and i wasnt in their system. I called Main Street again and got the same message saying theg are closed. Im incredibly frustrated abd in severe pain. I expected better. They also let a person who was thde for Covid testinv wait in the waiting room with meand another paiten . Ill be calling their headquarters  in the morning

name: Noflave Dave
text: Had a great experience here! Staff was super friendly and helpful.  They spent alot of time explaining everything to me and going over my treatment plan. I was very impressed with the level of care at this facility. From the front desk to the nurses and to NP were top notch and I hope this company realizes what valuable assets they have here. Keep up the good work ladies!

name: Kay Handley
text: I spent 20 min. registering for a covid vaccine.  I received confirmation that I was registered, and that I would be notified when my time came.  They sent me a text to come in for my shot, and then called me right after to inform me that they are not giving covid vaccines.  What's going on here?  They obtained my personal information, including credit card info, under false pretenses.  I gave them that information because their website said they are giving vaccines.  It was only after they had all my info that they called me and said they aren't giving vaccines.

name: Paul Hester
text: The staff was awesome. Everyone was so helpful. And the lady's on the counter . When out of there way to help me get a conv 19 test . I would recommend anyone to go there.

name: r a (RA21)
text: They were very fast, friendly and efficient!

name: LeAnn Miller
text: Very impressed! Staff and doctor were all extremely nice and helpful and answered all my questions. The kindness and care they showed is such a rare thing. I don't normally leave reviews but I was so impressed that I had to :) You have a new patient! (By the way, the injections worked and I'm finally able to breathe! Thank you!)

resp.text: This is so great to hear! We're happy you're feeling better!

name: Honeybun
text: Not sure why an urgent care office wouldn’t be answering their phone at a time like this... you would think they would pick up so they could control the walk ins during covid 19. All I wanted to do was call and cancel my appointment but I’m not even able to do that! Very unprofessional and I’m sure during a pandemic not advised, someone needs to visit them and give them a citation!!!I just know they BETTER NOT charge me for not showing up it’s not like they respond to the portal cancellations either 🙄

name: Caramel Libra Girl
text: Terrible service. DO NOT BRING YOUR SICK CHILD HERE!! They don't care about children at all. Go to the ER or your primary care provider. I could write a book about the mistreat I recieved here. Again, Greater Mobile Urgent Care is the best urgent facility in Mobile. This place is a joke.

resp.text:
Hi Caramel,

Thanks for reaching out! We'd like the opportunity to follow up regarding your experience. When you have a moment would you mind emailing us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com to provide us with some more details about your experience? We appreciate the opportunity to make this right!

name: Jessica
text: They did a excellent job

name: Courtney Washington
text:
Please do not utilize this facility COVID 19 testing. They have a 10 day turn around and blaming it on LabCorp. LabCorpis sending results to providers within 4 days. This urgent care is not posting or updating results in a timely fashion. Use some other provider. They do not even respond to the portal messages
.

name: Elisa Blackburn
text: I am terribly sorry, but I potentially exposed your waiting room to COVID-19 today. You see, I came in Saturday for urgent care, and they told me is need to get a referral from my doctor in 72 hours, and my primary care doctor gave me a paper to bring to your front desk. I tried to take care of it over the phone, seeing as my PCP submitted the referral through the internet, but the front desk girl had "no idea what to do here" and kept putting me on hold to speak to someone named Erica. The first time was 20 minutes, then I hung up and called back, because this is something front desk ladies have been able to do at other medical offices. The second time, the front desk girl got snappy with me, explaining that there was a waiting room full of people waiting JUST for Erica. I explained to her that I'd had to receive COVID-19 testing this morning, and I didn't want to risk bringing the paper in, but this was a time sensitive issue, according to the paper this very office gave me. She told me I needed to stay home and wait on hold. I waited another 10 minutes on hold before I got in my car. I came in wearing a mask and explained to the front desk lady that I needed to give her the paper, which took all of like 20 seconds. I asked her if this could have been done over the phone, and she told me OF COURSE. I showed her where I was still on hold on my cell phone, making it over an hour on hold to get to Erica. So, I'd like to thank Erica and the sassy front desk lady for potentially helping to spread COVID-19, by putting me in a position where I either had to come in (despite potentially having COVID-19), or risk getting stuck with a bill I could not afford, due to their lack of time management. Oh, and the waiting room when I came in? Maybe 2 people in there!

resp.text:
Hi Elisa,

Thank you for reaching out! We are truly saddened that your experience was not as great as we would have liked. We take bad reviews very seriously, and we would like to ensure that your experience is better next time. We have followed up with our staff regarding your experience.

name: Gabrielle Anderson
text: The healthcare providers at MainStreet helped me out with my work physical exam and paperwork. They were very friendly and reasonavly priced. Thanks for a great visit!

name: Brother Smitty
text: Very nice staff. Little bit of a wait.

name: Jaicenta
text: Very great staff!! polite ,friendly, and take care of your needs properly.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing Jaicenta! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Tabitha Grace
text: Do not use them! Came in 2 hours before closing and was rudely informed that it was 2 hour wait. Then the nurse came out and said did you tell them about the wait. An urgent care facility with zero compassion!! I left because I did not want people like that to treat my son. It was ridiculous!

name: Channing Cope
text: What type of COVID test is done here? Is it PCR Nasal Swab test?

name: Tiffany Gillerlain
text: The staff does not get enough credit for what they are going through during Covid. I witnessed all the staff members going above and beyond while I was there.

name: Brittany Gray
text: This pplace turned away my 6 month old more than once when she was sick don't go here

name: Jennifer Thomason
text: I haven't been there but what is the point of having a written referral from my childs actual dr for insurance? If I could get that I would take them there. Can you please explain this to me?

resp.text:
Hi Jennifer,

Trust us, we wish we didn't have to jump through such hoops too! While Medicaid and AllKids recently eliminated this requirement, certain BCBS plans require that we submit this referral before they'll pay for the services we provided. Thankfully, you have 48 hours after the visit to get this referral, so you can get the care you need, when you need it, and let us help get the paperwork finished afterwards! Thanks again for reaching out!

name: Megan Morgan
text: I have tried this place three times and each time, I have had an awful experience. They treat me like I am an inconvenience to them, but they sure don’t mind taking my money. They act like they do not care at all. I do not recommend!

resp.text:
Hi Megan,

Thank you for sharing, and we are sorry your experience was not satisfactory. We'd love the opportunity to follow up with our staff and improve. If you could, email us at info@mainstreetfamilycare.com and let us know any specific details about your visit, and how you feel we could make this right! Thank you again for reaching out.

name: Haleigh Parker
text: Okay so as with KidsStreet I was skeptical. I read bad review after bad review. So I originally didnt want to go. We went with myself and my daughter. They took the time to listen to all of my symptoms. My doctors office couldnt get me in and gave me something that made me sick . the staff at main street listened to everything i had to say . paid attention to my medicine allergies. They were able to get to the root of the problem and give me the medicines I needed to get better . As with kids street, I would definitely recommend main street. And I would go back if I needed to.

name: Hillary
text: Very clean and very fast! They get right to the point and I will definitely be using them again!!

resp.text: Thanks, Hillary! We're so glad we could help you heal and feel better. Thanks for choosing MainStreet Family Care!

name: Steph Andry-Wilkinson
text: From the moment we walked in we were treated with great care and concern. Kids Street made it very easy for my five-month-old to be seen since we were from out of town. We went to other facilities and walked out. This office is amazing  thanks for all your help !   P.s.   Excellent self-pay option I will highly recommend

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Steph! We're happy we could help your little one feel better fast!

name: Amber Morrison
text: Erica is sweet and patient with all the kids, especially when it's busy! I appreciate her kindness even when the waiting room is full :) Kaylan and Christopher are quick, efficient, and accurate when providing patient care. They really put the kids at ease.

resp.text: Thanks Amber!

name: Jonathan Morris
text: Don’t come here unless you want the most generic of care. Type A flu, and couldn’t even get a prescription of comfort meds because they don’t have an MD on staff. Waste of time and money, just go wait at the ER.

resp.text:
Hi Jonathan,

Thank you for reaching out. We're having our staff and management review your chart to see what we can do to help you feel better. We'll reach back out through our message thread on Facebook to keep you updated. Thank you again for reaching out with your concerns!

name: Diane Harris
text: Usually use another facility but decided to try this one since it was close to my home. Very nice and accommodating outer waiting room but after being placed in a room, the wait was too long! My daughter’s regular doctor and my usually urgent care  is 1/2 the wait time. The outer lobby did not have any patients so I expected to be seen more quickly. Total time: 2 hours 30 minutes!

resp.text:
Hi Diane,

We're sorry your experience was not satisfactory! Our goal is to always get our patients in and out within an hour. We are reviewing your chart so we can follow up with staff to see why your visit took so long. Since we are still new there in Mobile, I'm sure they're working out some kinks to make everything go a bit quicker. We hope we will have another opportunity to help you and your family feel better fast! Thank you for reaching out and for choosing KidsStreet Urgent Care!

name: Michael Looney
text: I'm not really one to post negative reviews like this but I wanted to share the experience I just  had. I was skating at the skating rink (thinking I was alot younger than I actually am), fell extremely hard and landed on my finger.  I came to this urgent care at 8:40 p.m and the website and sign said they were open until 9:00. All of the lights and signs were turned off when I walked up to the door. Although the lady at the desk initially saw me I stood out there for several minutes. Finally she came out and said they saw their last patient at 8:30. I told her that I just needed someone to look at my finger to tell me if it was definitely broken and she said they couldn't do it. Honestly I just want her to read this so that she knows how much she let me down.

resp.text:
Hi Michael,

I am so sorry for your negative experience and we will certainly be following up with our staff and take appropriate disciplinary action. Our company policy is that we accept patients all the way up to closing time and we do not have a cut off time. If you experience this in the future you can immediately contact the corporate office at 205-545-5090 or reach the clinic manager’s cell by calling the local clinic, pressing option 4, and then option 2. Thank you for alerting us to this issue!

name: Roslyn's Dad
text: Nice waiting room free refreshments, friendly staff. The wait was a little too long only because the computer was acting up and the doctor didn't do to much when I was seen only talk, but overall good experience minus the wait and a little more intent on explaining medical issues to people such as causes, treatment, and etc. Would recommend if not for a serious concern of health

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback Roslyn!

name: David MCclendon
text: Just seen one of your cars at Walgreen's on McGregor and airport blvd. Parked in a handicap spot with two children in the car. The one child was not in a booster seat and the driver was holding the newborn baby in her lap while driving and no one was wearing a seat belt.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention David. We have addressed this with the employee in question.

name: Erica Johnson-Arrington
text: The Staff at Main Street Urgent care is phenomenal. Amber Morrison-CRNP take time with each patient to provide optimum care. She's awesome and very suitable for her position. Rachel Dargan is Awesome! she is very kind and gives excellent advice. Rachel Carter-CRNP is an awesome provider. She gives wonderful health management advice & has a great approach! Christopher C. , Kaylan Short, Brittney, Spring, and Victoria are the best MAs any clinic could ever ask for. Despite what the patient count is  they are sure to take care of each patient fully and is the ideal Medical Assistants.

resp.text: Thanks Erica!

name: Tashia Bridges
text: Great customer service

name: Ashley Lassiter
text: Dr. Johnston and her staff were phenomenal. In and out in under an hour. Incredibly professional yet friendly. Only using Main Street from now on.

resp.text: That’s a BOOM! Thank you for sharing Ashley! So glad we could help!

name: Kimberly Theresa
text: Fantastic service. The staff is truly amazing. The waiting area is perfect.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing Kimberly!

name: Conrad Bates
text: Sitting here now.  There was one patient before me.  Been sitting here for 45 minutes and still not called back.

resp.text:
Hi Conrad,
Thank you for sharing your feedback with us! We’re sorry to hear you had a negative experience, and we’ll certainly follow up with our staff. We always strive to get our patients in and out in under an hour, but I know with cold and flu season upon us, it can increase wait times a bit. Thank you again for bringing this to our attention and don’t hesitate to reach out if you have any additional feedback!

name: Scott Mckissick
text: Don't let applicants know whether they got the job or not, which resulted in loosing another job offer. Terriable unprofessional.

resp.text: Mr. McKissick, we are trying to locate your application. Would you have applied with another name? We accept all applications through our website, and we have several that apply. Once you go through our extensive interview process and a decision is made we always notify our applicants with our decision.

name: Shayla Thurman
text: Didn’t even get a chance to go in the office. Just calling and asking a question the phone experience made me go to another urgent care. Rude staff.

resp.text: Hi Shayla! Thank you for letting us know about your experience! That is certainly not the level of patient care that we expect from our staff and we’d like to follow up. Can you tell me what date and time you called so that we can follow up?

name: Jacob Huff
text: great place

resp.text: Thanks Jacob! We appreciate you choosing MainStreet!

name: Emile Hughes
text: Great facility!!
